postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2018
reviewBody: This monitor is definitely a good value. Does it have superb color and contrast? No. Does it boast the best refresh rate on the market? No. But if you're tight on money, this thing looks and preforms great for the money. It has a Matte screen which does a great job at eliminating glare. The chassis it's enclosed within is absolutely stunning. It features a VGA and and HDMI port. The screen automatically detects signals and turns on when a source is turned on. When the selected source turns off it quickly scans and switches to any other sources. If no connections are available it goes into standby automatically. The power chord is a good 6 or more feet and easy to wrap with half of it being very thin wire. The ON LED is not distracting or too bright. When it's off it looks like a borderless monitor. And unlike what other people say it does have tilt, just not forward or left to right. It stands up straight or leans back. Unfortunately it doesn't have VESA mount holes, but under 100 you can't be that serious about your monitor setup. Small text has some problems fully rendering when using VGA so I recommend using HDMI. If you use the Windows 10 settings to configure how text is displayed though it fixes this, but not all will know how to do that. It doesn't have speaker, and I am thankful that most monitors don't. This monitor has A LOT of settings for gaming, night use, color adjustments, and general settings and all can be saved into 3 different gaming profiles. You can even change what settings appear in the quick menu. When u press any of the menu buttons, the menu pops up and clearly illustrates all the buttons. This monitors menus are super easy to understand and navigate and that's a rarity in its own. Also worth noting; it can display crosshairs and display the monitors current refresh rate. It also packs FreeSync for AMD graphics card users. If you only have DVI, you can get DVI to HDMI chords as long as your computer's video out supports it. The base and monitor couple together with one screw that features a hand flap so you don't need a screw diver if you don't want to use one. It is decently sturdy and the screen doesn't distort even when pressed on with strong pressure. The base is quite large, but wont be a problem for most. I haven't noticed any screen delay compared to my 300 dollar 1ms response time monitor (and I'm pretty picky). It's contrast is a little flat in some scenarios but appears much more dynamic in games, especially with some tweaking. With that said, I like that it looks flat when working on documents because it makes it much easier to focus.All in all, this monitor is filled with a good balance of features and looks like a very solid 1080p 75Hz IPS screen for any monitor under $160, let alone the $80 I paid. If you don't absolutely need a better refresh rate and aren't planning on spending more than 200 dollars then I would say just buy this monitor. It's durable, feature packed, and looks fantastic in all use-case scenarios. I'd give it 1000 stars if I could.
reviewTitle: Absolutely Amazing Value - Some other features not even listed!
name: Joshua Rhine

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2018
reviewBody: I've seen many other reviews saying this monitor does not tilt, but it in fact does. I'm guessing people didn't take a close enough look at the hinge mechanism in the base, which attaches to the main display and allows for backwards tilt of approximately 15 degrees. The monitor is very light, thin, has small bezels, and produces reasonably good colors. It doesn't have a vesa mount, but I knew that before purchasing it, and wasn't planning to mount it. For $89, it is a great value.
name: Seth

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2018
reviewBody: Aside from my computer and PS4, this is probably one of the best things I've ever purchased. I use it every single day without error and everything always looks amazing. I'm a broke college kid and really needed something sufficient for PS4, homework, movies, everything really. I was torn between this and the HP pavilion and I have no regrets from picking this one! The screen is definitely big enough (perfect for having multiple pages open for homework) and is insanely vibrant and good quality for the price. I have absolutely no complaints, and even with a horrible $2 thunderbolt to HDMI cable for my Mac, it still looks absolutely amazing.
reviewTitle: Probably one of the best purchases I've ever made.
name: Gergly

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2017
reviewBody: I bought two of these and enjoy them quite a bit. A few reviews complain about ghosting, which I experienced until I realized in the default settings on the monitors had "overdrive" or "OD" on. As long as you disable this feature you will no longer have ghosting trouble! Hope this helps anyone who bought these and was disappointed, I saw nothing online about fixing this issue other than figuring it out myself by chance.
name: Rayna

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2018
reviewBody: I just got this monitor few days ago and setting up literally took a minute. Colors are so vibrant and bright. Darks are good and brights are rich. I work in a IT field and I’ve seen and used a lot of monitors, this is by far the best I’ve used till date. I’ve only used vga and it’s already better than using hdmi in most of the monitors. I can only imagine what it would be after using with an hdmi cable. Its a steal for the price I got.
reviewTitle: Probably the best monitor I’ve seen till now.
name: Sam A

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2018
reviewBody: I very rarely write reviews, but am so disappointed with this monitor, that I felt the need to warn others. Originally bought this last year to use for school and work. After a few weeks, started having issues with it turning off and repeatedly blinking in mid-use, as well as dead pixels in the middle of the screen. Contacted Amazon, and they sent a replacement and I returned the original. Again, a few weeks of perfect operation. Then on the replacement unit, the power and menu buttons stopped working. The only way to turn on and off was to physically unplug the unit. Contacted Amazon again, and they referred me to the manufacturer. After several attempts, I finally got a hold of a person. They said they would look at, but I would have to ship it back on my own dime, and they would not replace it. I declined (mostly because I didn't have a box to pack it in, and was severely unimpressed with customer service).So I continued using it for several months with few issues. I stopped using it earlier this year, mostly because I got tired of the physical unplugging, and started using an old TV instead. Just now, went to fire it up again for my wife to use. After not touching or using it for the last few months, the screen is cracked in the middle, and as far as I'm concerned is unusable. And no, this is not a case of "oops I dropped it and now I'm going to blame the hardware." I have other Acer electronics, and have been for the most part satisfied, but this monitor has been nothing but problems. Would rate less than 1 star if possible.
name: George M McColgan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2018
reviewBody: I am somewhat satisfied with my purchase. The price was great, and looks great too. Easy to assemble. Came with vga and power cord. Colors look amazing, no annoying power indicator lights. The options menu is very easy to navigate. I didn't want to do this, but I had to dock a star as it lacked the ability to tilt. It's at a permanent position so I'm gonna have to stack an extra book below to go the position I want. Otherwise, 10/10
name: Henry

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2018
reviewBody: Read over the reviews at least 10 times weighing the pros and cons but I decided to go for it and I'm glad that I did! Like others stated, it took maybe 5-6 minutes to unpack and get up and running. I wanted a larger screen to use when I work from home as my 10 inch laptop keeps me squinting and bending over. The monitor is SUPER lightweight and very sleek. It comes with the VGA cord but no HDMI cord, luckily I have several laying around the house. I did have to prop it up a bit in the front since there is no tilt option, but that wasn't a deal breaker for me. I use this for basic internet and word processing, no gaming or watching movies and it's been working great for me!
name: kierysma

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2018
reviewBody: This is a basic, no frills, monitor with a beautiful picture & well deserved reputation for lasting a long time. No built in speaker, get a different model if that is what you want. Not for the novice, as the only usable instruction is "turn off computer before installing". There are 5 buttons on the bottom edge of the monitor, but pictograms are useless. But, don't worry; after you make all connections & power up the computer & monitor, the monitor checks connections & automatically picks the correct settings for you. If you have an HDMI connection on your computer (preferably on the back panel), use that instead of the VGA cable to get the best quality picture. (You must supply the cable.)
reviewTitle: Great quality screen for the money
name: N. Myers

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2018
reviewBody: You can't really expect much from a monitor that is less than $100, but this is a great monitor for everyday use. The only reason I give it 4 our of 5 stars is because there is no way to mount this on a wall or versa mount. Other than that, great clarity, color and size for the price point. I will be finding a way to mount this on my versa mount as looking down on a monitor is not conducive to prolonged use.
name: Edward Castro

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2018
reviewBody: Every now and again my screen blacks out, but just for a moment, less than a second, (think screenshot on your phone) and it's really weirding me out. It happens in irregular inconsistent intervals, sometimes days in between, sometimes only 5 minutes apart. I changed all the cables and adapters, I wrote back in Sept/Oct for a replacement but Amazon redirected me to the manufacturer. I sent the monitor to the Acer support center, and they sent me back the monitor with the diagnostic was no observed issues. So I bought this monitor to have an upgrade but wasn't a good choice.And here I'm with an annoying black flashing screen
name: Yohi

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2018
reviewBody: This monitor is perfect. It has really good image quality, it has incredible black tones, and super quick response time. The size is the only thing that bothers me, but I would definitely buy another one of these monitors to have two displays. Believe me when I say that it is a really good monitor.
name: Leandro

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2018
reviewBody: I’ll start this off by saying the screen looks great and the visual quality is top notch. However when I received the monitor it only worked for about 2 days. Then every time I turned it on it started restarting over and over every 2 seconds. So I contacted the manufacturer and they decided I should send it to their repair facility and I had to pay for the $80 shipping (wouldn’t have been that big of a deal if they had actually fixed it). About 2 weeks goes by and they returned the exact same monitor to me with a note saying they could not duplicate the issue and that they turn it on and off a bunch of times to make sure it worked properly. I knew exactly what was about to happen as I put it together and plugged it into the wall. Sure enough, it started cycling on and off immediately. Changed outlets, jiggled the power cord and unplugged and replugged them in and nothing changed. “Could not duplicate cust reported issue” pretty convinced they never even took it out of the box. Video is after it was sent back from the repair facility. The photo is their comment after “testing it”
reviewTitle: Manufacturer has poor customer support for defective product
name: Dan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2018
reviewBody: MONITOR SAYS INPUT NOT SUPPORTED. I am using a HDMI cable and it will not support the input for some reason. I have changed HDMI cables thinking maybe I have a bad cable and I got the same message with a known good cable. I would not recommend this purchase until the resolved the problem. Same pc is using the same HDMI on a television and runs flawlessly
name: Colt

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2016
reviewBody: This is a very good monitor for its price! I upgraded from a previous monitor that came with my Dell Inspiron that had Windows Vista LOL!. Very Old. Anyways my reason for upgrading:1) Using it as an external monitor for my macbook pro for college work.2) It connects to my xbox one s very nicely. Battlefield 1 and titan fall 2 looks awesome in this (in my opinion)BEFORE YOU BUY YOU MUST KNOW:1) the monitor does not tilt up or down.2) monitor does not rise in height and visa versa.3) the monitor does no rotateTo me this isn't a problem since my monitor is sitting on a monitor riser. However, if you are nit picky about this type of stuff, i recommend you look else where and compare!OVERALL THOUGHTS:1) set up is very easy! can be done in 5 minutes. Simply connect the circle base to the back of the monitor screen and you are done!Its a awesome monitor for its price!!
reviewTitle: VERY GOOD MONITOR FOR ITS PRICE AND NO BACK LIGHT BLEEDING!!!!
name: Jonathan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2018
reviewBody: I purchased for my custom pc and dont have much money for an expensive monitor but this one is really makes it hard to consider other monitors for the price. The picture quality is very good even with VGA. I'm upgrading to a displayport to hdmi to see if that's even better. There are no speakers but there are adapters you can order that have audio jack port to install speakers or headphones. Highly recommend this monitor for anyone. Updated: I had trouble installing the base but got help from acer support who in the same process registered my product. I attached a picture of the base where you should place the metal plate. It may be obvious to place for some, but there were no instructions included
name: Robert Corzine

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2018
reviewBody: The monitor blinks on and off. I've looked online, and apparently this is a common problem with Acer monitors. I've had one of theirs before, it didn't have this problem, but this one does. It might be cheap, but when it doesn't work, it's still a waste.
name: Jim

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2015
reviewBody: I bought two of these monitors a few weeks ago and they've been pretty great so far (aside from one issue which is described below).The best part in my opinion is the the thin bezel which is accurately depicted in the pictures above. In case anyone was wondering, the bezel (including the part of the screen that doesn't display any picture) is about 1/4" (7/32" to be precise).I was worried about the base not being stable when I bought the monitors, but the monitors are actually surprisingly stable.The main reason I'm writing this review is to warn people about the backlight bleeding that is present on both of the monitors I received. The pattern of the backlight bleeding is exactly the same on both of the monitors, which leads me to believe that I didn't just get unlucky. Under normal circumstances, the image quality is great. However, if there's a dark image on the screen and I'm in a dark room (when watching a movie for example), the backlight bleeding is very apparent on the two upper corners of the screens. This isn't a huge issue for me since I usually have a light on in the room, but I'm sure it might bother some people. This seems like a pretty common issue on budget IPS monitors, so I wouldn't rule this monitor out unless you find a monitor that you know for sure doesn't have this same issue.
reviewTitle: Great monitor, but has a flaw
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018
reviewBody: This is a great budget monitor. I was amazed by the quality of the screen and color display. I’m using this for both my MacBook Pro and Xbox one and I couldn’t not be any happier. Don’t know why people in these reviews are docking points for “not having a vesa mount” or “not including and adapter for Mac”. The description of the item easily tells you that before you buy this item. Why judge this monitor off of something it didn’t even advertise?
name: Manpreet K.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2017
reviewBody: Great value for 1080 monitor.Clear pictureSimple simple assembly (or taking it apart)Strong baseWorks beautifully with MacBook AirREVISED AND WARNING FOR MACBOOK PRO 2017 USERS:The monitor, which worked beautifully with a MacBook Air, does NOT work with a MacBook Pro 2017. Acer must service it with a firmware update. You have to send the monitor back to them. Buyer beware.
reviewTitle: Great monitor and value! NOT FOR MACBOOK PRO 2017 without hassle.
name: Morris Massel

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2018
reviewBody: screen shut down randomly after using 1 month. i have to reboot every time.
name: Tim

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2018
reviewBody: I purchased this monitor to replace a several years old, but nice Dell model. The build on this one feels light and cheap, but then it was 1/4th the cost of the previous monitor, and a monitor does not really have to put up with a lot of stress. I use it for work (browsing, reading, some graphics) and a little personal (video), but not gaming or anything intensive so cannot speak to that. What I did learn is that the input for video matters, a lot. Initially I connected the monitor using my current VGA cable (one reason I chose this particular monitor). The picture was fine, but I discovered that it did a poor job with any photo/video with dark tones. In a darker or shadowy picture, all detail was lost (the image looks almost black in some cases). This could not be remedied by adjusting contrast, etc. It was bad enough that I decided to shop around until I found an alternative monitor, at about double the cost. Just before initiating the return, on a whim, I changed the input to HDMI. I figured this was more about HD video quality, etc. But as soon as I made the switch, everything got better. Suddenly photos looked perfect, problem solved. This monitor does not come with an HDMI cable, so if you don't have one, I recommend purchasing one in addition. The only other thing that is worth knowing is that, as mentioned in the description, this monitor cannot be tilted. Because the base is round, propping it up is unstable. For me, its fine, I have it tilted up, and it sits on the desk. It would wobble at a bump, but its not really ever getting bumped.
name: Joe

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2018
reviewBody: It’s a nice product especially considering the price. But please be aware it does not come with HDMI cable, if you do not have one, better order one together with this Monitor.
name: AllenYoung

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2018
reviewBody: You honestly can't beat that price. 89 USD. There is a gaming variant for 10 more, but really I feel it's nearly identical.
reviewTitle: You honestly can't beat that price. 89 USD. ...
name: Terrance Earle

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2019
reviewBody: Nice enough screen and a good price, but …* Contrary to several reader reviews and comments here, Acer confirms for me that the screen doesn't tilt, even a little. Unfortunate, since I bought this on the assumption it would. NOTE: The detailed manual for this screen (which does not ship with the screen; you have to download it from the Amazon or Acer websites) says it DOES tilt, but that manual (which is dated 2016) clearly doesn't reflect the product shipping in 2019.* Contrary to some posts here (and to the manual, which says they are "optional"—not "available separately," which would be clearer), the screen does not ship with an HDMI or audio cable.* The menu options for this are bewilderingly complex (download the manual) and not easy to navigate with the under-screen controls.Buyer beware. I returned mine to Amazon.
reviewTitle: Poor interface, outdated manual and DOES NOT TILT
name: Charles Meyerson

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2018
reviewBody: The actual quality of the monitor is good, but the monitor itself has some issues with certain motherboards and/or GPUs. The monitor refuses to show the BIOS menu. (The menu actually loads but the monitor will display "input not supported" for the entire time, making it useless if you have to change one of those settings), but it works perfectly once the operating system reaches the login screen. I had to plug my computer into my TV to view the bios screen, and that worked, so I know that it's a monitor issue. Called up ACER support, said there was nothing they could do.
reviewTitle: Has a major Input / BIOS issue, support didn't help
name: Faysal

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2018
reviewBody: I bought two of these monitors and I am extremely impressed. 1080P + IPS + 75Hz + FreeSync + Thin + Narrow bezels at this price is awesome.1080P at 21.5" has a nice pixel density. Text is very crisp and sharp. Picture Quality wasn't bad out of the box but after some tweaking its looking great!75Hz refresh rate is still a NOTICEABLE improvement over 60Hz. This also costs far less than say a 144Hz monitor. Really a great gaming monitor if you are on a budget. I've only played some Quake Live on it thus far but I really don't notice any input lag or ghosting.FreeSync support - I am not using an AMD graphics card so I can't comment -- but its nice to have and ultimately is why this has a 75Hz refresh rate so no complaints :-)The monitor is impressively thin and having VGA and HDMI is great. No DisplayPort, but I wouldn't expect that on a monitor at this price point.I knocked off a star because I REALLY wish these had VESA mounting. I'm using two of these in a dual monitor setup and having VESA would be great to not only elevate them but also the monitors don't exactly line-up because you get a little bit of variation in tilt with the cheap plastic stands.
name: Printers fP

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2018
reviewBody: Henry wrote in his August 2018 review that this monitor has no tilt.Mine does., don't know why his doesn't. I almost didn't buy this monitor because of that but all of its other features at a very good price convinced me to do otherwise.I have seven computers (incl. 1 laptop) and I'll say, without reservation, this is the best monitor in the house.Lightweight, thin as thin can get and outstanding picture quality.My photographs never looked better.Again, Perfect!
name: Gil Miller

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2019
reviewBody: I like this product very much
reviewTitle: it is very thin and you need to be carful setting it up
name: Chase g

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2019
reviewBody: This monitor is complete garbage. It worked for all of about a month. Then the problems began. The monitor would "blank" out, a black screen replacing it. At first, I thought it was the VGA cable. So, I purchased a new one. That didn't fix the problem. So, I replaced the dongle (the next "cheap" thing to replace). It came back on, but only to have the screen go green. Upset that the color was completely off, I fiddled with the cables a bit, hopeful that the color would come back. Instead, the screen went black once more... and so it has remained regardless of which new wires I try to replace (VGA and HDMI), dongles, etc. Nothing brings this piece of garbage monitor back online.Don't waste your money, folks. This one is definitely a dud.
name: Fraggle

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2019
reviewBody: The monitor was beautiful at first, but the problems quickly arose within 24 hours of minimal use. A common theme among the 1-star reviews is the monitor "blacking out"; that is in fact true. My monitor began to go black randomly without reason and then the resolution also become distorted to the point of looking like playing an Atari video game from 1983. I used two different HDMI cords on a brand new HP laptop.The physical design of the monitor is sleek and attractive; unfortunately that concludes any positives. I was tempted to replace, but after reading that many other users experienced the same issue, I have opted for a return and will search for a different brand.
name: AKhan25

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2018
reviewBody: At this point, I'm giving this 5-stars based on the 27" screen that will be so incredible when I have multiple windows open and the color. I have hundreds of NASA photos on my desktop and it feels as if I'm approaching a nebula the color and definition is so extraordinary. However, attaching the base arm to the monitor was no simple feat. After calling Acer and finally get past the obnoxious auto-responder, an agent instructed me how to go online (via my cell phone) to get the manual. Yeah, Acer doesn't put the actual manual in the package, just the Quick Guide which states that the monitor should be removed from its packaging carefully since the base is attached. Then, what am I holding? Kinda looks like a base to me. Attaching the arm to the base - piece of cake. But getting the arm into the bottom of the monitor, ah, not so much. When I got on the Acer website, following the agent's instructions, I was unable to find a manual - just the legal agreement. Time to do a Google search, which lead me to a YouTube video where the man took a flat screwdriver and snapped a piece of plastic off his R271 monitor to get the arm into the slot. Okay. So, before I've even had a chance to plug this puppy in, I have to break it. Sure, makes sense to me. But, it worked. I managed to fit the base arm into the monitor slot and the monitor isn't wobbling now.I like Acer products - they've been around for decades. Have no complaints with my Acer PC and this monitor (so far) seems to be of very good quality. But really, no instructions? Come on. Even Pop Tarts come with instructions.
reviewTitle: Hook-up to the base was exasperating.
name: Honey Badger

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2018
reviewBody: I installed the monitor only to discover a vertical line running from top to bottom on the screen. At first I thought it was a setting but after trying all of the settings I decided to hook up the monitor to a different PC to see if it was a hardware issue, but the line was still present. I contacted Amazon support who was extremely helpful but all they could do was refer me to Acer. Unfortunately, the contact info Amazon gave me for Acer is completely out of date. The repair locations no longer exist and the Acer support number was invalid, I'm not sure why Amazon doesn't verify material like this with its vendors.I found the Acer support number online and called them. After having to repeat the serial number through their automated system, I was finally able to tslk to a person who again asked for the serial number to verify the warranty. After that I was put through a bunch of inane personal questions (full name, address, phone number, etc.) not relevant to the issue, since he had already verified it was under warranty. In the end, all they needed was an email address to email me the warranty repair address so I can ship the monitor back at MY expense. Needless to say this will be the LAST Acer product I buy. I understand that products fail occasionally but putting customers through unnecessary red tape and then forcing me to pay for the shipping on a item under warranty makes it clear this is not a company I want to do business with.
name: Pete H.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2019
reviewBody: This was a great price, I loved that it was thin and lightweight, and I was happy to see it had great reviews. But sadly I was one of the few who had issues with it randomly shutting down or disconnecting. If you read the 1-star reviews, you'll see this pattern. It would work for awhile, then suddenly disconnect completely. Other times I couldn't get it to come up at all. I tried two different HDMI cables as well as a VGA cable, I tried it with two different laptops, my Lenovo from work and my personal Dell. But same thing over and over. I returned the first one to Amazon thinking it was defective. Tried the replacement one with all 3 cables and both laptops again, and same thing. Had my tech-saavy spouse try both monitors to make sure I wasn't missing anything. But alas, we couldn't identify the issue. Not sure why this seems to happen for some people and not for everyone. Will have to try something else. Bummer. The times it did work, it had a decent image and was the perfect size and weight.
name: G & K

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
reviewBody: I have been using this monitor every day for about 8 months now so I feel I can write an honest review. I work from home and have it connected to my laptop as my main monitor, the laptop screen being my secondary. First things first: so easy to set up. I bought a 3' HDMI cord and it was 1.2.3... and I was all ready to work. I am a landscape architect so I do a lot of graphics and CAD work and this is perfect for that. I do the drawings/work on this monitor and keep my toolbars open on the laptop screen. It is easy to pack up and move, this was important to me as I am a nomad and frequently am setting up my "office" in new locations. I love the tilt feature, I can adjust the screen for if I am sitting or standing, granted it's not just a "push to tilt" feature, you actually have to loosen the mechanism underneath and readjust. I find the color, brightness, and resolution to be more than adequate for the work I am doing, especially for the price! Maybe if you are gaming or watching movies this might not be good enough (??? I don't actually know because I do neither of those things on this monitor) but for quite literally everything else, it is wonderful. I am considering purchasing a second and using my desktop more than my laptop with a dual set up. Highly recommend.
name: Kaley Dunlap

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2018
reviewBody: This is a great monitor. Smooth, thin, good color. But its NOISY with RF. I bought this to use with my Raspberry Pi, because it has an HDMI input. The input works fine and the raspberry has no issues with it. My only problem is, I got this to use next to my ham radio, and on 7mhz band it makes a little static on the band, not too bad. On 14mhz it makes a LOT of static. Almost to the point that I have to turn it off. On the 3.9mhz section it has several "birdies" that it produces - loud eeeeeeeeeee tones that switch off when the screen is off. The power cord is shielded so it has to be somehting inside the screen I cant shield. So, good monitor but if it is near your radio, you will have to turn it off.
reviewTitle: Nice monitor, NOISY on RF. Works great with Raspberry.
name: theosus

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
reviewBody: First things first: please treat this review as a "3.5 star", which is what I would rate it if Amazon allowed me to.My main issue with this screen is that it has to be the sorriest excuse of an IPS/AHVA/PLS panel I've ever seen. The viewing angles are actually so bad for left/right that there is only a very small position where I can leave my head so that there is no discolouration on the sides, worse than any TN panel I've ever seen. Also, it looks like there is a lot of excess light directly off center to your head's position, as if there is backlight bleed that shifts as you move your head left and right while staring at the screen.Since this was purchased to be my second monitor, it isn't that big of a problem to ME specifically... but it also means it's impossible to keep my head in the perfect position, due to it being off-center to me. I actually had to tilt the screen somewhat sideways (instead of being flush next to my main monitor) so that the sides would mostly look normal in terms of colour.Now I WILL admit that it is possible this is a defect with my actual screen, possibly some problem with backlight bleed or something, but since this is my only sample size, I must rate it accordingly. If Acer has a problem with my statements, they should step up their quality control game and not let a monitor like this pass inspection for sale.Now, the good! For a breakdown, I've rated this a 4/5 for gaming, 3/5 for picture quality, and 5/5 for brightness, here's my take on each:- The input lag is quite low; there is no system lag while working on it. Being above 60Hz also gives it a solid edge for gamers. Gamers generally care less about viewing angle issues like what I described, so as a gaming screen this should not be too bad. Unfortunately I still cannot ignore the viewing angle problem due to how bad it is, and I will never rate any screen below 120Hz as 5 stars for gaming, so it settles at 4.- Picture quality is actually quite good. The contrast is great and the colours very crisp - if the viewing angles and backlight shenanigans were a non-issue i would probably even rate this 5 stars (largely considering the price), but alas, 3 stars.- For brightness, it's certainly bright enough for my needs, though I've not used it in direct sunlight. The anti-glare works well and it keeps its picture quality and visibility perfectly fine even with a flashlight shone at it. I cannot ask for more, so full marks here.All in all, for $90 I cannot truly complain. It does its job of being a screen for discord, watching videos/anime, and handling my stream alerts/notifications. It's light and easy to set up, the on/standby light is not bright yet still well visible, so not distracting in a dark room. Unfortunately viewing angle issue and discolouration it produces ALONE is enough for me to say consider other options, but the rest of the screen pulls it up a bit.If this is going to be your main monitor, and you are not someone who does little but game on your computer? Stay far away. If you need a cheap, decent screen for gaming or this is going to be a low-importance second monitor? I'd say it's up for consideration, if only because it's 75Hz at this price point.
reviewTitle: Good for the price, but probably better options
name: D2ultima

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2019
reviewBody: I bet you didn't expect to see a review with this type of usage of the monitor, did you. I built a zombie containment unit for Halloween a few years ago in which it used a monitor to give the illusion a zombie was trapped inside the unit. I used a very cheap monitor in the past and found that it looked okay when looking straight on at it, but any angle from the sides or from the bottom would wash out the image and the illusion was broken. Given that the "window" was about 5 and a half feet from the ground, anyone shorter couldn't view the video.So, I found that I needed a type of monitor that had wide viewing angles so you can see it from off angles instead of just straight on. This monitor has an IPS board that allowed for these sharper viewing angles.Here are some things that I looked for when researching a monitor to buy:* Largest monitor I could buy for under $100 USD* Lightweight as it would be hung on the inside of the "unit"* Bright/vivid video* Sharp viewing angles without loss of image quality* at least 22" diagonal width. The previous monitor was only 15" so I wanted to get a larger size for more realistic size "zombiie" within.This monitor checked off all the boxes. I also had a $15 Amazon gift card which softened the hit to the wallet.Once received, I hooked up the power cord and an HDMI cable that went to a small digital video player that had a memory card which played the trapped zombie clip. I didn't attach the base as doing so would not allow me to mount the monitor inside the cabinet. This isn't a Halloween prop build video so any details of the unit is limited to the monitor itself.I used a felt material inside the cabinet along the edges where the front of the monitor would be in contact with to protect the screen as this is a bezel-less screen on the top and sides. I didn't want any scratches! No bezels was the only real drawback to the monitor. Funny to think that as any other use would welcome no bezels.Anyway, the clip I uploaded is the monitor integrated within the cabinet. I'm really happy with how it turned out and having this monitor has really took this prop a notch up.Overall, I recommend this monitor if you are looking for a monitor with sharp viewing angles. Colors are good, no dead pixels on my screen and the price was right for the size. Other than how I use it, I can't say much more.
reviewTitle: Used In My Zombie Containment Unit for Halloween
name: MegaByte

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2018
reviewBody: I ordered this monitor specifically because I thought, "Great! A monitor with built in speakers. Now I wont need to buy speakers immediately for my new computer." However, to my dismay, I apparently selected the monitor WITHOUT the OPTIONAL audio cable. So now I need to go to the store and find an audio cable (or speakers), as well as a different HDMI cable as I just took the one from one of my game systems to function in place of the cable the monitor came with (the basic cable it DID come with will not function with my desktop).Other than that I like the monitor. Its nice an bigger than anything I've ever had. Certainly does the trick. I'll update my review once I go out and buy an audio cable and get to experience the audio quality. JUST BE CAREFUL WHICH OPTION YOU PURCHASE. I don't see why they wouldn't include an audio cable with every monitor...UPDATE:After going to the store to get an audio cable and messing with this for more than 30 minutes thinking it was possibly something I was doing wrong, I now realize that I was sent a monitor that DOES NOT have speakers. It seems that now I must go BACK to the store to buy SEPARATE SPEAKERS. I normally would not get this worked up over a mistake made when making an amazon purchase; however I literally only chose this monitor for the fact that it supposedly came with built in speakers. Again, be careful which version you get, as apparently I chose the wrong one and am now literally paying for it.
name: Gidley

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2019
reviewBody: I bought two of these for a dual monitor setup. Unfortunately there are no instructions on installing the base of the monitor. The "Quick Guide" states that "The monitor base is attached onto the monitor before shipment and it is undetachable." This is clearly false as nothing is attached to the monitor. Rather, there are two pieces included: A round base and a middle bracket. Attaching the middle bracket to the round base was easy to figure out. However, attaching the middle bracket to the monitor was not easy. On the first monitor, we tried different things and none worked. We then thought the base is 'pressure mounted' so we tried to push it straight into the back of the monitor, and that broke two plastic tabs on the brand new monitor! On the second monitor we were more careful. After a few more tries, we discovered that you need to angel the middle bracket into the back of the monitor and then lift up for it to attach. If you do it right, it will work easily and quickly. If you find yourself forcing it in, then you are doing it wrong! Acer could make this easier for its clients by including installation instructions.Other than the above, it's a nice monitor. I have a VGA and HDMI outputs on my computer so I used the VGA to connect to one and a 6 ft HDMI cable for the other monitor: TIP: If you need to use the HDMI port like I did, order the HDMI cable with the monitor as it is NOT included. They might have included it in the past as some of the reviews says it is included, but it sure was not included with the two monitors I ordered in Jan of 2019.Also, it seems there are two versions of this monitor: one with speakers and one without. The latter is more expensive. I choose the version without speakers as I already have external ones.
reviewTitle: Be careful attaching the base - no instructions!
name: Mike Nasser

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2019
reviewBody: I bought 2 about 2 years ago for my first gaming build as my side monitors. So far I've had to replace or buy new ones because all of the seem to have dying pixels, the screens start to flicker and are unusable. Acer makes you pay for return shipping to replace or fix the monitor. Which is ridiculous because it costs like 20-30$. But after getting pissed at them, they agreed to cover all shipping costs. I will be getting different brand monitors once these ones die out too.
reviewTitle: I have went through 5 monitors already
name: Davit Petrosyan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2018
reviewBody: I bought 2 of these monitors for a dual monitor set up. The buttons did not work on 1 of the monitors. I filed a complaint with acer and they advised I had to pay for the initial shipping to them, which was approximately $90 to pay UPS for packaging and ground shipping. Acer refused to reimburse me even though it was not my fault the monitor didn’t function properly. The cost to ship it to them was nearly the cost of buying a new monitor.
reviewTitle: Malfunctioning monitor and bad Acer Support
name: St6stringer1

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2017
reviewBody: Update 2020:It only lasted for exactly 3 years. Vertical black stripes came out of nowhere. I remember when they used to make more durable products. I will never again buy an ACER brand product as well as never again recommend someone to buy this brand. Don't waste your money.PROS- Great value for the money- Slim screen (6mm thick)- Nice image quality and colors- The screen does not get warm after a long use- No ghosting while playing gamesCONS- Besides it's 4ms response you can see ghosting when move the mouse against white background (web browse, read text on white background)- Uncomfortable monitor configuration menu- It show a little lack of homogeneity across the entire screen- It shows light leak when the monitor is totally blackBottom Line: My version came with minimal but perceptible light leak, cool tone on the bottom left and warm tone in the bottom right. Of course this is only seen when the screen is black but it's not a deal breaker, you will not perceive this when you normally use the monitor. In general this monitor is a good purchase.Update 1: After a few weeks of use I like this monitor but it does not have a true 178 viewing angle. If you sit in front of the screen there's is no problem but as soon you stand up you'll notice the degradé.
reviewTitle: Very nice screen for the price - See update review
name: Carlos D.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020
reviewBody: Needed a second monitor for my Dell computer. No paperwork inside box like a quick start guide. I ended up finding one online and it proved to be worthless in regards to problem solving. Hooked up monitor to my Dell via HDMI and nothing, monitor acts like nothing is connected and Windows on my Dell wont detect. Contacted Acer support CHAT and spent half an hour with them and they ended up being no help at all. They wanted to start a REPAIR order. I said "forget about it, I'll just send it back to Amazon and make damn sure I never buy another Acer product ever again."
reviewTitle: Out of the box refuses to connect to my monitor and Acer support worthless
name: hondast1100

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
reviewBody: First of all, this is a decent monitor for the price point. Does the job just fine for working from home.Be advised, the monitor ships with a VGA monitor cable as of October 2020. The VGA standard came out in 1987 and was replaced by DVI in 1999 which eventually led to the modern HDMI interface as the industry standard. Very few modern computers ship with a VGA port, almost all of them ship with HDMI. You will likely need to purchase a HDMI cable in addition to this monitor.
reviewTitle: Head's up before you buy this monitor for a modern computer
name: E Michael

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2019
reviewBody: Despite being a monitor, it did not work with my gaming pc at all. It kept switching off and the image wouldn't connect. I know it's the monitor's issue because after buying a different monitor from best buy, the pc worked great. I would say purchasing is risky.
name: Gigi

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2020
reviewBody: Like a lot of people, I'm now stuck working from home for the foreseeable future (at least a month). My old PC set up definitely needed some updating for day to day use, including my old Viewsonic 1080P monitors. At 7 years old, they were due for a refresh (and my eyes needed a break). I thought I could grab these Acers and update my workspace without breaking the bank, so I ordered 2 of them.They came quickly, which was good (they were actually available from Amazon Fresh for next day delivery). I installed one monitor and got it up and running, planning on doing the second one right after. However, a quick look at the 2 side by side, and it was clear that the brand new Acers were both dimmer and blurrier, with horrible color quality, compared to my ancient Viewsonics (see attached picture). Playing with the settings didn't help correct the issue.I didn't even bother installing the second one. I started a return request with Amazon and then boxed up the open one and took both to my local Kohls for free shipping back to Amazon.So, apparently, monitors are on of those things that you probably shouldn't cheap out on if you have to stare at them for 8 to 10 hours a day. I've learned my lesson and ponied up the cash for some 144hz IPS monitors instead. Hopefully, those will help prevent the eye strain headaches.
name: Michael Bishop

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
reviewBody: My laptop screen finally burned out and I needed a quick but still decent solution since a whole new computer is out of budget right now. Boy, did I luck out finding this! At 22" it's about a 5" upgrade from the original screen in roughly the same footprint on my desk. And wow is it SHARP... and BRIGHT! I can now sit back further from my desk without straining my eyes while editing photos, reading, and watching videos. Since I'm not a hardcore gamer I can't speak to its performance in that regard, except to say that emulated DOOM ran perfectly smooth and looked great on it :-DMy only real gripe is that the buttons for power, display settings, etc are located under the bottom edge of the screen, which is really inconvenient, and there's no labeling or anything on the front edge to correspond to which button is which, so until you learn the layout by muscle memory, you might have to do like i did and keep the diagram from the manual as a cheat sheet. Once you get into the menus, however, there are plenty of options to tweak to your heart's content. I really like that there's a "blue light" setting for working at night or when you just want to give your eyes a break (obviously, you wouldn't want this on if you're editing photos, but for reading it's fantastic). There's also a display widget for certain models that you can download from the Acer website that gives you point-and-click desktop access to some of these adjustments without having to use the monitor buttons. A nice touch, but it would be nice if ALL the features could be accessed through the widget as well.Setup is plug-and-play; I literally had this out of the box and ready to go within minutes (you will need to supply your own HDMI cable if you don't have one; only a VGA cable is included). Apparently some models have built-in audio; I can tell you that the SB220Q that I have does NOT have audio out, so you will need external speakers to run the sound from your system out to if that's an issue.VERY happy with this value monitor!
reviewTitle: Wish I had gotten this sooner!
name: Lotus1922

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021
reviewBody: First, NOT a gamer, and to put mildly, NOT into tech...at all. I'm turning 70 and haven't had to deal much with changing out monitors or desktops in some time. I just turn it on and expect it to work. I'm saying that so you can tell set up was so easy.My old monitor, that was inches smaller than the 21.5 (I got it over a decade ago) had been used over 11 years and was a floor model when I bought it! It was great, but could tell it's days were numbered.I stream movies, email, stuff like that. Just wanted a simple, inexpensive, but decent monitor and my very Tech (he is in charge of tech for a company) recommended this one.PICTURE QUALITY/CLARITY - For what I use for, GREAT. I can't speak to how it would be for gamers. Great for streaming movies.PRICE: It was on sale when I got it so it was a total of about 90 bucks with tax (I have Prime free ship)SET UP - OK the manual I found worthless. Yes, I can just follow the cables, but this monitor was a tad different than my old one. My nephew, in three sentences, over the phone, told me exactly what to do and it was super easy. I DID find it easier to put this monitor in my lap, do the plug ins, put the stand on, and then move to my desk where I connected to my computer rather than try to set it up on my computer table. Just to reach everything and this monitor is SO much thinner than my last one.I waited to write this review til I had it at least a couple weeks and, so far, very happy. If anything changes, I will DEFINITELY edit!BOTTOMLINE: Would get again.
reviewTitle: WHAT I GOT for and WHY I gave FIVE stars
name: pleinelune

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2018
reviewBody: Just got this acer monitor after not having anything to play on for a month.. And once i received it.. it doesn’t even work, everything is plugged in the blue light hasn’t even turn on yet.
name: Anvenity

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
reviewBody: So with the whole Covid thing and my work going online, I decided to buy this one based on the reviews. If I didn't use a Macbook and had a standard laptop that had a lower PPI, I wouldn't have noticed the difference. However, using a laptop with a "retina" display (around 220 PPI) and having this monitor next to it was comical. I felt like I was looking at an old tube TV or something. I immediately had to return it the next day.
reviewTitle: Not for use with a modern Macbook
name: Andy

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2020
reviewBody: Very disappointed with Acer! The manual says the package contents include a VGA cable, HDMI cable, power cable/adapter, DVI cable and an audio cable. Mine was missing THREE! There was no HDMI, no VGA, no audio cable. It's one thing if one cable is missing. But three missing cables says to me "junky company." The box did not appear to have been opened or re-taped.Also the setup manual is confusing. It says, for example, "The monitor base is attached onto the monitor before shipment and is undetachable." Completely not true! There are two pieces that make the base and they are bagged separately and you have to assemble it. It's not complicated but I checked the manual because you never know if there are little things to be aware of so you don't break any tabs or connectors. Lastly, I am not a fan of the big fat adapter for the power supply (but at least they didn't leave the power cords out of the box.) I would have preferred one power cord instead of a 2-parter with a fat adapter that plugs into the monitor and then a cord that plugs into the adapter. It makes cord management much harder and adds a lot of wires to my desk.The monitor seems to work OK out of the box. I hope it will hold up. This is my first ACER purchase and considering it is missing so many items, it will be my last.
reviewTitle: Missing Many Accessories, Manual Not Accurate
name: MTMNYC

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020
reviewBody: This monitor has no competition for quality of picture and price . I fully recommend it .However, I don't understand why ACER doesn't tell you that although the monitor has not speakers, Win10 thinks it does when it is connected via an HDMI cable. Therefore, don't be shocked that when you first hook it up, YOU HAVE NO SOUND.The fix is simple but not obvious . From the control panel , after selecting sound set up, you will see that the monitor is the default speaker ( even though the monitor has no speakers.). You will also notice that your external speaker are UNPLUGGED , although they are not. To fix the problem simply disable the default selection and your external speakers will be enabled and your sound is fixed. Why Acer didn't warn buyers of this weird problem ,I have not idea. That aside, this is a great deal.
reviewTitle: Amzaing monistor for the price but ...  need to fix an audio glitch to get sound.
name: M. Heath

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2018
reviewBody: I read a lot of reviews before I purchased. I have to agree the tilt is a little bit of a problem. like others I can sit it on a book and get it a little higher. Very clear picture. I hooked to my laptop and viewed photos. Studio photos. The color on my laptop and the color on the monitor were not the same. I may need to play with color on monitor but I was thinking not sure I like this. It's ok for the price. More than likely I would not purchase again.
name: K Greene-Cleveland NC

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2019
reviewBody: I purchased this monitor for my wife to use with her Alienware R17X4 laptop. She had broken a key on her keyboard but also wanted a little larger screen. So, I purchased a wireless keyboard and this monitor. She now uses the powerful Alienware laptop as a desktop with a larger display and a wireless, movable keyboard. She is a very happy camper.Others have commented on the great graphics, thin design, and good quality build for a great price, so I won't repeat those details here. I will however point out a few tips:1. At first, it seems the stand will not tilt. But it does! Grasp the stand firmly and then tilt the monitor back to the desired position. Note it does not tilt forward or side to side, but does tilt back (facing more upwards towards your eyes) which really helps in most settings.2. If you don't get a signal, make sure you plugs the HDMI cable into the "HDMI out" port on your PC, not the "HDMI in" port. Duh. I had mine plugged into the wrong port until I found my reading glasses and saw the problem.3. We changed three settings which you may want to also do if you have a laptop. First, we changed the display settings to choose between "Second screen only", "Duplicate", or "Extend". We chose "Extend" so she can have two documents open at once on the two monitors, her laptop screen and the new monitor. You just drag one document off the edge of the monitor to move it to the other screen.4. Next, we found that closing the laptop, when she only needed one screen, put it into hibernation and shut everything down. We went into Control Panel and changed Power Settings under "What happens when you close the lid". We changed it from "Hibernate" to "Do nothing". Now the laptop keeps running even when the laptop is closed.5. Third, most Windows laptops are configured so you have to drag things off the right edge of your new remote monitor to get them onto the laptop screen. However we wanted her laptop setting to the left of her new monitor, so it was confusing to have to drag something off the right-hand edge of the monitor to get it onto the left-hand screen on the laptop. We went back into display settings, where you can drag the two monitors in the settings to reverse them. Now, she can drag items from the left-hand screen to the right-hand screen by dragging them in that direction, and vice versa. Much more intuitive to use that way.With those changes to the settings, she can open the laptop and use it as two monitors, dragging and dropping documents and apps from one screen to another. When she closes the laptop lid, it reverts to a single monitor (the new Acer) but does not go to sleep. This is perfect for what she needs. She can still power off the monitor when not needed for an extended period. Also, the laptop speakers still work when she turns on the sound even when the laptop is closed.I highly recommend this monitor for anyone wanting a very good quality, cost-effective solution.
name: UrbanLegend

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2020
reviewBody: I think if all you need is a non-adjustable display with HDMI (and no audio pass-through).. this is a good option.I got this for my father, and his requirements were very simple.Personally, I'd pay an extra 10-15$ and get a display with a bit thicker bezel (I know ppl like the whole "bezel-less trend", but bezels can help with stability and support. I dropped a LG monitor 22" a few feet and because it has a bit stronger/thicker bezel, it survived. There is no way this would survive a small fall. This isn't necessarily a bad thing because ppl don't usually drop their monitors, but it's something to consider. Also, because the bezel is so thin, there is no room for VESA.. and this is where I would take a hard pass for this monitor. VESA is required for myself. Personally, I don't think anyone who wants any type of customization (with their setup) to purchase a monitor w/o VESA mounting.Overall I would recommend this monitor if it's at $90 and you if you do not need VESA mounting. Also it's important to note that it does not have audio pass-through, which is helpful if you wanna extract the audio from the HDMI and have no other ways of doing it. I use the audio pass-through on my other monitors to connect to my speakers. This is helpful for things like use with the Nintendo Switch which doesn't have an audio port on the dock.
reviewTitle: for $90 it's a great budget IPS display, but...
name: M

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
reviewBody: This monitor worked great for about 2 or 3 weeks, but then all of a sudden my colors became really pixelated. Greenish pixels appeared all over the screen, which made it look terrible, especially when trying to watch videos. Checked all the connections and settings, couldn't find any issues. Googled around, and couldn't find anything on the internet either. Then about an hour after it started, it stopped. Only thing I did was *lightly* slap the back of the monitor (mostly from frustration) and the issue disappeared. My wild guess is that it was caused by a poor internal connection. I'm worried that the issue will come back, but it's been another week and no issues so far. I'll update this review if anything changes. Of note is that the return window is now closed - hopefully Acer will honor the warranty if it happens again.Also, there's no VESA mounting holes on the back, which is just an unacceptable oversight IMO. It would be super cheap and easy to add them into the manufacturing process, and without them, I'm forced to blow 20 bucks on an adapter to be able to use a mount. For a $90 monitor without a height-adjustable stand, it's really kind of a rip-off to not have them. Overall, I give this product a 3.5/5 currently, rounded up to a 4.UPDATE: The same green pixelated issue came back last week. Tried everything, can't get it to go away. Monitor is essentially worthless now. I'm looking into the product warranty. STAY AWAY from this product, and spend a little more to get a reliable brand.
reviewTitle: Decent monitor for the price, but with one worrying issue (UPDATE 4/3/2020)
name: RetroDad

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2018
reviewBody: My only wish is that it could come with an adapter for use with my MacBook Pro. It only comes with a 15-pin plug. I really hated having to order it separately and wait several more days before I could get the screen up and running. At the very least, it would be kind if the supplier could mention up-front in their Amazon ad that this might be needed.
reviewTitle: Wonderful - but Apple users need to buy an adapter
name: Waltzing Matilda

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2020
reviewBody: I really wanted to dislike this monitor enough to warrant purchasing something 'bigger and better'. However, I cannot find a reason. My monitor arrived with zero dead pixels and a great picture given the price range.Since building my PC I have been on a 55" 4K TV and later a 32" 720p TV. The additional bandwidth this monitor is capable of makes a noticeable difference in gaming responsiveness. While I still experience occasional tearing in games where my Video card is rendering frame-rates beyond the capabilities of the 75Hz it's still not enough to warrant going to 144Hz or 1440p. Having a Radeon 580 means most of my gaming still falls well within the specs of this monitor.Although monitor speakers almost always stink. It would have been nice to have a built in speaker and not give up additional desktop real-estate for speakers. Pros:* Good picture* IPS screen* response time* 75Hz* aiming reticle* monitor tilt* compactCons:* Controls are a pain to navigate* No Vesa* No Speakers* Only 2 ports (VGA and HDMI)
reviewTitle: For the price its hard to beat
name: David M Elliott

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
reviewBody: I wanted to use the monitor as an additional screen for my homework and coding. Didn’t realize that the computer would not tilt when I got it. That was a minor inconvenience but I didn’t think it would bother me much.What makes this monitor garbage is that even if it’s brand new out of the package, the monitor flashes black . You can connect and disconnect the monitor multiple times but it still flashes black. This monitor is more fragile than the fine China my grandmother keeps in her cabinets. And now that I’m ONE DAY past the return date, I have to keep this garbage. I’m absolutely pissed. Screw Acer.
reviewTitle: Absolute garbage unless you wanted a strobe light.
name: Sarah

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2019
reviewBody: I bought two of these monitors. I hooked them up using the HDMI port to my PC's video card. The VERY FIRST thing I noticed with both monitors is their constant flashing on and off. The power stays on, but they seem to keep refreshing their connection to the PC. I've tried different cables. This did help with one monitor, but the monitor connected strictly with the HDMI cable just will not stay on/lit/connected. Tapping or bumping the monitor or giggling the cord or connection doesn't change anything. The monitor will stay on for 30 minutes to an hour, and then go through this...refreshing or w/e it is where the screen flashes on and off over and over for about 10 minutes...then it stops for a length of time, and starts back up again.Going to switch it to DVI like I did the other one, and I expect it will help. I also read that cables come with these monitors but neither of them had any but the power supply. Wonder if this is part of the issue.
reviewTitle: Thought Acer monitors would be top-quality...wrong
name: R. Carlson

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020
reviewBody: This monitor was great while it worked, but then I started my computer one day, the monitored flickered as if releasing a few dying breaths, and then left me with nothing other than a blank screen. It powers on and my computer still recognizes it as an external display, but other than a split-second flicker here and there, it's total blankness.Now, after barely more than a month with a total usage time of probably 20-30 hours, I've had to contact support and will have to pack and ship the monitor and wait up to a month for them to fix it. For the amount of time and effort required for the repair, you think they'd just send me a new one, but hey, I'm not the one making the decisions. All I know is that I'm probably just going to spend another ~$80 on a monitor from another company given the alternative of facing a month of frustration and decreased productivity by being forced to rely on my 13" inch laptop screen. So, with that all being said, it has proven to be a regrettable purchase.
reviewTitle: Abruptly stopped working after less than 2 months of sporadic use
name: Stephen G. Smith

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
reviewBody: This was purchased for a CAD workstation so I'm not streaming video or gaming. These work pretty good for what I'm using them for. I do have a couple of issues with them though. The on/off button is underneath the monitor not on the front. Personal preference not a functionality problem. The other is the monitor base. Seems pretty flimsy in my opinion. It doesn't take much to make them move/sway. The vertical part of the support doesn't want to snap into place on the base plate, so every time I pick it up it falls off. But for the price I think I can live with it.
name: Rosch32

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2016
reviewBody: I figured I would wait awhile before making this review. It's for the 23.8 inch R240HY bidxI feel I should mention the size because Amazon has this completely stupid policy now of merging reviews for what they think are similar products, so you never know if you're reading the review for the product you actually are researching, or the larger or smaller model with may or may not be similar in reality.In my opinion this monitor has good color quality, blacks are black enough, it can be tuned to be not too bright/blue (although most people seem to love screens as bright and blue as technically feasible).It's great for gaming, the screen looks larger than it is because the bezel is small. It's very thin.No dead pixels (my last 1080p Acer had one stuck red pixel, this was ages ago though).I have hopes it will last longer than my last one because of the LED backlighting.Main complaint is ghosting or trailing when scrolling on websites with dark font and colors that aren't white. There's a site I visit more often than others, and when scrolling the text ghosts pretty bad, it's black text on a kind of blue/grey background and the ghosting is basically negative, as in it ghosts light almost white under the black text when scrolling. Hard to explain I suppose but even a literally ancient HP LCD monitor I have from Windows Vista era does not do this.Really griping I suppose and if you want consider this a five star review. I just don't give five stars unless I have no complaints.Acer is always a great value brand if you're willing to consider it might not last forever. Great specs and features for the price as alwaysVESA mount would also be nice, if just so that I could get a second of exact same model for portrait use as a second monitor
name: nederlander

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2019
reviewBody: I got my monitor today and it was easy to set up right out of the box. There is only a vga cable and power cord in the box.I bought this to use with my older mac mini (mid 2011) using a thunderbolt to vga adaptor that I already had. However I tested it right out of the box as a second display with my Acer windows laptop. My review is therefore for these two systems as shown:1) With Windows (Acer) laptop: I connected the vga cable to my acer laptop and it instantly recognized and duplicated the screen without a hitch. There is a bit of tilt to the monitor on the mount which allows it to be adjusted backward or forward (like an up or down neck motion). The colors of my desktop wallpaper appear true to the original and crisp, however words were blurry until I updated the drivers in Windows Device Manager and tweaked the resolution to be the same on both regular setting and 'active signal resolution.' ONE WORRISOME ISSUE came up: There is a horizontal flickering/flashing white line near the top of the monitor running two-thirds across the width. It did not affect the display because it was outside where the display frame would be but it made me think the monitor was internally damaged. UNTIL I connected to my Mac Mini...2) With Mac Mini mid-2011: Immediately after using the monitor for about two hours as a second Windows display to my Acer laptop, I disconnected from that system and connected the monitor to my Mac Mini 2011 model. Without any need for additional tweaking the display was immediately recognized, resolution and scaling were good, and my wallpaper slideshow is breathtaking. The colors are much more beautiful than the Windows system on the laptop, but I suspect this has more to do with the actual graphics card of the much older Mac Mini. Most notably however, is that the flickering and flashing white horizontal line is not showing on the Mac display. I have no idea what to make of this. Luckily I bought this monitor to use with the Mac Mini so for now I am very happy of the quality and rendering of this display for the price.
name: CS

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020
reviewBody: I use this monitor for work, not gaming. The size of this and its price are terrific. It easily holds to 8x11 documents side-by-side, and there are no difficulties transporting it (light and easy to set up) which I occasionally do.However, I have spent LOTS of time trying to brighten the whites, but to no avail. It's really dim compared to a computer screen and to another external monitor I have (same price range). It seems like there should be a setting or adjustment beyond the ones I've found (picture, mode, manual adjust), but I don't think so.I would appreciate any advice if you have found it differently.em
name: Waitin' on the Cubs...

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2019
reviewBody: For the price, I am very happy with this screen!The Color saturation is GORGEOUS and I mean that: It's rich, deep, the blacks are clear and the quality is perfect. I have larger screens with higher refresh rates that pale in comparison (Literally: their colors look washed out comparatively)I originally only ordered this screen because the thing fit under my roll top desk perfectly, so the 21.5" size was just right there. But this is a joy to look at.The OSD controls are fantastic because despite them being unlabeled, once you press them the screen shows the controls directly over each button, very well done Acer, very well done. I can change the brightness in the dark (Which is when I would need to change it) thanks to this.For gaming this did well in Overwatch (It's being driven by a GTX 770M however) - no tearing or anything, the decent refresh rate (75mhz) on this panel, decent gaming performance for the price for mid-range graphics cards (1060/2060 or below).For browsing and writing the screen is perfect to look at, Windows 10 handles the text in a nice crisp manner, the pixels do not show, and it's an excellent image all around.This is an excellent buy for the price: I would buy another if I needed one this size.
name: Jordan M Eilbert

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
reviewBody: Bought this as an external monitor to connect to my Macbook Air while working from home during the pandemic. I typically don't like working from home because I preferring working at a desktop (depending on the type of work I am doing). Buying this monitor has been the perfect solution. I've had it for about 3 months now and haven't had any issues. You just need the Mac specific HDMI cord and set up the appropriate display specifications (I think the display wizard popped up automatically the first time I connected the monitor to my laptop but can't quite remember - if not just go to the display settings on your Mac). The display/color quality on this screen is also great, even better than my Mac. I had low expectations for this product since it was so cheap and I wasn't confident about the compatibility with an Apple product, but I'd definitely recommend it for Apple users.
name: Lynn I

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020
reviewBody: I use these for work and for gaming. After adjusting the color settings from 50 per spectrum to 70, the colors pop, the screens look fantastic, and these monitors seriously beat out any other in this price range. The 22" size makes these fit perfect on my desk as well, as everything is crystal clear and sharp. Games run at 75FPS with rich color, and there are even gaming modes that work great on different games. These also turn on quickly from sleep. I have had these for almost a month and have had no problems. I also own the 24" version of these, and have had that model for 2 years without any issue. Great monitors, great company, don't listen to the negative reviews if you're looking for a basic solution for work/light gaming.Pros:Minimal IPS backlight glowMonitors turn back on quickly from sleepColor saturation, once tweaked, is fantasticBrightness is great for all day work, doesn't cause eye fatigue from being too brightGaming modes, and a low blue light modeGreat menu panelAdjustable up and downCan mount a webcam, as seen in the picture, without covering part of screen.Cons:No bracket for mounting, but not a big deal if you have a desk with a rising stand as I do.Not adjustable sideways to line up with second monitor. Make sure your desk is very level or you find a clamp or something if you are wanting it to be perfect. Otherwise, as in the picture, they work fine.
name: Kenneth Chambers

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
reviewBody: I bought this with the intention of adding a second monitor to my laptop. This turned out to be a great monitor. The screen was perfectly sized for my needs at 21.5 inches. The screen resolution is good, colors are perfect and has multiple settings for you to change the screen colors and resolution if you need to match your needs. Has both a HDMI and VGA port, but it only comes with a VGA cable. You'll need to get a HDMI cable separately if you don't have an extra. Set up was easy, easily put the monitor and stand together. The stand is sturdy to withhold the monitor and has a round base so won't tip over that easily. The monitor is thin so there's no bulkiness if that's what you're concerned about. Also, it has a zero frame design so all you see is the screen, which makes the picture even better, for example when you're watching movies.
name: JL7390

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020
reviewBody: This was for my son, so as to how it is working not sure, I am sure it is fine, he hasn't complained, but he opened up the screen inside my dining room, THE ODOR that has come out of that box is sickening. It is outgassing some kind of odor that is somewhere between gasoline and medicinal. Don't know what that odor is but it has my whole house stunk up and it is making me sick to my stomach. I don't know if they spilled something on it, or is that is the smell of the plastic or what but he took the screen to his room and just the box in the dining room was so bad I could smell it from my chair in the living room, finally took the box to the garage and the house still smells. I find it hard to believe that is the normal smell, I think they sent us one that had been contaminated by something, and now wondering what......my son's room is rather air tight if his room smells like that I don't know how he is standing it......
reviewTitle: The smell is making me sick
name: Neoma G. Zimitravich

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2021
reviewBody: 02/05/2020 Update:Today I bought a desk mount and for my surprise (or not), this monitor is not compatible with ant mount (not VESA compliant).At first I gave them 3 stars and now I'm lowering it to 1, This is the 3rd time I buy Acer and end up regretting it.Old Review (the reason I first had it at 3 stars):Ads says: Full HD monitor but it is a LIE because it does not have an HDMI cable.I could have bought a cheaper model from not so famous brand WITH AN HDMI cable WITH IT. Besides, who's still selling FHD monitors WITHOUT it? Acer I'm very disappointed at you right now.LET US REMEMBER that to achieve FULL HD you HAVE to have an HDMI cable, so that concludes that YOU ARE SELLING a monitor that can be HDMI if you invest $20 bucks more on an HDMI cable, other than that you just buying a DIGITAL monitor.If you buying it be aware, IT WON'T COME WITH AN HDMI CABLE so add monitor price + $20 bucks before you decide, meaning that there are plenty other BETTER monitors that will come with an HDMI cable inside at this "NEW" price range.
reviewTitle: They don't come with an HDMI cable and are not VERSA compliant
name: Francisco Leite Pontilho

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2020
reviewBody: This is my first Acer product and I was skeptical in purchasing. but my Hannspree finally went kablooey after 10 years.The ONLY major issue I have had so far after 2 months is in no way because of the product itself but me getting used to a smaller monitor screen. My old Hans was a 28" so going to a 21" definitely takes getting used to, even though most of the time I am on my 15" laptop. I don't know why the size bothers me as much as it does.As for the free sync, it works great with my AMD RX580. Yeah it is NOT 4K BUT for the price it is perfect, again especially with the RX580 (which is pretty much not a 4K GPU anyway).The minor issue for me is again, just getting used to the monitor and NOT the monitor. My old one had speakers built in. This meant I had to break out my old speakers, which are outdated so I spend more time on my headphones.In the 2 months I have had it, no manufacturing issues, knock wood.Would I rebuy? YES, so far.Would I recommend to a friend? YESI find that Acer is a good product and have rethought my previous attitude about them.I absolutely love this monitor. The ONLY thing I do hope and time will tell is that the performance remains as strong as my previous one, lasting 10+ years with no issues except at the end.
name: pancdca

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2020
reviewBody: NO speakers. NO audio input (although the barely-legible instruction manual shows an audio input port, there ISN'T ONE on the product).If you don't care about audio, and don't mind a laterally stretched image, it's acceptable. I only bought this because I understood it to have internal speakers. Perhaps those are coming in a further delivery. I note that Leftmazon has once again shipped my order to the wrong address, and it only by accident showed up here. I watched the partially-masked delivery boy walk up and down the street looking for my house.
