Given the garbled address label, it's a wonder he found the street at all.Not very happy.[Okay, after a couple of weeks, the monitor is starting to grow on me. I like the size, clarity seems at least acceptable. I note no technical issues, such as phantom images at the edges, "bleeding," or any of the rest. The speakers still haven't shown up. But I'm boosting my rating by one star.
name: Kirinjin

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021
reviewBody: This review is how it was delivered. The Amazon delivery person did not follow my instruction as to where I want the packaged to be dropped off. Front door. Not by the gate, where the package was dropped off. I prefer to have my pkgs dropped off by the front door. This did not happen. My monitor was dropped off by the gate in plain sight to anyone who could be walking by the house and clearly see the box labeled "monitor". Luckily for me, my Echo dot, along with the app on my phone, notified me that my pkg has been delivered. So I'm giving the delivery person 1 star.As for the monitor itself, 5 stars. This is my 2nd purchased. This one is actually for my father. A late Christmas present. I didn't know what to get him for Christmas till a couple days before. My dad is happy with his gift. This monitor is great. There are no bells and whistle. It's a flat screen, about 21.5 in, HD..what more do you want? It's AFFORDABLE TOO! So yeah, I love this monitor. Thanks Acer!
name: Luv to Shop!

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020
reviewBody: My first Acer was perfect and lasted many years. I purchased this 2nd one and I deeply regret buying it. Even though it says you can lessen the brightness of the screen it still is very bright and after about 10 minutes trying to work my eyes actually burn from the "too bright" screen.I'm sorry to say I'll be replacing it with a different monitor. I'm not going to ruin my eyesight over a monitor.Very disappointed. I've tried to live with it but I'm no longer willing to deal with it.
reviewTitle: This is my second Acer monitor.....
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2019
reviewBody: The stand makes the monitor itself sit at a slight angle, probably only 3-4 degrees off level. But that's enough to drive you crazy really fast. There's no way to adjust this, fix it, nothing. It's brand new and I'm trying to shove plushies and stuff under one side to make it level. Absolutely horrific.The picture is phenomenal. Crystal clear, sharp, beautiful color depth, etc. If you plan on mounting this to an arm (not sure how one would even pull that off though), consider this a 5 star review.Also, just random accessory issues. A power pack for a monitor? I get that it's super thin/flat and I appreciate that, but honestly, nobody could figure out how to make a monitor use the same power cable as every monitor ever from like 1990 onwards? Now I've got this kinked cord power pack flopping all over the place in an already messy setup.Unboxing was awful too. They have 5,000 things placed on one side (outside) of the styrofoam protector. Pull your monitor out at any angle except the correct side face down, and enjoy the explosion of accessories all over the place.I understand this is a bit ranty, but what I hope to convey to potential buyers is that you will *love* the picture of this monitor, but you will definitely ruin a day in frustration to get to the point of being able to enjoy it with a tilted head. For some people, it simply isn't worth the headache, for others, picture is everything. Just know which you are before you head down this maze to get to picture quality.
reviewTitle: 5 stars for screen quality, -1,000,000 for the stand
name: Weston Winn

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2018
reviewBody: 4.5/5 starsHad it for 2 days and its been good so far. The picture quality is good and the price was very good.The small stuff that annoyed me:the led power lights blinks o/off when in standby mode and is annoying, none of my previous acer models have done this and honestly its ridiculous to have it.doesn't come with an HDMI cable, I guess we are still in 2008 for some reason.This one kind of on me, but doesn't have DVI-D, only HDMI and VGA; now I'm very sure its still 2008 :PThe only reason I took half a star off is because I don't like how the base looks, the quality of the power adaptor and the cables (hopefully they don't burn out), and the small stuff that annoyed me. Over all this is excellent for the price.
reviewTitle: Small stuff annoyance, but overall good
name: MZAnwar

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2021
reviewBody: I used to live in a cool, quiet house in a valley but had to move into a hot and noisy apartment in the city, with no A/C. The temps inside get up to 88 F on a hot day with a 90 F high! As room temp is considered to be 68-72 F, I was worried about my high end Lenovo ThinkVision monitor ($300) and HP color laser printer ($400) being fried or corroded in the heat and humidity of this wretched climate. So I placed both in my air-conditioned self storage unit while I look for better living conditions.To replace them, I decided to buy this $85 Acer monitor and an $85 HP inkjet printer (which costs less than a black toner cartridge for my color laser) and I could pretty much dump then when I move abroad to live (my main intentions). While the Acer is no match for the color saturation, overall screen quality, and bells and whistles of the Lenovo (which was pretty much hand-picked at Best Buy before I pulled the trigger on a good monitor), the Acer has surprised me for such a cheap monitor. It's sharp and color contrast is excellent. My main issue was the screen background being yellowish-green compared to my Lenovo or my Dell XPS, however it got whiter with time as the monitor burned in. In addition, I used the preset screen settings and found a couple that was able to whiten up the screen quite a bit, so that now, it's not bad at all.For $85, I expected soft, blurry text with dull colors in which case I'd return the monitor but I have no complaints now: sharp, excellent color saturation and contrast, and decently white background. Just be aware it has ZERO USB ports, no USB charging port, no HDMI or DisplayPorts, and no audio out port - nor height and tilt adjustments - like my Lenovo. It's probably worth it to spend 3-4X the cost of the Acer to get this if you want to get a really good monitor. But for my purposes, the Acer suits me fine. I might have to find room in my self storage to keep the monitor as it's too good to throw away!
reviewTitle: Good deal for a throwaway monitor
name: Clevor

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019
reviewBody: The monitor/screen/picture itself is great....when it works! Turns off/blacks out several times a (work) day. I Unplug...plug back in. Unattach & reattach VG cord. No change. No rhyme, no reason. Then sometimes after just a few mins.... it comes back alive. Sometimes after many, many minutes. It's quite random (and embarrassing when I'm presenting. My 30 days to return has passed (issue only started after 30 days of ownership :(. Disappointed. A different purchase (NOT ACER!) is in order.
reviewTitle: Turns off/blacks out several times a (work) day.
name: Skippy

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2020
reviewBody: Worked fine for a few months before starting to occasionally flicker and go black for a few seconds as if due to inactivity, which wasn't the case (would happen while actively playing games).Eventually the problem became more common and eventually just died.Pouring through other customer responses on this same product shows at least 5 other people with similar issues, which also go along with a display problem my brother experienced a few years ago with another Acer product.That turned out to be a second rate chipset that overheats and shuts down the display briefly before it realizes it's not really overheating and it turns back on. Eventually it just burns out and the display is dead.Obviously no clue if that's what happened here but dead is dead and this display is D.E.A.D.
name: Daniel K. Worden

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2019
reviewBody: I purchased 2 monitors, when they arrived I was excited to set them up. They were beautiful, thin, and easy to put together. But to my surprise when I turned them on, the monitors were different resolutions and I cant set them up so the images are equal!!! This completely defeats the purpose 😡
name: MGando

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021
reviewBody: I'm disappointed. Even if I weren't using this monitor for gaming, which was what I'd intended, it wouldn't be great for general use either! The picture isn't smooth. It has - for lack of any other way to describe it - lines in it. I don't think this is a defect in the particular monitor I received. I think that's just how it was made. If I'd seen this in person, I'd have rejected it and bought something else.I don't recommend this monitor. Not for gaming or anything else.
name: Rachel

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2021
reviewBody: The old LCD monitor lost the back-light and just getting the required capacitors to fix it was about a third of the price of this one. It ended up just being way too bright (like you had to view it from a distance like a larger TV) and fudging around with brightness just made things look worse. Also, we couldn’t everything to fit nicely on the screen and there were a lot of pages that just didn’t look right and/or fill the screen. We’re too old to play around with it so it’s in the garage as a backup and my wife is using our old laptop that I updated with a new HD and Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. The upside of not using it is the laptop alternative got the speakers, tower, keyboard and mouse of her desk and it looks so much better. The tower also had so many updates to Ubuntu over the years that it was slow and often nothing happened so you just had to wait it out. if you’re going to sit close to these you may find it irritating to the eyes as we did but we did do all the possibilities we could think of to make it a bit softer but it was a knee jerk purchase to just get he back online until we did come up with a more viable alternative… which was the laptop she was using while we waited for delivery of the monitor. Lastly, I do have a pet peeve about lights on electronic items, like our TV that has a red light to tell you it’s off. this one has a very bright blue on light that was also somewhat annoying and even flashed when the computer was in sleep mode.
reviewTitle: We were disappointed in it as a computer workstation monitor.
name: Todd M.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020
reviewBody: I bought this monitor along with an ASUS laptop because I love the idea of a dual display. I have three screens that I use at work and it is so much easier than clicking back and forth on one display. I will be using it for school and am looking forward to the easiness of tracking web pages.It's compatible with the laptop I bought, but make sure you get an HDMI cable with your purchase of the monitor. I had the assumption it came with the cable already, but it just has the port for it. My ASUS laptop also had the HDMI port so it worked out perfectly.If you have a laptop that is USB-C I recommend getting a USB-C to USB-A/HDMI adapter. The set up is easy and it doesn't take long. It's super light weight and thin. I almost was scared to drop it even a couple inches because I knew it would most likely crack the screen.The display is nice and it doesn't lag when connected to my laptop. I don't plan on using my laptop and monitor for any streaming (I have an iPad), but the monitor is useful when I have to WFH every now and then. Otherwise, I definitely recommend this monitor. And for the price it is DEFINITELY a steal.
name: maria

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2019
reviewBody: If you are like me and need to wear polarized prescription glasses, DO NOT purchase this product. You will not be able to see anything and the screen will appear to be very blacked out and will be hard to see anything.
name: Checkpoint

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
reviewBody: Easy to hook up, although I had to ponder a bit to figure out how to attach the stand. Nice and light, good picture quality. Well worth the money for a home office setup.UPDATE 7/22/20: I liked the price and performance of this monitor so much that I bought a second one for another setup. This one had problems almost right out of the box. The screen will go black intermittently for a few seconds then come back on. It's random, and the interval is unpredictable. I'm still using it, but wary that eventually it will go dark and not come back up. Reducing my stars accordingly.
reviewTitle: Nice little monitor, the first one, anyway
name: Reiver44

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2020
reviewBody: There's no AUDIO! and they keep that quiet! I have no use for a monitor with no audio. Jeez! What a waste of time! And now I've got to send it back, too. Why can't they make that clear in the heading! Oh, that's right -- it wouldn't sell as well.
reviewTitle: There is NO AUDIO! NONE. ZILCH!
name: Ron Marshall

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020
reviewBody: I love the monitor but had trouble setting it up. The documentation did not explain how how to attach the screen to the base. I had to watch a video I found online in order to find out what to do. Then the operation of the panel controls was really confusing. The longer online manual (not the Quick Guide that came with the monitor) didn't help either. I couldn't for the life of me figure out how to activate the left and right arrows. Fortunately I have a tech-savvy son who helped me out.Given how many people buy this monitor, and the fact that some percentage of them are not hardware-adept, I wish Acer invested a little time and manpower into delivering better documentation.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2021
reviewBody: First the pluses: I've only had this one day, but it seems pretty good for general "home office" purposes. It's bright (had to turn contrast and brightness down quite a bit for comfort), text is clear and easily readable. Color looks reasonably good to me right out of the box, which is a good thing as I can't immediately see a way to fine-tune colors in "Standard" mode. There may be a touch more green than I would like in skin tones. I also really like that this monitor has both HDMI and DVI inputs. This was one of the few monitors I could find in this size & price range that still had a DVI connector, which I need with my older video card.As to minuses: My biggest concern, is that black and dark colors get washed out more than I expected, especially if my eye level level is near the top of the screen (or higher). If I elevate the monitor so my eye level is near the bottom of the screen, the contrast and black level improves a lot...but then I'm looking up at it. And the stand has no built-in height adjustment. Similarly, if my eye/head position is lined up with the left side of the screen, the black levels on the right side get washed out. So, it seems to me that this monitor, despite being IPS, is still quite sensitive to viewing angles/position. Not so much with bright colors fading out, but with the black levels rising to hazy gray.The control buttons are small and unlabeled (and on the bottom side of the bezel). It's easy to hit the wrong one when trying to make an adjustment or work through the menus. (It's ridiculous that manufacturers don't label or mark the controls, functionality should always take priority over style.)But, for a nearly 24" screen at this price, maybe I ask too much. It seems like not that long ago, a 17-19" CRT was considered a "large" monitor and typically would cost $300 USD or more.
name: Zathras

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021
reviewBody: Receive a replacement.When installing the stand, I found there are a large screw and two small ones on the bottom of the foundation, intended to reach their individual receptors on the support stand. The weir thing is, when I screw down just found the large screw does not have a receptor, while the two small ones are not able to reach the other side to make them secure. WTF?!!!So my replacement monitor just put around the support stand, without a single working screw to secure the connection.Really do not understand why thing comes like this.....If Acer sees my review and finds I am wrong installation, I would be happy to update my review.
reviewTitle: why the screws have no / can not reach their receptors?
name: David_xw

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
reviewBody: I received the monitor yesterday. Plugged it in today and it doesn't work. It gets picture for about three seconds, then the screen gets fuzzy, then it buzzes and loses picture for four seconds. It's been repeating this process for five solid minutes now. We've tried everything--choosing a different outlet, changing settings on the monitor (no easy task when it's constantly restarting on you, I'll tell you that), moving it to a different desk, no change. Just fuzz, buzz, black, repeat. As if setting it up and playing Magical Chairs (but with outlets) wasn't hell enough for someone with arthritis, now I also get the pleasure of boxing it all back up and sending it back. I cannot recommend this monitor to anyone.But hey, there are a lot of good reviews here, too. Maybe take a chance, like I did. I just hope you get better results if you do. I'll be taking my business elsewhere.
name: Chanilove

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2017
reviewBody: Don't buy this model. I purchased two, and after only a year of light use they both are nearly unusable. After spending the money to ship to their repair center (a shipping label isn't provided), I got the panel back not repaired with a scratch on the casing. Spend the extra $20 and go with a better brand, you won't regret it.
reviewTitle: Spend the extra $20 and go with a better brand, you won't regret it
name: Bryan W.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
reviewBody: Con: No USB to provide power to Fire TV stick or Raspberry Pi; Has HDMI in but no audio (confusingly manual does show a volume control but that's for some other unspecified model); blacks are not very black; apparently it does have tilt, but I pressed as hard as I felt comfortable doing before risking breakage and could not make it tilt. No height adjustment. Comes with only VGA cable - if only supplying one cable, HDMI would have been a more sensible default. If it wasn't the cheapest display on the market on Black Friday I'd have sent it back, but I need a really cheap display so I'll live with the limitations. Pro: good resolution and sharp picture, good price.
name: Kindle Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2020
reviewBody: I work at home. I needed to lookup more, improve my posture, and get the kick out of my neck.I did some research on what was an inexpensive and decent monitor to work with my MacBook pro.I read reviews and came to this Acer monitor for the size and cost. In my research, folks talked about problems setting up and calibrating, etc.; I found none of that.I had the monitor step up in ten mins.I did buy a separate HDML cable, which I plugged into the monitor and my laptop. Then changed my display settings on my Mac to mirror or extend displays (depending on what I am doing).This monitor was easy to set up, and it is performing amazingly well with my mac.I use the monitor to write and do web work; imaging and fine design work I use my laptop directly.For under $100, this is a great deal!
reviewTitle: Great choice- I use as a larger display monitor for my macbook pro
name: Damini Celebre

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2019
reviewBody: For the money this is really good value. It’s a great entry monitor for all use cases, office, gaming, entertainment, etc.Comparing it to my 4K monitor that still currently cost 3x as much & a MacBook Pro with Retina display...The 75hz refresh is noticeable for FPS games, it’s just smoother over 60hz.The picture quality is very good (especially for the price) but I would not call it retina quality like another reviewer. However the quality is good and would be fantastic for most people.The color accuracy is pretty good too but it isn’t 100% accurate. Greens are a bit saturated and yellow is slightly duller in comparison for me.The brightness is good / average.The monitor I got looked pretty good in build quality. No dead pixels, only very very minor bleeding on one corner. ( only noticeable if testing for it )Overall it’s a great starter monitor. But, it falls short as a secondary monitor because of the lack of adjustments you can make with the stand and lack of vesa mount. So really this monitor is only good for budget & will have it sit landscaped in a stand on presumably a desk.
name: hi

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2017
reviewBody: At this price, it simply can't be beat! Whether you're a content creator who needs accurate color reproduction, a business user looking for a inexpensive monitor that's easy on the eyes, or a gamer who wants a multiple monitor setup, you will be EXTREMELY PLEASED with this monitor.The monitor has a small footprint for its base so it will fit anywhere. Additionally, I calibrated the monitor using Calman software and, surprisingly, it didn't need it. I've calibrated monitors that are worth $400+ and even they needed calibration. Obviously, if you've got a calibrator, go ahead and use it, but it likely won't yield any noticeable difference. For an accurate monitor that produces this wide gamut of colors, you won't find anything in this price range.I will say, if they could improve it, it would be nice to see the monitor have freesync. Since it's basically a software update, it's a shame not to see it on this monitor. However, this is a minor issue. Good contrast, great colors, and a tilting stand. What's not to like?
name: KennyNashville

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2019
reviewBody: This is the FIRST display (TV or monitor) that I have EVER seen that has no vesa mounting holes. I will give Amazon the choice of me returning the two screens I purchased, or refunding me enough money to purchase an after market "hack" to mount these on my triple screen clamp desk mount .As far as quality, bleh. I didn't purchase these to work on, they're hooked up via USB3 to display browser inspection tools and other things to free up space on my other screens. 27" should be 1440p, but for the price, these are decent screens if you don't plan on mounting them to anything. Color out of the box is flat (I haven't compared the two I purchased since I haven't decided on keeping them or not.The bottom bezel should be smaller, (remove the Asus logo that is barely visible anyway).I moved my review from a 2 to a 3 star rating for now. I will consider updating my review if things get worse or better when it comes to mounting these with a hacked mount, or sending them back.
name: YTSEJAM

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2019
reviewBody: Bought this monitor for my new PC build. Unfortunately I could not get it to display while in BIOS. The first time I set up my computer I had to drag it to a TV and connect it so I could get BIOS displayed and begin loading Windows 10. Once Windows 10 was loaded I updated my video card drivers and updated everything.. tried to go into BIOS, it did not display. The screen says "input not supported" it does not come on until after my computer gets to the windows login screen. I called Acer support. They suggested all the things I already tried (different cables, update BIOS) nothing worked. Due to this issue I am returning this monitor. I'm A+ certified and a professional in I.T. .. I'm stumped by the issue and so was Acer. I'm sure there is some sort of display settings mismatch while in BIOS but to be completely honest after troubleshooting this much and not having any further direction from tech support I think it's not worth it.. returning it and getting a different model from a different company.
reviewTitle: Couldn't get it to display while in BIOS
name: Cbrew

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020
reviewBody: Wow. All I had to do was unbox it, plug in the cable & power cord, hit the power button, and I had a beautiful, clear, crisp display. No drivers to download/install, no set up, etc. Took 2 seconds to attach to desktop stand. Literally plug & play. Very slim & light weight, but doesn't have a flimsy or cheap look or feel at all. Works well w/my Acer laptop & daughter's Lenovo laptop, as well as her Dell work laptop w/docking station. Tilts & adjusts easily & smoothly w/out slipping or sticking. Really pleased with it, probably ordering another for daughter to use while working from home. Doesn't have mic, camera or speakers, but if you're using w/laptop that has them, just do a dual display or multi-screen mode and you should be fine using the laptop for video calls.
reviewTitle: Amazing price, works right out of the box
name: Save a Life - Adopt A Pet

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020
reviewBody: I wanted a small monitor that I could dedicate to a Raspberry Pi 4 B. The reviews attracted me. The picture quality is outstanding for the price. The 21.5" device has no speakers...irrelevant to me. It is light and takes up very little desktop space. I don't really need good image quality to run a RasPi but having good IQ makes surfing with the RasPi fun. Obviously it uses very little energy and generates very little heat.
name: abacus

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021
reviewBody: This is the worst monitor I've purchased in the last 15 years. Even on HDMI it looks worse than a decades old VGA monitor. I bought it to use as a second monitor, mostly for text and chat apps and even for that purpose it's unbearable.Colors look incredibly pixelated, giving everything a "screen door" effect. You can notice it most prominently with light blue. What shows up as a solid light blue rectangle on my primary monitor shows up as essentially a series of vertical blue lines on this piece of junk.Secondly, the contract is absolutely horrible. It always has a washed-out look. Adjusting the contrast didn't resolve the pixelated color issue. There's a permanent hazy tinge to the screen that makes your eyes hurt.Anyone who reviews this monitor positively simply hasn't used another monitor made this century. Of the thousands of amazon products I've bought in my short life, this is a serious contender for the worst one ever.
name: Erik Pfeiffer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
reviewBody: I bought one of these monitors back in November and loved it. I thought the quality was great. So great that I decided to buy a 2nd one so I could use them for dual monitors.When I got the 2nd monitor and set it up next to my older monitor, I noticed that the white color on the new was actually very yellow in comparison.I figured it was a “bad” one and ordered a 3rd monitor, hoping I could simply swap out the yellow monitor and return it... I just received my 3rd monitor yesterday, set it up, and it is very yellow as well. I will be returning both monitors since the first one is out of its return window.I put photos of the side by side yellow vs white tint. Harder to see on the photo, but you get the idea.
reviewTitle: White is more of a yellow...
name: Mackie

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2019
reviewBody: Straight up: These are not great monitors.But for $100 each? Well, they're pretty great monitors.Thus my headline. "Cost effective" is what these monitors are.The picture is a bit on the washed out end of the spectrum and maybe a tiny bit grainy. If you're a gamer, don't even consider thinking about buying these. But if, like me, you're using them in an office setting, they're just fine.The monitors have virtually no physical adjustment. What I'm especially missing is height; I think they sit at least 6" too low for proper ergonomics. I was able to solve this with the tried and true "stack of printer paper" method. Again, perfectly fine in an average office setting and maybe not so great in your Gamer Man Cave or whatever.Finally, consider that these are fairly low-resolution by today's standards. Again -- office work vs. gaming, watching a movie, or whatever.These things work fine. Setup was a breeze, they do what they're supposed to do, and I don't regret my purchase one bit. If they were more expensive I'd start pulling off more stars, but they're quite cheap and well worth the tiny investment. If all you need are simple office monitors, you can certainly do worse than these. Just go order yourself a few reams of printer paper to go along with them.
name: Adam Machanic

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
reviewBody: I use two of these in my home office, the image is crisp and sharp, and plenty bright even sitting right next to a big window. The only criticism I have is they are not "Zero Frame" as the title description indicates. The plastic bezel itself is almost nonexistent with the screen surface going right out to the edge, but the image stops about half an inch (say 5-6mm) from three edges with the bottom a bit wider. If you put them side by side, you will notice it, but it hasn't bothered me at all. Again, not a problem for my use, and I did not deduct any stars.Having said all that? I love these things. The monitors have performed flawlessly since I installed them (I use two) and they match color and brightness perfectly right out of the box. Like I said above, they're sharp, crisp, and bright. I use a (Amazon Basics brand) DisplayPort to HDMI adaptor cable with them and have no issues at all. The power supply is external, but is small and has plenty of cord both on the AC side and the DC side so you can stash the small brick wherever is convenient. I have them next to the monitors.
name: AdamJayP

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020
reviewBody: Good monitor for budget. The monitor is good deal for office usage, programming. Not sure about game purpose.Pro:- Nice picture quality as promised- For the budget, I would say this is an excellent deal- Text is clear. I used to programming on 15" laptop. This monitor is really a big help for me.- Color is excellent for pictures- The monitor does tilt back and forth a little bit, ~ 10 degrees- Viewing angles are wide as promisedCon:- As other said, the monitor is out of tune. I did spend SEVERAL HOURS to push different buttons to get the correct color/text tuning for this monitor. Out of the box, the default setting screws up. Be prepare, you will need patience to get every thing right. Once it gets the correct setting, the monitor looks great- No VESA mount. I wish this monitor have that. I like to have the monitor setting up in vertical position but unable to do that for this one.- Max resolution in 1920x1080
name: TDinh

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
reviewBody: I knew it wouldn't be nearly as good as my retina Macbook Pro screen, obviously...but it literally hurts my eyes. You can see every damn pixel. It's honestly a joke how bad the picture quality is. It's really heinous. I guess you get what you pay for, but I sincerely regret not spending another hundred bucks and getting something that doesn't make my eyes bleed.
name: pkessler

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
reviewBody: Bought two of these for my home office. Absolutely thrilled with their performance. I'm not a gamer so I wasn't expecting 4K quality considering the price but was pleasantly surprised. Picture quality is excellent; text displays sharply and color quality exceeds my expectations. Interestingly, even though they are 23.4 inch monitors they "present" much larger. Very happy.
name: K. Dillard

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2020
reviewBody: Junk. if you are looking to anything other than type up a word document or some excel work. I received my monitor without a mark or physical damage to the box. Open the box up and the monitor screen is pealing apart. The plastic clear part which lays over the lights in the back of the monitor is separating. Worthless unless you push the plastic part back in and tape it down. Now I have a new monitor with tap on the top left and right sides to keep light from escaping from the insideSend it back? Sure, I would if I could … Stuck in Kuwait with no way to return it. I will not be buying an Acer product again. Stick with higher price (quality) products if you want an enjoyable experience. Do not waste your time with this monitor .
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2020
reviewBody: When I bought this product it had a 4.5-star average with 5 000+ reviews. So my expectations were very high. I got disappointed because sometimes colors on the screen get messed up. I've attached one normal and one messed up picture taken with my smartphone. When that happens, I need to adjust the cable/monitor and so far it has been working (less than a week that I had it). I know it's monitor's fault, and not cable's fault because the same thing happens with my VGA and HDMI cables as well as with VGA cable that it came with. I'm too lazy to return/replace it and it's possible that very soon the screen will be messed up permanently and reconnecting cables won't help. If that happens I will bump this down to two stars, if that does not happen I will bump this up to four stars.
reviewTitle: Colors get messed up occasionally due to connectivity issues
name: irakli

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2020
reviewBody: Bought this product at the beginning of March, made it to mid May. I was on my computer one night browsing the web, all of a sudden my screen went black. Then I started to smell burning plastic. At first I thought my PC was overheating as I have been having issues with the cooling fans. But eventually I narrowed it down to the screen. I do use my computer a lot. I have this hooked up to my laptop docking station for work which I use during the day, and it’s also connected to my personal computer for gaming and other personal uses. I think it’s safe to say that it couldn’t handle that amount of usage. Now I have to use my tiny laptop screen for work and have no display for my PC until my replacement comes in. So if you are like me and constantly using it, might be more worth your time to shell out the extra cash for a better quality monitor. Luckily it broke in time for me to return for a refund. If you are using occasionally might last you a little longer than 2 months but to be safe I’d stay away.
name: Chris C.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020
reviewBody: I bought 2 of these. Simple assembly, great picture quality. On one of the monitors, the base is a little off and causes the monitor to tilt ever so slightly to the left. If I didn't have 2 of them next to each other, I might not have noticed.There's a million ways to correct it - small piece of folded paper under the base worked. I'm sure this isn't common, and I still gave it 4 stars.
reviewTitle: Good value, get what you pay for
name: Luke

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2018
reviewBody: I have been using 27" Asus monitors for many years now for photo editing and preparing artwork for printing. I was very confident in the color settings for the Asus monitors, so I was a bit hesitant to buy this Acer model. I use a Datacolor Spyder to set my display color to the profile the printer is using, so that what I see is exactly what I get. After calibrating the color for this monitor, I have found that it is at least as good as the Asus 4K monitors, but with one feature that I find sort of amazing to me. This is an ISP monitor. With a other LED monitors, it can be tricky to make sure you looking at the monitor from right in front of the screen. If you are standing looking over my shoulder, or kneeling looking up at the LED monitor, the brightness will be slightly different. This monitor does not behave in that way. The color and brightness of the image remains the same regardless of your angle of view. Since I am often showing he work to a client or business associate, this is a huge advantage.
reviewTitle: After 2 months, I have no complaints
name: MET

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2021
reviewBody: I bought this monitor on 12/16/2015. While I don't use it everyday I do use it quite often and for long periods of time when I do. It has been a champ, no problems whatsoever. Clear, display with no abnormalities. Is it the same as a $1,000 monitor? No, but even those have their own quirks. This is a good, everyday monitor without frills (that often cause issues) that I've been able to count on always lighting up when I jiggle the mouse. I don't have pets, kids or peeps wandering through the house. I always leave my stuff turned on (though asleep) and connected to power through a UPS. I learned my lesson about power issuers and electronics many years ago and since I've been using a UPS I've not had a single electronic failure in 21 years (tvs,stereos, computers, etc.) - something to consider.
name: Beav

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2019
reviewBody: I use this as my garage computer screen. Simple and easy setup. Packaging was great and protected it thoroughly. Enough cord to allow for distance and tucking of wires. My only complaint is that on a white screen, such as this web browser(google), there is a black ripple effect that is prominent. Sometimes it pulses, sometimes its a ripple. Imagine opening up a blank notepad on the windows app, and having a black/grey shadow in the background. It does not go away. I've watched a movie and use it for multiple social media browsing and a video game. It works great, it really shows you different colors and definition. I'm annoyed by the background black/grey ripples but am very pleased with performance and color otherwise. I would buy it again and would recommend to friends.
reviewTitle: Simple install, Great color, has a weird ripple on white screen.
name: Duke

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2019
reviewBody: I currently have a 2 monitors setup that were mistmatched and so when I'd work the display quality from one to another was quite drastic. They were also 30inch monitors to which I still use but have swapped them out in order to have a more cohesive setup.Here are my quick takeaways:- I bought 2 monitors which comfortably now sit where my one 30inch monitor use to be- The ultra slimness of them allow for more desk space which is quite nice!- Display quality fits my needs, whether it be for anime, gaming, or just simple research / work.- Functional buttons on the right bottom of the screen make it easy to navigate the menu's for brightness, contrast, and so forth.- Comes with VGA and power cables, if you want to use HDMI you would need to have or buy your own.Overall, I'm very pleased with the quality of these and the packaging was perfect and appropriately secured. I'd recommend this display if you're just looking for a simple way to alleviate your space needs and a display for a good price.
reviewTitle: Quality that doesn't break the bank!
name: Iris Malang

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021
reviewBody: This monitor was great for only two months, and then the screen became fuzzy. I called the Acer technical support to guide me through the same steps I did to fix it, but nothing worked. So they told me it would be almost one month before they could fix it and send it back to me. I ask a replacement, and they said, "no". I ask if they could give me prorated refund they said, "no". So, now I have wait for one month before I can get the monitor back, and hopefully, it will work. I will never purchase another Acer monitor.
name: Killrain

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2017
reviewBody: I really have come to like this monitor a lot. It was definitely a good upgrade from the LCD monitors that I had before. The screen is large, borderless, and produces bright, vibrant colors. Pixelation is hard to notice on the screen even with its size. Here are some things to keep in mind:Pros:- Large screen- Borderless trim- Brilliant display- The unit is very thinCons:- When viewing dark videos, pictures, or games in a dimly lit room, you can see the backlight bleed through the screen in the corners. For games, that really sucks, but I do like to play with my game brightness up quite a bit, so it's not such a problem for me.- There is no VESA mount capability.- The inputs on the back face outward, not downward. If you want to put this up against a wall, depending on the firmness of your input cable, it's going to prevent you from getting too close the the wall. I much prefer my inputs to be facing down to save space and look less awkward.
name: Ryan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021
reviewBody: It looks phenomenal and is basically exactly what I needed. My computer won't push more than 144 fps, the colors are vibrant, easy to set up, works on my standads (vesa?) mount, 3ms is more than adequate response time for someone that isn't in the top .01% of gamers and the price is excellent.Chances are you don't need a better monitor unless you're running a really high end rig. 1080p is exactly the pixel count you need for a 24 inch, if you move to 27 you should up to 1440 but at 24 you're not gunna need more. No dead pixels so far and I've traveled with it a couple times now.The one and only thing I can say slightly negative is that as other people mentioned, the curvature is a little weak. It could def be more aggressive but if you're not sure about how you feel about a curved monitor it's a nice transition. Sound is also pretty trash but I use it when I'm watching sports and it's a good enough situation, I'd keep the headphones on or use a sound bar or whatever if you're gonna watch movies or high production tv.
name: Brandon Dotson

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
reviewBody: I use these for video editing mostly. They are very color accurate for the price, and good for color correcting as far as I can tell. I just got a second one because I ended up needing two for my workflow. I think it’s crazy how sometimes they are around $90 and then they can jump to more than twice the original price at about $200! I snagged the second one when the price dropped again, but it was close! I did notice some inconsistency. For instance, on of the stands is just a couple millimeters higher than the other, so they aren’t perfectly side-by-side. I know I can fix that by getting a stand for my desk to mount these on. I thought there wasn’t a mount for this monitor, but there is an adapter sold by a few sellers so it’s possible. I like how thin these are, and it seems like they are reliable. I’ve been using the first one for about a year now. I wanted cheap, but not too cheap. And I needed an IPS.
reviewTitle: Get these when they’re cheap. Watch for the price to drop to about $90
name: Adam

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
reviewBody: For the price, these are fantastic monitors. As with most monitors, set up and use is simple, and the provided HDMI cable means nothing extra to purchase. I would probably not use this for serious, detailed photo editing but for general daily computer use it's excellent, but with one curious discrepancy (flaw?). I got used to using two monitors at my office, so I bought two of these to use side by side. They look identical, and if they were not side by side I would never have noticed, but one stands about 1/4 inch taller than the other. It must be the stand or where the stand is attached, as the difference is the same on the top and bottom of the monitor itself, but it appears that the stand is fixed and not height-adjustable. Every once in a while it bothers me (but that's my issue), but it does not detract from the monitor's performance.
name: Tom_F

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2015
reviewBody: I purchased 2 of these a few weeks ago and have enjoying the hell out of them ever since. The slim bezel was a big selling point for me. They look amazing side by side.-Pros--Unbeatable price/value for a full 1080P monitor.-Wonderful picture. LED lit makes images come to life.-Easily calibrated or adjusted.-Matte finish reduces any background light glare. Looks great with room lights on or off.-Lightweight (only 6 lbs).-Best response time out of any IPS panel display I've seen (only 4 ms)-Very sturdy base.-High viewing angles.-3 different input ports makes this a dream for compatibility.-No backlight bleeding(a common problem with some displays)-No assembly, the monitor just slides on to the base and clicks in place. I set up 2 of these in less than 5 minutes.-Packaged very well.-Includes VGA cable, which I though I was going to have to purchase separately.-Cons-Not VESA mount compatible. (I knew this before I bought them. Didn't have plans to mount them anyway.)I will be purchasing a 3rd to add to my workstation soon. (see picture)
name: Charles Bradley Scott Jr.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
reviewBody: Just received the monitor love the resolution and bright colors. I’m using the monitor as a second screen for online classes and it seems to work great. No issues so far. Would recommend.UPDATE 06/21/2020 DO NOT BUY THIS MONITOR IT WILL ONLY LAST FOR A MONTH. I turned on the monitor today and it was fine, it was working. Then I noticed that the screen had gone black sometime today when I wasn't working on the computer. Now it says that it can't find a signal and when you read the reviews where people gave it a 1, they are all talking about how the screen goes black. I have tried everything I can think of to get a signal. I'm not all that tech wise so I'm not sure what's wrong with it. I just know it was working fine for about a month. If you do buy this monitor. MAKE SURE YOU DON'T THROW AWAY THE BOX AND IT'S CONTENT in case you have to send it back. READ THE NEGATIVE REVIEW BEFORE BUYING.!!! Now I have to buy another monitor.
name: P Faison

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
reviewBody: I purchased two of these monitors on Black Friday and I’m very happy with them! They are a huge upgrade from my old, lower resolution Dell monitors and they were very easy to assemble and hook up to my Lenovo Thinkpad X1 Yoga. To connect them to my laptop, I had to purchase separately an HDMI cable and a VGA to USB-C converter, but there are many other variations you can try to be able to use two monitors at once.The only downsides are: 1) no USB inputs on the sides of the monitors (my old ones had 2 each so I had to purchase a USB multi-port USB adapter to have those extra usb inputs for my keyboard and other chargers), and 2) the monitor heights are not adjustable. I currently have mine propped up on stacks of books, but just ordered two “Simple Trending” risers to free up the space under the monitors.Overall, I’m very happy with the picture quality and brightness of the monitors and for $80 each, they are a great deal.
name: Jenna

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021
reviewBody: This is a very good monitor for its price! I upgraded from a previous monitor that came with my Dell Inspiron that had Windows Vista LOL!. Very Old. Anyways my reason for upgrading:1) Using it as an external monitor for my macbook pro for college work.2) It connects to my xbox one s very nicely. Battlefield 1 and titan fall 2 looks awesome in this (in my opinion)BEFORE YOU BUY YOU MUST KNOW:1) the monitor does not tilt up or down.2) monitor does not rise in height and visa versa.3) the monitor does no rotateTo me this isn't a problem since my monitor is sitting on a monitor riser. However, if you are nit picky about this type of stuff, i recommend you look else where and compare!OVERALL THOUGHTS:1) set up is very easy! can be done in 5 minutes. Simply connect the circle base to the back of the monitor screen and you are done!Its a awesome monitor for its price!!
reviewTitle: VERY GOOD MONITOR FOR ITS PRICE AND NO BACK LIGHT BLEEDING!!!!
name: Samial Ibrahim

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
reviewBody: Running a GeForce 1080 Ti and a Ryzen 7 3800X, this monitor shows pretty strong signs of motion blur. Panning left/right when there's a dark object against a light sky, shows multiple ghosts of the object, just like you'll see with high-persistence monitors. Turning on "overdrive" gives the objects white edge outlines, but doesn't really reduce the effect. This is not super surprising given that it's an IPS panel, but I had hoped with 75 Hz and overdrive (and the VRR from free-sync) it wouldn't be so noticeable. It's certainly not "4 ms gray-to-gray" in any meaningful way.Unfortunately, my wife gets motion sickness from this persistence when playing Overwatch, so I wouldn't call this a "gaming monitor" in the same class as real G-sync monitors.
reviewTitle: Fairly blurry monitor -- wife gets motion sick
name: Jon E Watte

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
reviewBody: It is a very clear compact budget monitor. great colors and brightness, all around very nice looking. Not the best refresh rate which I feel a lot of more people are going to start realizing is important as we see more and more people enter the digital age with tech exploding, masses of people starting to work from home, etc. But for a budget ultra thin light weight monitor, it's a fantastic monitor. and if you're into gaming you should know the refresh rate listed on this product is nowhere near what you need, although you still could use this if needed. I actually just keep it in the box and bring it on the road with me when heading out early during the week on vacations and such, sneak in a mornings worth of remote work if needed. yeah, still have to plug it in, but it's way nicer than my actual 'portable' monitor. the stand just clips and un-clips and you slide the monitor in, so it's only takes about 1-2 min to set up, and if you got some sort of proper carrying case for it, it would take less than a minute to set up.
name: Andre Gide

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2019
reviewBody: [Edit: Please be aware that the photo and video were compressed upon upload. The picture is very sharp and colors are bright and accurate. Also be aware that the original photo was taken with my phone, producing miore patterns of red stripes which aren't really there. Anyway...]My application is for home video surveillance. I haven't had it long enough to know if there will be screen burn-in but the price is really good so if that happens some day it won't be a big hassle to replace it.I can't speak for gaming as the refresh rate may not be appropriate for that, although I've enjoyed games at this refresh rate so it might be great -- Find out elsewhere as I have no idea. Personally for gaming I'd use a bigger monitor but this is the right size for my needs.I'm using the VGA input because that's all my surveillance system has for output. I was worried the VGA input might not produce a good picture but was pleasantly surprised... it's really excellent. My photo doesn't do it justice. I've also attached short video where you can see squirrels running along my fence.I like that this monitor is light weight and very thin. And yes it DOES tilt on the stand, although it doesn't move up or down. Personally I will mount it to a wall. (Actually "in" the wall by cutting into the drywall, then adding a picture frame so it looks like part of the home.) The thin profile, light weight, and thin bezel will help the installation and produce a good-looking result.I also like that the power supply has a small brick, from which a thin low-voltage cord connects to the monitor.Good picture, great price, and a nice physical profile. I'm happy!
name: Bart

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2019
reviewBody: I bought two monitors for my home office and almost immediately after the return date (missed by one week) one of the monitors had a bad pixel line right down the middle of the screen. Although the Amazon representative was absolutely great, Acer is not handling this well at all. This experience with Acer has me not wanting to buy electronics from Amazon because once you get a defective product, the sheer trouble of having to send a brand new item to a repair place means that I will have effectively paid full price about a month ago for a refurbished unit. If I had bought my two monitors at Costco or Bestbuy, I would have been able to return the one defective unit and walk out with a replacement. I would recommend that Amazon try to use its muscle to help customers return defective items during the warranty period. Sadly, I've had a pretty good experience with Acer until now. No offer to send a replacement thereby allowing me to use the same box to return the defective unit. Oh well.
reviewTitle: One defective unit left a sour taste...
name: Big John

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2019
reviewBody: So, i am a gamer(with over 2000 hourse in cs go), i had my previous monitor for 7-8 years and it started flickering and stuff. So i started doing my research, of course at this price point i was not even expecting to get 75hz monitor, i saw this one, i thought ok, its 75hz but its going to have some other drawbacks, i read reviews, i sawYoutube videos and one of the most trustworthy Youtubers actually recommended this one for gaming when on budget. even though i could have afforded something more expensive than this, i was so curious to check this one out, so i bought this monitor and i had it for couple of days, difference between this monitor and normal 60hz monitors is SIGNIFICANT! I mean playing counter strike is just much more smoother and nicer. also it is really thin and has IPS panel, which is superior to TN panels, because of more accurate colors and viewing angles.So i realized that it is not only best monitor 100$ but its actually best under 150-200$I mean there are some TN monitors which cost 150-200$ and have 144HZ but you are going to be sacrificing IPS panel colours.Also keep in mind that going from 60hz to 75hz difference is bigger than going from 75hz to 144hz.
name: GEORGE

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2020
reviewBody: Oh my goodness! I have been using this monitor for around a couple months I would have to say. I have been loving this monitor. Great everything to be honest. Now, sadly if I wanted a second one I might have to upgrade the desk. I personally use mine for console gaming though, so I am not sure how it would operate with a PC.No controller of any sort included, however the monitor does have buttons on the bottom right. The very first one on the right is the power button (when I first got it, this was hard for me to figure out.) and the other buttons switch around a few things. Now for me it automatically detects my HDMI which is great and it also can have VGA cords connected (in fact it comes with a VGA cord).My only dissapointment is that it has no speakers (no audio) so you have to use a headset connected to either your console or PC whichever one you are using it for. If your using a Xbox One be careful, because that console is known for having headset audio issues. Works great with my PS4 though and it did with my Xbox One X as well.Disclaimer: My phone isn't the best with picture quality, so don't judge the monitors quality off of my picture haha.
name: Jordan M

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020
reviewBody: I was looking for a monitor to replace a smaller, older, 4x6 type display on a secondary PC. There are many 20"-21,5" monitors to choose from so the choice wasn't easy. The type of connection ports available on the board also create limitations. I finally opted for this Acer. I considered a BenQ which I had purchased before, as well as HP, Asus Dell and other Acers. This Acer was priced right and came with the connectors I needed for hook-up. The display is pleasing and far superior to the monitor it replaced. Hard to compare to the BenQ which also has a decent display. My issue with the BenQ that was being offered at the time was that it was refurbished and I preferred to buy brand new. The Acer was also slightly less expensive. The PC is used for basic computing needs. No hi intensity games are play much on either PC so I don't have much feedback about that. This monitor fit the needs for what I purchased it for and so far am pleased with it.
name: Trauts

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020
reviewBody: I just bought two to set up a working from home working place. They picture quality is amazing, I am super happy. I thought they did not tilt, but they do. At first they are super difficult to tilt, but once you do it it for the first time, it becomes super easy to adjust, it is just the first time that takes some effort. I have included a video. I was installing them, so I didn't attached the base at the moment, but of course it tilts with the base on it as well, just showing where the mechanism is located.
name: Diego Barrantes

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020
reviewBody: The monitor is great. The image is bright and crispy clear. I don't use for gaming, so I cant say anything about speed, response time, etc.It is a very thin monitor and light, the monitor does tilt horizontally so you can adjust the angle of vision. The stand however does not move up or down, so it stays at a fixed height, but honestly, I don't miss that.However, my only pet peeve is that this is not a zero frame monitor, or you can say that the 'frame' is very tiny, but the image of the monitor does not reach the edge, so there is an actual visible frame in this monitor. Of course, it is much smaller than 'normal' monitors, but it is NOT zero.
reviewTitle: Great monitor but not zero frame
name: Eduardo

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviewBody: I didn't expect to buy a monitor, but glad I went with this one. Originally I did not think it was adjustable, but it is. I saw on another review someone thought the same thing. It is just a really sleek design, once you play with it, you find how to adjust. It does very easily once you figure it out. Easy to put together. No drama. Love the brightness, and quality. It's beautiful to work on. I am a student and worked all last semester on my laptop, and do not know how I managed. I feel spoiled now. Although I did purchase this to be able to work remote from home...This will benefit my studies now that I have a duel screen. This one is very nice.
name: Brandy

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2020
reviewBody: I bought these monitors to replace a pair that I have had for over 10 years. The picture quality was a huge improvement. I made the mistake of not checking to see if the monitors had VESA mounts, they don't.I seem to have issues with switching between computers with my KVM (GHT DVI KVM Switch 2 Port Support Dual Monitor). I am using Linux Mint as my OS. When I switch to my laptop running Windows 10 (connected to a universal docking station), the picture comes up. When I switch to my Linux computer, it takes forever for the image to come up & sometimes it doesn't recognize the video signal & I have to turn it off and on again to get it to come up. I have never had this problem before. I still need to try this with my laptop that runs Linux to see how that is affected.
name: Nate

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
reviewBody: This little screen was purchased to use as a second screen at one our workstations. It's affordable and a good size, plus we like that it has a HDMI port for easy connectivity.The part I sort of don't like is the color balance on the display is not the same as the other Acer screen we use. It's fine for what we use it for; it's not for working on graphics or anything, but it is kind've annoying. I am sure if both the screens were the same model it wouldn't have been an issue, but I was hoping the screens would match a little closer since they're both from the same company.Overall though it's a good budget screen to use as an extra display when you want to run a dual monitor setup.
name: S. Wheeler

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
reviewBody: Great for the price. Only downside was that ours didn't tilt. But after reading a question someone said to loosen the hex bolt inside the stand. To do that we had to dis-assemble the entire stand (pictures shown of the screws we had to unscrew go reach the tilting mechanism.) Once we got to the spot we could not get the nut loose. We ended up holding the nut with pliers and using a hammer to make it tilt. That worked! Once it was all put back together it tilts fine. The nut was way too tight before hand that didn't allow it to tilt. But all is good now and we don't have to dis-assemble it to tilt it back! It's a great montior for the price wish it had speakers but we got some cheaper amazon ones that work great!
reviewTitle: Great monitor but needed some adjusting to tilt
name: stacken

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
reviewBody: I bought this for my wife's home office to be a second screen for her Macbook Pro. Have had no issues what so ever. I used a HDMI cable to link them and everything works great. No issues with ghosting or blacking out at random like others. I plan to use as a second screen for my streaming while I game on my new gaming rig that I have built.
reviewTitle: Works great for what I wanted.
name: mchone14

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
reviewBody: I ordered these monitors for my home office. I received the monitors within two days of placing the order. I was surprised to see how nicely they were packed. Also, I was surprised, when I picked it out of the box, how light and slim the monitor was.Setting up the monitors was easy, especially as the instruction manual provided step-by-step instructions with pictures. I set it up with my docking station for my surface pro. It worked when I connected my surface in the docking station. It took only a couple of seconds to detect the connection and start displaying. As promised, the picture quality was great. I was also impressed with the viewing angle and brightness. Also it detects unplugging of the surface in few seconds and switches to power saving mode. I was so impressed that I even it to my colleagues.
reviewTitle: Best Monitors i have used so far
name: kamal

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020
reviewBody: I was temporarily using a 32" hdtv as my monitor but when I got a new desktop with a good graphics card, not only did the tv give an invalid format message, but it was clearly going to be inadequate. I was shopping between this one and a slightly larger ips monitor that was $20 more but went with this one and the 75 MHz. It absolutely does not disappoint.Some comments complained about the volume on the speakers. Mine didn't even come with speakers and I don't care because I have a much more potent speaker/subwoofer setup. I was totally fine that the monitor was just a monitor.It tilts. Others complain that it doesn't. It does.This is a fantastic monitor. When I realized I'd need to get a monitor, I figured I'd be shelling out 300+ for one, but this one more than fits the bill for now and is priced under $100
reviewTitle: $90 is a steal for this monitor. It does not have speakers
name: Baron of Colier

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021
reviewBody: My daughter plays a lot of games but she also does a lot of digital art so I needed a monitor that would do well at both. This monitor fit the bill. It has a fast enough response time that 99% of gamers would be fine with while also having a bright and colorful display. For the price range, this is a great monitor that will satisfy most users. If you are a professional artist or videophile, you would probably want something a bit more expensive than this one.
name: E. Summers

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
reviewBody: I've now purchased three of these monitors and recommended them to others. I think it's a great deal. I originally purchased at the beginning of quarantine, so I could work from home, but also purchased for my niece and nephew for virtual classes this fall. The monitor is super thin and lightweight. It comes well packaged, and is easy to assemble. I know there was debate in other reviews about the tilt - it DOES tilt, it's just a little stiff. I don't know anything about what's needed in a monitor for gaming, but I've used it for graphic design and felt the picture quality, color, and brightness were excellent.
name: A Hughes

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
reviewBody: These monitors are really good. The thin frame give you a large screen without the bulk, and picture quality is great. The only draw back I've found is the rear mounting connection. If you're going to keep this monitor on its stand, you'll be fine. However, if you plan on mounting this moitor on the wall or on a different stand, DO NOT BUY. The design of the mounting location seriously limits the types of mounts you can use, and requires the purchase of a 'conversion' bracket. This will really throw off your mounting plans and makes the monitors clumsy and awkward. I own two of these monitors, and although I really like them, I'm looking to replace them for monitors that more appropriately mount to my dual monitor wall mount. It's too bad they didn't just design them with the traditional 4-hole mounting plate on the back. But, to reiterate; they're great monitors, and if you're planning to use the desktop stand that comes with them, you'll like them.
name: Dave Watson

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2020
reviewBody: When this monitor first arrived, the packaging was pristine and the monitor fit snugly in the packaging. The setup was extremely easy. The base and the neck of the base come detached from the screen, and they just slide together very easy with no tools required. When you turn it on, it autoscans to find what inputs you have plugged in. This feature can be turned off in the menu. The menu is simple to learn and easy to navigate. You can set the brightness, contrast, etc. manually, but there are also a number of preset profiles you can choose from. The screen can be made to be very bright if you like it that way, but if you're more comfortable with a more dim setting, it's easy to adjust. The color is very good too. The picture of the screen doesn't quite do the real-life experience justice, but the colors are captured very well. I have absolutely no complaints about this screen and will be buying 2 more next month. At $90, which is the price I bought this at, I really have no reason not to buy more. None of my friends believe me when I tell them the price of this screen, particularly after they've seen me gaming on it.
name: King David Westerkov

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
reviewBody: Okay guys this is going to be really simple here my kid has been gaming on a regular small TV since I built him a PC I saw this and said what do I have to lose it's a hundred bucks and holy crap when it got here I was blown away this thing is 100% worth the money you're not gaming at 144 hurts but the 75 Hertz is adequate and the picture is unreal I'm waiting for this thing to blow up or something because I can't imagine why it is this cheap buy it while you can the price is already gone up
name: Joseph Karaffa

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
reviewBody: I'm a teleworker on a budget and was looking for a low cost second moniter for my riser desk. I thought no way should something this inexpensive be getting all of these high reviews, it's gotta be some high level scam! Well I'm here to tell you that you can indeed believe the reviews, this is bang-for-the-buck perfect, this monitor has it all. The colors are rich and they do pop, the text is crisp and the response time fast. I literally plugged it in and my laptop synced up with zero effort on my part. I'm not a gamer so I have no opinion on that but if you're just looking for a monitor to just simply get work done then this is the best deal by far. For anyone on a tight budget this monitor gets my highest recommendation.
name: sonicseer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2016
reviewBody: I bought 3 of these monitors for my workstation setup and they look really great. I don't have to repeat the advantages of these monitors since there are already a lot of reviews which do that. I like these monitors and they are great for the price and so I have given it 5 stars. However, this monitor is not without its issues.1. It has no VESA mount option. So you cannot mount it on a stand. You will need to spend on something like this
reviewTitle: Great monitor but design issues for multi monitor setup
name: priyanka yuvaraj

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
reviewBody: to get it on a stand2. It has a protruding bottom panel which makes it difficult to bring them close to each other in a multi monitor setup where the monitors are angled. This defeats the thin bezel advantage. When the monitors are placed in a straight line, the thin bezel looks good.Check the image to see what I mean.Again, in spite of these issues the monitors look amazing.
name: Robert

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2021
reviewBody: Price performance hgh. packaging very good. assembly instructions rather poor, to non existent. Monitor controls barely adequate. but this does not affect the long term use if item. Asus is a company that produces adequate products but support is really horrendous. Monitors, and such rarely require support, but if you anticipate needing anything beyond downloadable documentation stay away. they are also very inflexible. and legalistic in their interpretation of their responsibilities regarding consumers. Customer support, is very low priority and their ultimate response will be no response to any issues that may arise.
name: customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
reviewBody: I purchased two of these monitors for my home office several months ago. They have performed well and function fine for routine office work (Zoom, MS Office, etc). Refresh rate would be far too slow for any serious gamer. Picture quality works fine, though when I sit down at my Mac after working on my office computer all day, I can easily see a huge difference in the picture quality. If you're looking for a reasonably priced, dependable monitor for your home office, these are a good choice.
name: Mydogissupersmart

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2019
reviewBody: I received the monitor quickly ( a couple of days) and was excited to set it up. It needed the stand attached to the scvreen. Unfortunatly the bracket that would make this possible was missing. The reason I'm giving the unit five stars is the wonderful response of product support. I called them and told them of the problem and they immediately sent a replacement. I sent the broken monitor back the next day and got the replacement the day after that. Also I love the monitory. It is replacing an old Acer that I have had for many years that finally died. I didn't know knew monitors could be so much better at half the price.
name: Bartly',s 10 inch

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2021
reviewBody: This Acer has good quality at a low price but be forewarned. I bought this monitor to use as a second monitor for the junky one they gave us at work - so you could have one document open on one screen and a different document open on the second screen. Makes life a lot easier. The problem is the Acer only has 3 hookups in the back: Power connection, VGA (blue pin connectors) and HDMI connector. My old work stuff will not support HDMI and has one DCI hookup and one VGA hookup and Some USB hookups. I've been having a difficult time trying to get around trying to getting both to run on VGA since I only have the single VGA hookup on my laptop docking station. Trying all the cable adapter configs. Bottom line is the monitor is great but if you are trying to run 2 of them off of some old gear, you might run into problems with what can I hook into what since they don't give you a lot of options.
reviewTitle: Good but wish it had more hookups
name: Stephen R Beckner

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021
reviewBody: I bought this for my son to connect to this Chromebook when he is doing virtual schooling. We really liked the size and slim design which saves space on his desk. However it wouldn’t work using HDMI cables to his Chromebook so we had to use VGA cables. I found out he wasn’t using it very much because if it was connected the sound would not play on his Chromebook. The picture quality connected to the Chromebook also wasn’t great. We ended up switching it out with the screen he used for his XBOX. We did not experience any of the same problems connected to the XBOX that we did with the Chromebook. The Dell monitor connected to the Chromebook worked just fine.
name: choeper

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2019
reviewBody: The screen is very high quality for the price and the zero bezel design is appealing to look at. The IPS panel gives it a large range of viewing angles and the refresh rate was good but nothing near gaming quality. My only issues I have with this monitor is that I have a pair of them hooked up to my docking station for my work laptop and either the laptop or the work station seems to be forcing the incorrect aspect ratio which either makes me cut the screen size to scale it properly or lose text and images. I think this is because the monitors seem to have built in bezels that keep it from being truly "bezel free". The other issue was that the stands that come with the monitors are not very adjustable with the two of mine for some reason being at different heights even though they have the same stands and angle which is irritating but nothing major.
name: Josh

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2021
reviewBody: I have purchased this monitor 4 times in the span of 2 years for myself, my sister and my dad. They were around the $90-93 price range. I gotta say, for the price, I am very satisfied with how well it's done for me. My family also has no complaints using this monitor with their own PC's. The bottom base of the monitor is super easy to install. No built-in speakers, but if you use external speakers and a headset like me, you don't even need/want them. As I mentioned in the title, these are not VESA-mountable so if you're looking to mount these monitors, look elsewhere.Some of my main games are League, Apex, Monster Hunter: World, Final Fantasy XIV, Final Fantasy XV, and Call of Duty: Black Ops 3. This is a decent range of graphics intensive and non-graphics intensive games. I had zero issues with response times and frame rates. They all run smoothly with my GTX 1060 (as long as you play on medium-ish settings). Sure the colors aren't mind-blowing but I don't care at all. I personally think it kicks ass for the price.When it comes to non-gaming stuff, like school or work, there's not really much to ask for other than a monitor that can turn on and work, and this monitor is definitely capable of doing everyday tasks. The 75hz is also very nice.I don't use these monitors anymore as I have upgraded my setup, but I should mention that during the last few months of using these monitors (I had a dual monitor setup), one of the screens randomly goes black every now and then, then turns back on. It can get pretty annoying and can even cost you during crucial moments in-game.Other than that, this monitor was part of my first gaming PC build and I am still very happy for how much it has done for me. A very solid start, whether you're a gamer like me who can't afford an expensive monitor or if you simply need a cheap but good monitor that can get the job done.
reviewTitle: if you're a budget gamer like me and don't care for VESA mounting, this monitor is for you
name: Tyler Nguyen

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2020
reviewBody: Finally replaced my still-functioning 11-year-old (April 2008 MFR date) Acer 22-inch monitor that was dim and only running 1680x1050. This new monitor appears to be great quality, and with my last Acer product still functioning after over a decade, I am sure this new one will last for many years as well. Some have said it doesn't have an ISO mount, which is true, but I didn't need that. Also, if you are looking to bump 2 of these together, even though it appears to be very minimal frame, there's still a good 3/8" border on the top, left and right, so that would be a pretty noticeable gap. Similarly, the refresh rate is only 60Hz (it's not a gaming monitor), but it's priced as such. Lucky for me, I just needed a larger screen for my laptop and this fulfills that need quite nicely. Highly recommended for a very good budget monitor.
name: Ryan Petersen

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2019
reviewBody: I couldn't believe good freesync monitors exist for under $100, but here I am now using this monitor. The picture is really good, but I had to tweak the settings a bit to get it to look just right. It looks great on my desk and it can get very bright, so I recommend turning the brightness to 50% or lower.Edit: multiple dead pixels, and a cluster of dead pixels near the center. This display doesn't last
name: Nanachi Hantomei

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020
reviewBody: The monitor arrived a day earlier than anticipated and we are now ready to work out of our new home office. My wife has a new demanding job and was required to work from home for several weeks. The job preferred dual monitor capability, so I went shopping for a quality monitor with a good reputation. Well it certainly met the challenge. We now have a great dual monitor system and my wife certainly enjoys working from home for an uncertain period of time. Whatever the times require we will be prepared, as I set up her new office and updated my own office as well, both with dual monitors.Simple to install and instructions that are written in easy to follow steps. Now up and running two dual screen home offices, for little cost.
reviewTitle: Great Price and Great Quality for that ruched new Home Office
name: Bob

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021
