reviewBody: I purchased this along with my first pc build. I was on a tight budget, and with the quantity and quality of reviews this thing had, I figured it was a worthwhile purchase. Once the tower was built, I plugged in my computer (HDMI from the graphics card interface), and was greeted with the message "input not supported". After some research, I learned that I needed to update my display drivers to output HDMI, but, in order to do that, I'd need to get the machine running and install windows, and to do that I'd need to use a monitor. I could have used the Mini DP output on my graphics card, but I learned that the monitor didn't have a Mini DP input. Several hours later, with the help of another borrowed monitor, I was finally able to update the drivers and use this one. All that toil and trouble to see an adequate picture, at max brightness.In short, if you need a Mini DP port, don't use this monitor. For everyone else, this is a good choice for starter monitors, but don't hope to get a great deal. You get what you pay for, and so you might want to hold off on purchasing this, or using it as a second monitor.
reviewTitle: You Get What You Pay For
name: jacob g.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2021
reviewBody: Wow, I was shocked at how easily and quickly I was able to set up a second monitor for my late 2015 27 inch iMac!Because my iMac is an older model, I had to purchase a Mini DisplayPort (Thunderbolt) to HDMI Cable.This is the one I bought and it worked GREAT: iVanky Mini DisplayPort (Thunderbolt) to HDMI Cable.https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0757JWW81/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1Please note: This cable WILL NOT WORK WITH THUNDERBOLT 3 (USB-C) Macs. This cable is for older models.The product description page for this item will list exactly which mac models are compatible with this cable/adapter.Here's my experience with connecting the Acer monitor to my iMac:1. I connected the Thunderbolt (aka Mini Display port) to the back of my iMac.2. After placing the monitor on my desk next to my mac, I connected the HDMI end of the iVanky cable to the Acer monitor. I then plugged the monitor into an outlet.3. I turned the Acer monitor on AND IT AUTOMATICALLY displayed as a second monitor WITHOUT me having to go into my macs system preferences to set anything up!It...just WORKED!I'm using this monitor ONLY to display documents, browser windows and other reference materials while I study online so I can't speak to the picture quality or any other technical aspects. I just know it was a breeze to set up as a second monitor to an older iMac. But picture looks fine and colors look great.Just remember to get a Mini Display (Thunderbolt 1 or 2 NOT 3) to HDMI cable like the one I mentioned.FYI this came with a VGA cable only.
reviewTitle: FOR OLDER MAC MODELS: Works Seamlessly with late 2015 27inch iMac But You MUST buy an adapter
name: Vivian C.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
reviewBody: I bought this to replace an older LG monitor that I use for my Acer laptop. My old monitor was connected via the HDMI cable to the hdmi port on my Acer laptop. Oddly, this new monitor refuses to be recognized on the hdmi port, so I had to use the vga port and cable. While I don’t see any difference visually, it annoys me that I have to use an older technology, to get it to work properly. And yes, I’ve verified that the hdmi port on the laptop works by connecting it to another monitor. Since it works and displays properly via VGA, I didn’t really feel like sending it back and getting something else a little bit pricier.
reviewTitle: nice image but my laptop wouldn’t recognize it on HDMI port.
name: MCSE

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
reviewBody: Wanted an external monitor for my home office—something inexpensive, yet crisp, clear and lightweight enough to hang it from a VESA attachment arm without worrying about it's weight. This one from Acer delivered everything awesome, except for one thing: Apparently Acers aren't natively compatible with the VESA arms...which didn't end up being a problem at all thanks to this $30 adapter bracket made for exactly this—to make Acer monitors usable by fancy VESA-style monitor arms: https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B07XPJ5CF6/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o02_s00
reviewTitle: 👊 Sweet Monitor—crisp, clear, simple & super light
name: JP & Kara

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2020
reviewBody: First in the middle of the "work from home" pandemic, and got a monitor. Turns out I needed a cable. I just got a HDMI to HDMI cable, but had I tried to use the VGA one I would have needed a VGA to HDMI adapter to make it work. The HDMI to HDMI is great because I can use it with my TV too when I go back to the office. The monitor itself is great, clear bright. Someone said small text is fuzzy and my Team site chats have that small text...so yes just a little, but nothing you can't read. you can read it just fine. For the price I think this is a good deal, but add $10 for your cable or adapter, and hope Amazon can hire the delivery folks as fast as we are all ordering. Thank you all out there working so hard. I am in the greater Seattle area, and it is all shut down. Be safe!
reviewTitle: May need a cabel HDMI or VGA adapter
name: Susan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
reviewBody: I have two of these monitors and I like them well enough.They are slow to turn on, and show a lot of green and white static and flicker for a few seconds initially. When the Acer logo pops up the light leaks are obvious, but once I get to my home screen and get to work (engineering software/matlab and typing) it isn't noticeable. (Using a brand new Mac mini for what it's worth.)Overall, good for my purpose at this price. The only annoying thing was buying VESA adaptors in order to hang them above my desk. These are lightweight enough that there is no reason they shouldn't have the VESA plate built in already.
reviewTitle: Light leaks galore and slow when turning on
name: Kail Miller

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
reviewBody: With all the positive reviews posted.... the unit I got was a lemon.Apparently acer has a quality control issue with the display panels as indicated by others as well. The monitor I received had a large white bleed out from the bottom left side and the pixels were very visible from your typical desk length when watching a video--Haven't had this issue with other monitors of the same or larger screen size. Every time I watch a video or play a game, there would be a white glow covering the bottom left corner (approximately 5x3 in) which is very annoying and takes away form the experience.Hopefully you will receive a unit with less defects. It looks really slick.
name: JACKjack

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2019
reviewBody: Same model, same settings, everything. The one I bought last year looks good and the new one looks terrible. The contrast ratio, brightness, everything looks worse on the new model. The whites are yellow on the new one and cool on the old one despite both being on 'warm'. I have them side by side at the same PC so its really noticeable. I am used to monitors having slight variances in color temp but this one is awful. Apparently they went with a cheaper display to reduce cost.
reviewTitle: Bought one last year and one this year....
name: DavidP

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2020
reviewBody: This monitor would be really great, but I believe that I was sent a faulty refurbished version. Right out of the box, the screen was flickery and terrible, but I adjusted the refresh rate and it looked great — one one side. The other side was still dark and horrible on the eyes. I contacted Acer customer support and when I gave them the serial number, they asked me to confirm that the purchase date. According to them, this monitor was purchased 9/19/19. I purchased it 3/12/20, brand new. Fishy? Definitely. This monitor is clearly a refurb, and upon further inspection, I noticed that the screws had sharpie marks on them as if they were being checked by an refurb inspection team. There was no disclosure that this item was used. I'm super annoyed and distrustful of this seller.
reviewTitle: Was sent a faulty, used monitor. Buyer beware.
name: Alyssa

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
reviewBody: Working from home on my laptop. I'm used to three monitors at work, it was a pain to unhook one to use in my home office. I purchased this on the cheap and I don't regret it. It's my work from home during Covid monitor. I only wish I bought it sooner, but I was being cheap! Not sure how it would hold up for gaming and all that, but it's fine for what I need to do. I have a gaming laptop next to it in the photo, and the colors seem a little off on the monitor. I have it in graphics mode on the covid monitor to make it brighter. I'm not complaining for under $80 bucks. Monitor is super lightweight, setup in less than 5 minutes from unboxing. Monitor tilts. Does not come with HDMI cable.
name: Katie B

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019
reviewBody: It was better than I excepted. The screen looks nice though control it was kinda tricky. I usually see 60hz 720p but this looks nice. I don't get why people want 144p 4k displays, this was good anoth. It's cheap and I didn't realize that it had no speakers. So if you looking for ones with speakers, I suggest get this and buy speakers. Soundboards and Internal Speakers makes it so much more expensive. Also if you looking to plug in lots of things. Get a dock, haven't tried it but it only has 1x VGA, HDMI. So looks before you buy and leave bad reviews for the display doing it's job. Would of been nice if this model at least had a remote or audio port.
reviewTitle: Wow.... I at a lost of words.
name: Tarsteel

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2018
reviewBody: Nice monitor, especially for the price! I bought this monitor in November of 2015. About 2 years later the settings buttons would turn off the screen when trying to adjust settings. Acer promptly addressed my concerns and had me sent the monitor back, they then replaced it with a new one. I've been shopping for a 144hz monitor for gaming, but found I can set this monitor to 77hz in the Nvidia Control panel using my GTX1080 graphics card. It will also run at 70hz, but every other frequency including 75hz will not show a picture, just a gray screen. It does take about a minute longer to show a picture when waking from sleep at the higher frequency, but no problems after that. There is definitely a noticeable increase in FPS gaming response compared to 60hz. It does have some backlight bleed in the corners, but only really noticeable on startup for me. The colors are nice, screen is bright, and viewing angles are good as well.
name: Gullzway

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
reviewBody: After about 2 weeks of working from home, I was lost without a second monitor. After a quick search on Amazon, I found this and it has been great. I've been able to setup a home office and I feel twice as productive - this is even larger than my monitor at work. I absolutely love this when I'm working in Excel or Tableau so I can have a larger view of the data set, tool bars, and reporting fields.
reviewTitle: Easy setup, great picture - great value for $$
name: Erin

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020
reviewBody: It is a really nice starter PC if you would want to get into gaming. It is great for its price. 75 hertz is pretty much all you need for gaming. There isn't much of a settings or menu for the monitor to adjust anything. There are only two video ports: HDMI & VGA. Prices do rise and drop at times of demand. I bought at 80 U.S dollars.PROS: Inexpensive, 75 Hertz, Great picture quality.CONS: No settings, Non-mountableThe cons aren't really important too me. The way I see this monitor is as a starter monitor and than after a while, i would get a new and better high quality end monitor and than set up dual monitor and I would use this one for Twitch chat and other non gaming things.But.. that is going to take a while for me...
name: Raul Veliz

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
reviewBody: We chose to keep out kids home this year to do all virtual learning. We needed a bigger screen to attached to the 13" Chromebook provided by the district. This 21" monitor has made the world of a difference for my 8yo son who is in 3rd grade. I was able to plug this monitor in by its HDMI port right into the Chromebook. After a few minutes in the display setting of the Chromebook, we were up and running.Having his class on the smaller screen and his classwork on the bigger screen make for a much easier school day!Great value and quality for under $100.Two thumbs way up from me!
name: Brawl Dog

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2019
reviewBody: Setup was easy. There is the ring base, the short upright bar, and the monitor. Put the ring base and upright bar together first. Then place the monitor onto the upright bar. It will not easily go in all the way. Just place the base on a flat, solid surface, hold the monitor by the top and press down. It should snap into place.It's basically plug and plag, however, the controls are awarkedly placed at the bottom righthand side of the monitor, so it's difficult to determine what you're manipulating. I don't really find this a big problem since I leave the monitor in the always "on" position, so I don't have to always locate the controls.The main problem is that the stand is not adjustable. I'm fairly tall, so the tilt of the monitor on the stand is not the best for me. I had to adjust this by placing a wooden block beneath the front of the ring base.If the monitor tilt was adjustable, or if the monitor could be easily connected to a wall-mount, I would have given it 5 stars.
name: Bob409

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
reviewBody: hooked up to laptop at work desk. plugged into HDMI and came right up set to max performance settings and max viewing area. use as companion screen for 17" laptop for business. also watch some YouTubeTV on it and the picture is really good. no noticeable lag and color looks true. great packaging and easy to set up. no noticeable missing pixels on screen. HDMI setup uses a USB-C splitter with no degraded quality noticed as i did use for a short while plugged direct to the computer HDMI
reviewTitle: good monitor for work (not used for gaming)
name: S Lewis

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
reviewBody: I really had a hard time finding a monitor for my new gaming pc it's my first one so i watched on youtube and this one was recommended so I took the shot and bought its and honeslty it's a great damm monitor I bout 2 for dual set up and they work great i didnt think it would be good for games but it runs apex legends beautiful i even bought another 1 for my gf for her gaming pc and she loved it to I highly recommend this I got it 1 day after ordering so I'm very happy
name: connie m. ford

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020
reviewBody: It would be so easy for them to provide an adapter so that it could be mounted on a VESA monitor mount, but they do not. HumanCentric VESA Mount Adapter Bracket for Acer Monitors works well, needs washers when mounting.
reviewTitle: Does not support VESA - use HumanCentric VESA Mount Adapter Bracket
name: kj

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021
reviewBody: When I first set this thing on my papers to keep them from blowing off my writing table as I enjoy the cool breeze of an open window, I thought, "This seems a little too large for the job; its cumbersome even." As I pondered sending it back down the mountain on the next mule train, the fair-headed shepherdess wrapped gently at my door."Mountain man! Oh Mountain man! Will you tell me another one of your stories? The ones you write and people in the valley read?" She asked as if I would say "no" to such a sweet request.In response, I opened the cottage door and brushed my old, gray, wiry hair out of the way so the young lass could see my eyes smiling as I said, "Welcome again child."But as I opened the door a gust of wind nearly knocked me over. The whole house seemed upset by the blow and papers were flying this way and that. Once I gathered myself I looked at the new paperweight and thanked heaven it was larger than most and sturdy too.My guest chattered on about weather and the unknowns of rogue gusts in the Alps while she tidied up for me. I had just poured myself a pint of brew and seated myself to recover from the mishap, when the young lass commented, "Cool paper weight."
reviewTitle: Can you imagine a cooler paper weight?
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2019
reviewBody: I got two of these monitors for my dual-monitor setup because of the large size and stability of the base. My brother uses a pair of these with his computer and I really liked them so I chose the same for mine. There's a small gap between the two monitors (see photo) at the bottom edge because the screens are tilted downward a little, and this tilt is non-adjustable. That, and assembly (see below) are my only quibbles. Versatile use with HDMI, DMI and VGA connections, but not for the latest 4K systems, which is fine because I don't have anything in 4K. Beautiful color, clarity and spacious viewing area is perfect for my multi-tasking needs. They play very nicely with Windows 10 as well, truly "plug and play" easy.Assembly was a bit tricky because apparently it used to be shipped with the base pre-attached (according to the printed instructions), but it no longer comes that way and there are no detailed instructions on how to put the base on. I did finally figure out how to snap it into place.
reviewTitle: Matched Pair for Dual Monitor Setup
name: Yvan Strong

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2016
reviewBody: I'm quite impressed with these monitors. The bezel on the top, left, and right edges is very thin, making for an excellent multi-monitor setup. The brightness and color are nice, as well. Since I'm using these for a home office setup, I have no idea about their performance for gaming. Perhaps someone else can comment on that use case. These monitors are pretty thin and lightweight, and the power brick? Wow! These consume so little power that their power brick is super small.It's smaller than a pack of cards, which is a welcome change. Could they have integrated the power supply into the monitor? Sure, but having it separate does aid the user in determining what has gone wrong if the monitor suddenly stops working. Whether power supply replacements will be available after the warranty period is another question, but if you're like me, you've got a drawer full of power supplies with the same voltage, same barrel connector, and same or greater current capacity, so finding a replacement, even for testing, is just an exercise in rummaging through the spares bin.
name: Mr. Bananaface

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020
reviewBody: I purchased this monitor, as I will be working from home for an extended period during the pandemic. PROs:Slim frame, not heavy, easy setup, reasonably priced, blue light reduction option, cables were included (HDMI, VGA, and a simple power cord) - not having special cards is a plus if you happen to misplace the ones provided.CONs:The back of the monitor is not equipped to have a plate for mounting. (After purchasing, I realized getting it off the desk would allow more workspace.) So, I had to buy an adapter for the desk mount.The monitor does not have speakers - which may be a deal breaker for some.Ultimately, I would likely repurchase, if needed.
name: Lisa D

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2019
reviewBody: OK, this is not quite up to the standard that our $300 monitor is, but for the price this is an amazing monitor. Very clear, easy to read, no flicker etc.It has a nice tilt feature that is stiff enough that the screen holds steady, but not so stiff that you would worry about damaging the screen when adjusting it.It only comes with the power cord and VGA cable. It does not come with an HDMI cable. I knew this when I bought it, so I ordered the cable when I ordered the monitor.It's only been 5 days since I received and hooked up the monitor, so I can't speak to its longevity, but so far so good. I am very happy with my decision to purchase this monitor. If at any time that decision changes, this post will be edited immediately.
reviewTitle: For the price, this monitor is great!
name: Tracy J

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2020
reviewBody: This monitor worked great until suddenly a line appeared straight down the middle of the screen less than 2 months after I received it. I called Amazon support and they connected me to Acer. It's a hardware failure, so now I have to go find a box to ship it in and pay for shipping to get it fixed. Amazon's 30-day return policy is not enough for computer hardware. Next time I plan to buy hardware from somewhere like Costco that has a better return policy if anything goes wrong. Dealing with the manufacturer's warranty returns is a big pain. The one star is for a combo of a defective product and a lack of a reasonable return policy at Amazon.
reviewTitle: Worked great, until it didn't (after less than 2 months)
name: M. Keating

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020
reviewBody: It arrived sooner than I expected and was well packed. VGA cable included. The HD resolution, color and clarity of this monitor blows me away. This is a steal at this price! I thought I may have trouble reading small text with this monitor but the image is so clear I feel like my glasses actually work better. The ultra-thin zero frame provides a finished touch that would impress a picky minimalist. Super thin and lightweight. Very well made. Couldn't be more pleased.
name: Larry

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2021
reviewBody: I was close to returning this monitor because I was experiencing the intermittent off/on problems that other users have reported. However, I fixed the problem, and I now am keeping the screen. I think it's a good product for the money.I am using this monitor with a docking station for my laptop. I initially used an HDMI-to-VGA converter to then connect a VGA cable to the monitor. The VGA cable was the one shipped with this monitor. That setup was very problematic. The display quality was okay but not great, but the real problem was that the screen intermittently turned off and on, multiple times per hour. It was unworkable.Today, I went to Walgreens and bought a simple, 6-ft HDMI cable (HDMI plug on both sides, it is not a converter). I plugged the HDMI cable directly between my docking station and this Acer monitor. The image quality is now very stable and greatly improved. I also have not experienced the intermittent off-on issue, even though I have been watching movies with heavy graphics (e.g., I tested it with a trailer for World of Warcraft).So there you have it. This is a pretty cheap and pretty good product if you use an HDMI cable. I gave it four stars because it does not work well with the HDMI-to-VGA converter. Even so, I am happy with the product.
name: Kindle Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020
reviewBody: This Acer with Windows 10 is now my desktop computer and I like it. Operates well. My computer guy who works all over this city helped order it for me and I am very pleased with his choice. He knows I spend every night at least 4 to 5 hours on computer going thru hundreds of e:mails, doing Photoshop and my computer is like a companion. Looks just like advertised on Amazon where you can read specs. Could not imagine being without it.I also had a 10-1/2 or 11" small ACER TRAVEL COMPUTER which I carried along in my carry-on to many international countries and had it for many years. I like Acer Computers.
reviewTitle: ACER DESK TOP IS A VERY GOOD COMPUTER
name: ORCHIDLADY1

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
reviewBody: I will second what other reviews have written about ghosting. Disable the OD feature and we have had no problems with Ghosting.We have used it for a few weeks now with no problems. No on and off experiences, no restarting but never turning on problems, no ghosting.I'm an every day user but I'm not an expert on screens for a computer. I just want to be able to turn it on and it works. I want it to have a nice picture that look realistic to my expectations. I want it to be sturdy and not have the feel of breaking if I tap on it. This meets that criteria.
name: apoem

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020
reviewBody: For the price, I love it. The only thing I didn’t pay attention to was the fact it DOES NOT come with built in speakers nor a port to plug in external speakers; which I’m fine with but didn’t realize until after I set it up. No biggie though, you can purchase speakers to plug into the CPU ( I also use my laptop speakers or headphones for gaming [switch/ps4])It is a good monitor, colors are decent and has options/modes to adjust. I bought a multi-port hdmi cable since it only has one hdmi input but I’m satisfied with the product for what I paid. No dead pixels, design is clean and slim.
name: Mariah Shaffer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2020
reviewBody: I bought two of these monitors for the new home office, since working from home is now in style. For $90 a piece, this is probably the best bargain monitor I've ever purchased. The 1080p panel makes those work emails look just as smooth as they do at the real office. I ended up buying a couple HDMI to DisplayPort adapter because my docking station didn't support HDMI, but these monitors still displayed what they needed to display without a problem, even through the displayport adapter.Pros:InexpensiveGenuine 1080pLightweight and thinPower brick has a long cordPerfect for generic office or school work (emails, spreadsheets, documents, random coding etc.)Includes a VGA cable in the event you didn't already have 20 of themColor reproduction is good enough for most tasks.Cons:Did notice some light bleeding along the edges of both monitors, nothing serious though, but it's there.These monitors do live up to the "ultra-thin" name, but zero frame is a stretch. The bezels definitely look bigger in person than they do in those promotion pictures.
reviewTitle: Best solution for a home-office/WFH set up
name: Patrick Claude

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2019
reviewBody: The attached picture shows the blurry text that only started happening after switching from my tv to this. I changed no settings other than making text bigger after switching from my tv to this so why are things so grainy and blurry with this "number 1 ranked" monitor? I only bought this monitor to help my eyes.. I have bad eyesight and as I age it's getting worse. Going from a 43 inch tv to a 21inch monitor is difficult but It's helped me enjoy streaming more since I still use my tv for streaming. It's helped me play LoL better because now I don't have to look two feet to the side anymore lol. I am disappointed with how hard it is to clean the screen. My tv screen is also hard but it never absorbed water(maybe my tv has a coating or something). I wish I would have known this screen absorbs things before I tried to clean it.. Made a permanent smudge(maybe its not permanent and I just don't know what cleaner I'm supposed to use on screens). I had old monitors that were SO easy to clean the screens(LCD flat panels..). Since I've been using this monitor and keeping my tablets blue light filter on I have not had a single eye strain related eye twitch. I just wish it were capable of being cleaned and that things weren't so GRAINY. The only reason why I'm not sending it back is because it's clearly helping my eyes not get as strained..... I would have given it less stars if I didn't care about my eyesight as much. I can confirm it has tilt but I couldn't figure out how to get the tilt to STAY tilted without re screwing those two screws back in(which made it not tilt anymore lol..) So I wedged a Popsicle stick in it to keep it SECURELY tilted. Luckily I can't see the eyesore when using the monitor even with it tilted back. I'm not sure why it takes 6 seconds for this monitor to turn on. My entire pc only takes 13 and its 8 years old(with a newer nvidia gpu that makes me want to go back to amd sometimes). I wish the power light didn't blink when in standby mode. I'd love to not turn this monitor off when I'm not using it because it goes to standby mode very quickly after my pc is off and only uses 0.05 watts more than being off and plugged into outlet but that blinking power light is too annoying.
name: John H

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020
reviewBody: I did not realize the monitor is not wired for sound on the monitor itself. Our Xbox 360 does not have sound either, so my granddaughter got no sound when she played her disks. I am a granny who is not very knowledgeable about gaming, or I guess I would have known that. But otherwise it's a pretty good monitor. It's a bit too light for my liking. Not as sturdy as I would like. I would not buy it again. I used it hooked up to my desktop computer for a while and i found it to be too big for the computer, and again, a little too light and shaky.
name: Sarah

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020
reviewBody: Was on a budget, needed a second monitor, this is what I ended up settling on. Picture quality out of the box was great but colors seemed a bit.. dark, I calibrated it enough to be bearable but it's still a bit darker than my 1st monitor. It doesn't bother me too much as I use this monitor for my xbox. I definitely wouldn't use this for artwork though as it seems darker/warmer than my current monitor by a landslide. (Unless, I am just terrible at calibrating)This monitor doesn't appear to have speakers either, which I don't really mind as I'm using headphones 90% of the timeOverall a solid budget monitor for gaming, however I may upgrade it to a second asus monitor so I can have 2 monitors with the same colors as I'm also a graphic designer student :)
name: SITKAFREE

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020
reviewBody: I needed a monitor that I could move around and was small enough to work in my tiny Brooklyn apartment shared with my partner and cat. My setup is on my dining room table but I also sometimes may need to move into the bedroom. Just plugged it in and its immediately good to go. Works great with my 2019 MacBook pro. Got an HDMI - USB-C cable. I honestly don't know too much about computers so if you don't either and just need something to work from during social distancing this is a great choice!
name: mia

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2015
reviewBody: I'd say this is the best purchase you can make if you're on a low budget for an IPS monitor (meaning it's better for your eyes and not meant for gaming). It's bright and clear with no dead pixels. As someone has posted before a couple corners on the screen seem to glow a little when you have dark images on the monitor but are not noticeable if you have brighter images on the screen (not something that really bothers me whatsoever). I think this is happening because the screens aren't perfectly straight when you look over the top of the screen from the side (almost as if you're looking down a rod to see if it's straight). They are slightly warped but not enough to notice unless you're really looking for it... I think it's causing pinching in the corners and affecting the lighting. These are things you should expect if you're spending only $130 for some large IPS monitors so I have no complaints about these issues and overall the picture is great for the price.If you have more to spend, go for the BenQ IPS monitors... and if you're looking for a gaming monitor then this is not for you. You'll want a TN monitor for that with a faster refresh rate as IPS monitors usually don't have fast refresh rates (this one is only 60hz).I'll be sure to update if anything goes wrong with them.
reviewTitle: Best IPS monitor for a low budget
name: Michael903

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2019
reviewBody: Worked great until this week....just one week outside the return/exchange window. Today I fire it up and have a row of dead pixels about an inch from the bottom bezel. Stuck pixel videos/repairs did not help after running for over an hour on loop. Other than the dead pixels it has been a decent monitor for the price-- one that I will now have to replace before my OCD gets the best of me and I throw it out a window.
reviewTitle: Great....till just outside the return window.
name: USAF99

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2020
reviewBody: This was an excellent way to get a pair of nice monitors for my work-at-home setup. The monitors are very light, but the base keeps them very stable. I would give them five stars, but the monitors have external power bricks. It makes it very hard to have a very clean look to your space, since the bricks are hard to hide. I had to take away a star for that, but I'm very pleased with my purchase.
name: KARL LEWIS

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2016
reviewBody: Warning before you buy: This monitor has a well known backlight bleeding problem that appears to be present in everyone's purchase of this model monitor. It's still a good deal if you are viewing an image with full color borders but if you are watching a show with dark corners around the edge in a dark room it's pretty apparent. I think I can get over this problem as the price was so loe, however.
name: Daniel

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
reviewBody: I got this recently to replace my bad ASUS monitor.Connecting to my Macbook pro 2016 is a not an awesome experience. Connecting to my PC is a good experience. The selling price is truly a deal! Love sub-100$ price tag! I miss the DVI input badly, and connected using Analog port (for my office laptop). I prefer the former. Text has a minute pink tinge on it, which is odd for me, and it is consistent. I've also ordered a 34" monitor and make this a secondary. I can't comment on gaming experience. I'll update my experience.
reviewTitle: My Present Monitor! Excellent value for money!!
name: Frugal Amazonian!

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2019
reviewBody: I bought this Acer monitor and haven't been terribly impressed. The brightness levels are unimpressive, so if you are doing tasks such as photography, pick a different monitor. The monitor also started randomly going off and on momentarily after 6 months or so. I'm probably still in the warranty period, but I'm not sure I want to bother getting a replacement. That said, the monitor is lightweight and setup without issues. The monitor doesn't seem flimsy, so if it worked properly and gave good brightness/contrast, I image it would otherwise have a long life in my office. But alas.
reviewTitle: Poor brightness and keeps going on/off
name: Jonathan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2016
reviewBody: Just received mine today to replace an older Acer display that is going on to other uses in my house. Installed the base no problem, hooked it up, no problem and off and running. First thing I noticed is that it is much brighter and crisper than the LCD screen it replaced. I am not an expert on color reproduction and all that. It seemed fine right out of the box. I did some minor tweaking in my NVIDIA control panel to tone down the brightness by about 3% but other than that, nothing.I play an online multiplayer game and I immediately noticed how much smoother this was and everything looked almost new. My old LCD was still a pretty good 5ms monitor, but this one transitions so much better.Other notes:-Using a DVI-D connection to my computer - I have a lot of cables lying around and for me the included VGA cable goes into the electronics recycle bin-This monitor uses a power "brick" but it is so small, it's more like a power "mouse"-The base is great, my old monitor used to shake when the washing machine went into spin cycle. This one doesn't move a bit.-For the money, if you are looking for a good monitor without a ton of features, just want to plop it on your desk and be done with it, this is a great deal.-This monitor appears to be exclusive to Amazon.-It's a very nice design, very pleasing to the eye.-I have this side-by-side with a very high quality HP display and I think the two are comparable. With my old display, when I switched from one to the other, it looked like going from a shiny new car to an old rusted beater.
reviewTitle: Excellent value, sharp, crisp, and better quality than I expected for the price.
name: MC

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021
reviewBody: As others have noted (and you can see in the pic I've attached) this thin display does have a blue light bleed-through at the top. However, it's invisible when facing the screen straight on and doesn't appear to affect the picture quality.My last Acer monitor lasted over 11 years (through many moves) of moderate-heavy use before the backlight started to fail (and I only ever saw 1 or 2 dead pixels the whole time). I have high hopes that this monitor will go the same distance. Highly recommend!
reviewTitle: Great monitor at a good price
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021
reviewBody: Everything was working well, and we were satisfied with the picture quality, but yesterday a vertical line appeared after only 30 days of owning it. We own three other Acer monitors, and have never had this problem.Edit: we got in touch with Acer, and sent the monitor to their Texas facility to be fixed. It was back a week later with a new LCD screen. Works fine now. I'm going to stick to 3 stars, since it shouldn't have a line in the screen after a couple of months.
reviewTitle: Developed a vertical line after 30 days (EDIT: fixed under warranty)
name: Erma

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2020
reviewBody: My intent was to use the product for my home office, but I was not able to use it as the necessary cables weren't included as stated on page 1 of the User Guide. When I realize the items were missing and called Amazon to inform, I was transferred to the manufacturer (Acer) and the customer service I received was atrocious at worst and horrible at best!! I was so annoyed and disgusted I inform that I would be returning the item immediately; I did - and re-ordered from a different manufacturer. The monitor was well made and looked to be ideal for my purpose of use, but I refuse to give my money to a company that utilizes rude and obnoxious people to represent their products.
reviewTitle: Package Contents are NOT as Advertised!
name: Kindle Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2020
reviewBody: Ok. Unboxing was nerve wracking but I figured it out.Manual says stand should already be attached. It isn’t. There were no instructions. I had to figure it out for myself. Wasn’t hard for me but might be tough for others.Power cord was confusing. Two pieces were not together. One fell out of box and I didn’t see it. Took me a few minutes to figure that out.Once I got past those two hurdles, all went well. Looks great. Will update if anything changes.
reviewTitle: Looks good. Some issues with unboxing/assembly.
name: Warren Redlich

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2019
reviewBody: This is an old style LCD display that is polarized. When you try to look at it with polarized glasses you can't see anything at all since it is polarized in the wrong direction.. The standard calls for horizontal polarization as is the case with all polarized glasses. Many sunglasses are polarized.With that exception this is a nice display. The resolution is very good as are the colors.
reviewTitle: A nice display so long as you don't wear polarized glasses
name: Kindle Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020
reviewBody: There's no way to adjust the height of the monitor. I bought 2 mainly for PC gaming, and it reaalllly bothers me that the second monitor sits about a half an inch lower than the first monitor. It would be great if they modified this product to be able to raise and lower them. (And it would make getting my desk ergonomically correct a lot easier). I'd recommending buying something to put under the monitors to raise their height. Otherwise, they're a great purchase. Been perfect in every other capacity.
name: Autumn

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
reviewBody: The picture is great and clear. Very crisp and bright. The settings are broad and you can AG just to your liking. It does NOT have a speaker. I knew that going on. It also raises up and down but not in a large range. Only thing I wish was different. Not bough of a bummer to not still love it. I have had it two months and use as a dual monitor on a daily basis in home office.
name: Elynoon

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2019
reviewBody: Other than the lack of an HDMI cord, these monitors are perfect for what I need. (I had spare HDMIs, so not a big deal, but just a heads up that you'll need one if you plan on hooking to HDMI instead of VGA.) The picture is clear and setup took about 5 minutes for both monitors I have running. I am still playing with settings, but so far, very happy with it. I do photo editing and repair, so I need a clear picture. I couldn't pass up the price either.By the way, it DOES tilt, for anyone wondering. It's just new, and you might have to use a bit of maneuvering to get it to move. It doesn't do side to side, but does tilt forwards and back. It's not wall mountable, which is sad, but I wasn't planning on wall mounting anyways.
reviewTitle: Only comes with a VGA  and Power cord.
name: Sarah Harper

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
reviewBody: When you teach on Zoom you can see your participants on one screen and your teaching materials on the other. It is very helpful to have a second screen. This one works very well and was priced well.
reviewTitle: Really helpful to have a second monitor for Zoom teaching
name: M. Petersen

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2021
reviewBody: Simple install and lightweight the screen tilts, the buttons are underneath, no biggie you can still access the buttons by feeling your way monitor button settings are easy to navigate.The screen display is crisp and clear. I did a short streaming test -it's okay. The picture quality is clear but not to replace an HD screen for streaming or gaming. I am not a gamer my only experience is what I know when I watch the kids play. I purchased this monitor for work-related tasks such as docs, spreadsheets, printing, not for streaming or gaming. Overall, I am happy with my purchase.
name: Nora

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2019
reviewBody: Extremely easy to assemble, just three pieces and they slip together easily, they'll only fit one way. It does tilt, half an inch forward and three inches back. Screen does not glare. Colors and brightness are good. Color looks great to me, but a professional photographer would probably be more picky re color accuracy than I am. Very light weight. Has two ports: VGA and HDMI, and they are easy to access, right on the back of the screen, not concealed. I use the HDMI exclusively since my video card happens to have an HDMI output. I would buy it again, and will if/when other computers around the house need new monitors.
reviewTitle: An excellent monitor at a very good price
name: David Eaglesfield

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2016
reviewBody: This monitor is extremely slick and has astounding image quality! I primary use this monitor for gaming and school purposes. The bezel on this monitor is barely noticeable and provides a clean look. This monitor also features reduced blue light which allows the user to use this product for long periods of time with less eye strain. The image quality of this monitor is amazing! The quality is crisp, sharp, stress-free, and lag free.Gaming Use:Pros:-I have played CS:GO, GTA 5, and ARMA III on this monitor and each game looks superb!-The IPS feature helps you view the monitor from every angle without white spots-Great response rate for fast paced games like CS:GOCons:-None so farBusiness/SchoolPros:-Great for both environments due to the less eye stress feature.-If you are looking to buy 2/3 monitors to put side by side, these will work great.-Large display and does not heat up as much as monitorsCons:- Does not feature built it split screen capabilities (which is not that big of an issue because many OS can do this instead)
reviewTitle: The image quality of this monitor is amazing! The quality is crisp
name: Shewbz

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
reviewBody: I needed a new computer monitor and went with this Acer brand. It fits nicely in my computer center and I like the brightness and that I can use either an HDMI cable or dot cable. The only negative comment I can give is that I wish the stand weren't so round. My computer station is a modified Secretary and the round base was a little too round to let me close the doors, so I had to cut a hole in the back of the Secretary to push the back of the stand through. (The photo doesn't show the new monitor, it's just to show you what my computer station looks like).
name: Kaelin51

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2019
reviewBody: I did not start off with this monitor. Originally I got another one for Christmas that was about $15 cheaper on Black Friday. I was looking for something to plug my laptop into while at home. Problem was that the old monitor did not have an HDMI port like I thought it would so I returned it. That's when I began shopping around online and found this Acer unit. Sure it was $15 more but it had an HDMI port, which in my opinion should be on everyone's list when buying a new monitor now a days. Sure, you could go with one that just has a SVGA port for a couple bucks less. Maybe your computer has a SVGA port, you have an adapter, or you planning on investing in a docking station. I still think you would be better off having the HDMI port. You will never be able to get the kind of picture out of SVGA that you get with HDMI and in a couple years Goodwill will be about the only place you can unload monitors with SVGA only. This is a surprisingly versatile monitor for the price. I have had no issues and it has been 2 months now. I highly recommend it.
name: Bro. Steve

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
reviewBody: Purchased to replace an older Viewsonic with a huge bezel. This screen looks a lot better then the old Viewsonic until you turn it on. After going through every setting on the monitor and Windows, even using HDMI instead of VGA I can say with confidence that this monitor was a mistake. It really does look like there is a screen door between you and the monitor with the lines between pixels clearly visible and the display being so dim and colors so dark.
reviewTitle: Dark Dim and Screen Door effect all in one monitor
name: AlexDShields

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2020
reviewBody: After giving alot of thoughts to rather have ultra wide monitor for my work and personal computer or to have two seperate monitors ; I finally decided to have simply two monitors as it is very econimical solution . This acer model(in picture the right one) in just 89 USD is simply great ! It came in excellent packaging ,good quality material , slim , picture quality is best and overall a great buy. I am glad I did not buy expensive ultra-wide-screen rather a more budget friendly decision which at the end proved great.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2019
reviewBody: In terms of quality of image and size, it works for me. I need a larger screen because of my neck hurting causing headaches while working. SO this help and for the price the quality of image is great. My only concern it that sometimes the screen turn purple when I turn it on or if left on after turning my laptop off and then turning on.All I do is turn it off then on again to get it back to normal screen. So it's not too inconvenient but it is a concern and I have no idea why that happens.But over all I'm ok with it.
name: Tamercindy

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021
reviewBody: Not funny I didn't laugh. Your joke is so bad I would have preferred the joke went over my head and you gave up re-telling me the joke. To be honest this is a horrid attempt at trying to get a laugh out of me. Not a chuckle, not a hehe, not even a subtle burst of air out of my esophagus. Science says before you laugh your brain preps your face muscles but I didn't even feel the slightest twitch. 0/10 this joke is so bad I cannot believe anyone legally allowed you to be creative at all. The amount of brain power you must have put into that joke has the potential to power every house on Earth. Get a personality and learn how to make jokes, read a book. I'm not saying this to be funny I genuinely mean it on how this is just bottom barrel embarrassment at comedy. You've single handedly killed humor and every comedic act on the planet. I'm so disappointed that society has failed as a whole in being able to teach you how to be funny. Honestly if I put in all my power and time to try and make you get the point that i'm trying to get at, you'll lose a wapping 8.6 zectillion brain molecules causing hypothermia. Have a nice day - Monke
reviewTitle: Not funny I didn't laugh. Your joke is so bad I would have preferred the joke went over my head.
name: Emmanuel Brown

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2019
reviewBody: This was an awesome 4k capable monitor but it was too difficult to get sound for previous gen consoles i.e. PS3 without a host of cords. I wanted to hook up a Bluetooth speaker but there were no ports for it. I sent it back and for about the same price got a 32" Polaroid 1080p tv and I'm satisfied.
reviewTitle: If only it had a aux jack or speakers 🔊
name: stephon m.brooks jr

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2019
reviewBody: Got a new desktop which allows me to exceed the 75Hz that the monitor caps at, however it still looks crispy. Image quality is great. Main games played is CoD, GTA, Fortnite, BattleRite, and various other indie games (New Desktop, not as many games in my budget right now). HOWEVER, the monitor itself is hard to adjust brightness and display settings due to unlabled buttons below the monitor, it is sort of touch and guess with trial and error of what controls what, but you should not have to touch it much after the initial set up. For gaming on a budget, this monitor is excellent!
name: Shane Victorino

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2020
reviewBody: Very thin, easy to unpack and setup. Reasonable price. Works great in my 2 monitor setup. I run Win 10 with upgraded graphics card. I have a large monitor for normal games and doing spread sheets etc and then a smaller one for going online to do banking etc and plugging info into spreadsheets.Pros: Easy setup-great picture quality for normal operation (youtube-netflix etc) Not a gamer so don't know about that. Instantly loaded with quality picture and I have a double monitor setup.Cons: This only excepts VGA/HDMI plugs. NOT large plug DVI styles. Although if you have a DVI to HDMI or VGA adapter it works great.
name: Earl Meyer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019
reviewBody: Works great! The stand isn't adjustable and it doesn't come with an hdmi, but hey - this monitor is great, especially considering the price. You aren't gonna beat anything like this.The thing I'm sad about was that I wasn't able to grab a 24" since it was sold out so I got the 21.5", but that's no fault of the manufacturer, mostly my own bad timing.I didn't need to manually set the frame rate to 75hz or turn on freesync, it did it on its own, which was surprising and very nice. It's an ips, so it's got great viewing angles. I've only had this screen for a month and have had absolutely zero problems so far!EDIT: So one problem, but it doesn’t change my star rating. Setting the monitor into overdrive (which I don’t even know what that does) creates like a blue shadow effect behind figures and shapes a half second behind. It’s odd. But I turned it to normal, and zero problems!
reviewTitle: Love it! Just make sure to pick up an hdmi!
name: Lili

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
reviewBody: Wanted a low cost monitor for my security camera system. I used this monitor to replace the built in monitor that had developed a big brown spot in the middle of its screen. I took the hdmi output and split it with a 1 in 2 out splitter so I could drive this monitor and a 60 inch plasma TV. The image is crystal clear 1920x1080 video from my high definition security cameras. The 21 inch display is much easier to view over the old 12 inch broken display.
reviewTitle: High Definition at a decent price.
name: T.J. Turgeon

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2020
reviewBody: I have a Lenovo laptop and wanted a larger monitor. There are many different ways to assess a monitor. I needed the basics. I don't know what is necessary for gaming so I can't speak to that. I have a basic nvidia card because sometimes I do graphic design. For the average consumer like me this is the right price for nothing special but a monitor that works well. I am completely satisfied with my choice.
name: V AA

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2018
reviewBody: I love this monitor. The picture quality was great, and it was super easy to set up. The price couldn't be beat, either!I only have two small issues:1. It doesn't come with an HDMI cord. I knew that from reading the reviews, so I ordered one separately. It took forever to get here.2. When attached to the base, it angles downward slightly. I have some issues with my neck and shoulder, so this is proving a bit uncomfortable in my current workspace. If you have similar issues, maybe get a riser or stand to remedy this.
name: MrsLucard

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
reviewBody: For my work station at home ... 👍❤💪.... /& the wife works remotely using it during Covid.... keeps her safe ... keeps me worry free... 🙏🏽🙏🏽
name: Jay

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
reviewBody: bought it because I had built a computer without remembering to allocate any money for a monitor. for what you pay, you certainly get a lot; IPS panel, 75hz refresh rate, a decent size, and 1080p. I've since bought a slightly bigger 144hz monitor for my main screen but this trusty little guy sits on the side as a second monitor to watch videos on because the colors are nicer (the 144hz is a TN panel). if your budget is tight, grab one of these and you'll be set! my only gripe is that you can't mount it without buying a ridiculously cheap looking yet expensive adapter, but you get what you pay for; however in this case, you get quite a lot.
reviewTitle: great little monitor for barely any money at all!
name: Joshua Kim

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2018
reviewBody: This is a sub $200 27in monitor. It's exactly what I expected. Brightness is 4/5, color is 4/5, response for casual work or browsing is 4/5.... the monitor as a whole is just 4/5 stars.But what really lost a star here was that this box doesn't include a mount pattern or include a mount adapter for third party mounting systems ($30 extra expense). I knew this before I made my purchase so it wasn't a surprise at all, but it should be included or built into the platform. Until it does, it's still just 4/5 stars....Yes, I would recommend this monitor! As a whole, the price is right for what the R271 brings to the table.
reviewTitle: Monitor is exactly what you'd expect at this price. Minus one star for no mounting pattern.
name: Chase A.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020
reviewBody: bought this monitor for working from home so i can extend the screen from my laptop. when i move the existing tasks to this monitor, it is a little bit slow and the image quality is a little blurry. but i can bear with that due the price. however, sometimes it will have glitches going on this monitor while opening new task on this screen. for working, i would recommend it; but for gaming i am afraid it might decrease the chance of winning due to the glitch.
name: Christy

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020
reviewBody: I have used it for about a year and I am happy with it.Features:-It is a thin monitor with good picture quality. Though, I do not use it for gaming, etc.-It has both VGA and HDMI connections. So, presumably, you can connect it to both old and new computers. However, it comes with only a VGA cable and you need to have the HDMI cable on your own.-It does tilt but not much.-It comes with a base to put it on your desk but does not come with mounting holes, etc.Overall, a good second monitor.
reviewTitle: Great to Use as the Second Monitor for Work
name: Mahdi

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
reviewBody: I was a bit skeptical about buying this mnitor because I was on a $200 budget for it and I was looking for a monitor with freesync and was atleast 20 inches. When i was staring at it on black friday for $80 I was only thinking if it would be bad for such a low price but then I looked at the reviews and thought what the heck it had freesync for my gaming and i was using a gaming loptop so i needed a bigger screen and I measured me dest and it was the perfect size. When I gt it it assembled really quickly and was easy to use. The freesync worked perfectly and for the price I got to buy alot of other gaming hardware. I think this monitor is the best out there and I even recommend for minimalist gamersw looking for a good piece of hardware for their money.
reviewTitle: Size is fine and all the other features are great
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2016
reviewBody: I would rate this monitor as a 2.5/10. I'll list the pros and cons then follow up with a more detailed explanation.Pros:-Clear and vivid screen-Good looking monitorCons:-Began flashing on and off when in use (6 months after purchase)-Acer makes you pay for shipping for repairs... even during warranty period-Buttons on monitor are too small and unmarkedInitially I needed a second screen for my laptop. After looking around for a while it seemed like nothing else really compared for this price point. I order the Acer R240HY. At first it was fantastic. When it works (note that phrase), it looks great... crisp and clear. However about 6 months after purchase it began to act strange. It flashes off and on randomly when trying to use it (see attached video). The screen going black every few seconds makes the monitor utterly useless So, I call up Acer support and this is what the support tech tells me "unplug and re-plug it in... did that work?... no... ok, that's all the guidelines we have... you'll have to send it in for repair" As it turns out you're responsible for the shipping... let me rephrase that ... YOU HAVE TO PAY TO HAVE YOUR DEFECTIVE PRODUCT FIXED. Based on that alone (let alone the fact that it's a defective piece of equipment) I can't recommend this monitor. When it works it works great... but what does that matter if it breaks after 6 months?
reviewTitle: Great at first... but you're better off spending your money elsewhere
name: S

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020
reviewBody: It's a nice monitor. it's thin. It works. But they include a VGA cable, but not HDMI??????? In 2020? I'd rather they not waste cords and include HDMI. The VGA will remain in the box with other old, useless cords. And now I need to make a quick trip to Target so that I can work tomorrow morning.
name: T. Valenza

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2018
reviewBody: So far I really like this monitor. I wish it would get a little bit dimmer, since I work at night, so far it is a large improvement over the last monitor I had. The brightest settings allow you to see it at any time, even during the brightest of days. The matte finish prevents reflective glare oh, and there seems to be no, or very little light bleed. Recently, I have noticed a bit of what I can only describe as slight wave-like fluctuations in the picture. You definitely can't notice it while gaming or watching anything, but while working on documents it is a little bit more pronounced. Still, I would definitely recommend this monitor as a great value monitor if you don't want to spend a lot of money.
reviewTitle: Great value for a budget monitor
name: Dorothy Hall

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
reviewBody: monitor worked fine for 3 weeks.... today the colors were extremely washed out. at first i thought it was my computer so i tried everything i could find: installing old/new drivers, resetting my PC, etc. i figured out it was the monitor after i tried plugging in my laptop and mirroring the displays... picture was completely fine on my laptop. i'm very disappointed and it's going to be a pain returning this thing. do yourself a favor and do NOT purchase an acer monitor. it's just junk.
name: tmeclroy

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2017
reviewBody: For the price this is a good looking display and works well.CONS: The stand is somewhat flimsy so when you push up from below to hit the power or menu buttons you have to stabilize the monitor with your other hand. Otherwise it feels as if you may tip over the display. Also would not recommend if you frequently plug or unplug cables from the back for the same reason.PROS: I haven't had any issues with that in the past 4 months of use despite the not-so-sturdy stand. This monitor is hooked up to a computer and a PS4, and the input switches accordingly to know which source is powering it. Press the menu button twice to scan all inputs in order to switch if both sources are active. That takes 2-5 seconds.
reviewTitle: Good looking display and works well. Somewhat flimsy stand.
name: AC

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2021
reviewBody: The picture quality and refresh rate really is excellent for the prince. It's slim and sturdy in quality. The only disappointment (which is my own fault for not reading carefully enough when I picked it out) is that it is not mountable.That really is the only downside to it. I don't really understand why companies even make monitors anymore that are not capable of mounting but there you have it.
name: Blah Blah

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2021
reviewBody: Acer's been around forever...they didn't disappoint. Actually using this as a second monitor for gaming...I can have Steam and Discord open on my second monitor, and games open on my first one (took me hours to figure out how to do this LOL). My first monitor's a little larger, 23 inches...but the clarity of the Acer is so good, I wouldn't hesitate to use this as my only monitor.
name: Papa Rick

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2019
reviewBody: I bought this monitor as an external display for my laptop (Xiaomi Mi Notebook Pro, for anyone who's curious). The display is gorgeous and the monitor itself is rather stylish and attractive. The screen size and resolution are perfect for my needs, which are mostly web browsing, video streaming, document editing, and occasional gaming.Though my laptop isn't a designated gaming laptop, it can run games decently enough. This monitor makes games look very nice, and I much prefer using it to my laptop's built-in screen. I highly recommend this monitor to anyone in the market for a well-priced 1080p monitor.
name: Devin

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2019
reviewBody: What can I say? This monitor is just fantastic!The color production is totally on point [especially at this price outdoing itself].The IPS display delivers impeccably [hardly notice any IPS glow.].It can be overclocked to 75 hertz for a bit more speed.The monitor is practically bezel-less and really comfortable to look at.The monitor itself is truly beautiful and durable.It has a small user friendly menu which you probably don't even need to touch as its already well calibrated.It is very energy efficient and flicker free.Acer you've certainly outdone yourself with this one. No wonder it is practically a best seller on Amazon. I am truly a happy owner!! :)
reviewTitle: Definitely worth much more than the price!
name: TechlovingMoses

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
reviewBody: I just bought this for my husband as an early Christmas present since his died this morning. He's heavy into gaming and his old monitor was terrible. I've been looking at this one for a while so I decided to make the jump. I'm so glad I did! The colors on this monitor are so vivid on the default that we had to turn down the brightness a tad. Everything moves so smoothly! He's been smiling since he got it. He's been playing Path of Exile since he got it and he says it's like playing a brand new game. The details really pop on the screen that you can even see that the statues have eyes! He's been smiling for about an hour now. I only gave 4 stars on durability on this review due to us owning it for only a couple of hours. We don't know how long it'll last just yet.
name: bizzlemuck

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
reviewBody: Dead on arrival. I work in I/T, so it’s not like I may have plugged a cord in wrong. It would not even acknowledge that it was getting power. I tested the power supply with my multimeter and received the expected 19 volts going into the monitor. Very frustrating. In the middle of a pandemic and the monitor I ordered to do my job remotely won’t turn on. And, at this point, anything decent and affordable is already sold out. So I’m stuck with just a laptop screen for now. Buyer beware!
reviewTitle: Won’t even turn on.  Broken right out of the box.
name: Anthony from MS

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2019
reviewBody: Not very impressed with the quality. Quite a few times in a day it suddenly loses display n then it starts working people y in about 5 seconds. The picture quality is decent for the price. I have a Dell monitor placed right next to it and when I compare the same picture on both the screens, I can see that this monitor gives a satisfactory performance.
reviewTitle: Good for the price. Keep your expectations low.
name: Priyanka

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2020
reviewBody: Got this since LTT recommended it and it’s perfect size for small display for a really good price. Didn’t want a massive monitor for my WFH set up.Acer makes really good quality value displays and construction isn’t Apple Mac Pro but then again you are paying <$100 vs ~$5000.See LTT video on this display. Good brightness refresh rate and picture quality. Stand only pivots/tilts forward and back.
name: Myko

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2021
reviewBody: Honestly, the picture quality is ok, but not the greatest monitor. It is a great price though. The color quality isn't great, and it isn't that bright, but I'm still finding it very useful for work from home. There was a run in the screen when I first turned it on, and that run appears every once in a while, not sure why. I've changed the cable and used different computers to connect to it, but it still happens occasionally. Since I'm using mostly for WHF, it's not a problem, but when I game it is quite annoying.
name: Jackie K.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020
reviewBody: I bought this monitor as a second screen for my laptop. So far I’ve used it for web browsing & light gaming (Sims 4), and it works perfectly! The image quality is great, and although my laptop screen is 144 hz, the 75 hz on the monitor doesn’t feel too different.Some potential deal breakers to keep in mind: the height isn’t adjustable (you can only tilt the screen back and forth) & the monitor isn’t vesa mount compatible. Furthermore, you need to supply your own hdmi cord, but you can generally find these for cheap on amazon or in stores.
name: Alma C

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
reviewBody: Reduced rating to one star. Absolutely no support provided from Amazon or the manufacturer. I will have to pay out of pocket FROM SOMEWHERE ELSE to get a monitor that stays on longer than ten minutes. What a total POS this is. Complete waste of money.I purchased two of these monitors so I could work from home. One of them works well, but the other blacks out often. Sometimes the screen comes back on with no issue. Sometimes it comes back, but purple or green. Sometimes it comes back, and the right side of the screen is on the left and vice versa. And sometimes it doesn't come back at all, and I have to unplug it from the computer and plug it back in. This didn't start happening until after the return deadline had passed. I've only had these for five months or so, so I am highly disappointed in this product. I will not be purchasing this brand again.
reviewTitle: Screen blacks out 10-50 times per day
name: Amy Crowe

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2019
reviewBody: The reader should be warned that the display is reduced glare, which is a good thing in general but tends to make text look grainy. The monitor could be brighter but it is not a major issue. While text and icons are somewhat grainy, movies look very good and the relative absence of glare is a big plus. For my taste monitors smaller than 27" are preferable and this one is the perfect size, allowing sufficient screen real estate to work while not taking up too much space on the desktop. Overall, a good value if you can live with the non-reflective screen.
reviewTitle: Decent Value in a Full HD Monitor
name: neurodoc

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2020
reviewBody: I ordered the 27 inch monitor for our home office after ordering the 21.5 inch monitor last year & for such a reasonable priced monitor - I couldn't be happier. I was not expecting it to be as large as it is but I absolutely LOVE this monitor!! Great picture quality but i am a little bummed that this monitor doesn't have any USB ports on it. It did come with a cord to plug into the hub which i forgot when i got the 21.5 inch monitor. LOVE the monitor!!
name: Chris&Michelle

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2019
reviewBody: The monitor is light, thin and was an easy fit on my untidy and cramped work station. Setup was quick and the picture quality is consistent with other monitors in its price range. My gaming is mostly limited to strategy titles like the Civilization and Total War series and I find the screen size and picture definition to be fit for purpose. The control buttons are on the underside and a bit awkward to use, at least at first. It comes with an HDMI to VGA cable so if you require a different connection combo you'll need a different cable.
name: daniel j. silvia

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2021
reviewBody: Tried two monitors to decide which fit better on my desk. The other was bigger, which I liked but had an enormous base. This one was a bit smaller (about an inch) but had a much more convenient round base. Because of that it fits much better on my desk and isn’t sitting right in front of my face. For under $100 I doubt I could have done better than this.
name: druznak

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2021
reviewBody: When rating the picture quality this is subjective as I like full and bold image coloring, but it has held its quality for two different types of gaming desktops both with G-Force graphics cards for the price. Highly recommend this product for those looking to set up duel screens and need one for communication and quick reference as this will meet and exceed those need.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
reviewBody: I purchased ACER "R240HY bidx" 23.8" AND ACER "R240HY Abmidx" 23.8" monitors. There is a clear difference in the picture quality. The screen on R240HY is less bright despite the adjustments.If I view both the monitors together wearing polarized shades, I see blank screen on "R240HY bidx" but I can see the picture on "R240HY Abmidx" monitor (dual screen)According to the description, both the monitors have same spec except for "R240HY Abmidx" has built in speakers.The monitors were purchased together but arrived from different locations. Waste of time and money. I threw away the boxes so can hardly return it.
name: AD

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2019
reviewBody: this monitor is a 75hz with freesync and is super duper slim. The stand for it is a bit cheapish.. but the rest is great. also has gaming features like additonal brightness and cross hair placement. I bought this for playing CS:GO. quality is there and would recomment to anyone looking for a good 1080p monitor for budget gaming.it does have a con though.. it uses an external power adapter because obviously it being so thin.
reviewTitle: cant beat this price to performance
name: Usman Sheikh

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
reviewBody: Image quality is great, nice looking monitor that works well. Was a great addition to the work from home setup.Used with 2019 Macbook Pro through a USB-C to HDMI connection.
name: Cam

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020
reviewBody: bought this earlier this year, 2020, and as much as a month ago the monitor is already flickering, and has grey lines stretching across the image (very noticeable on white windows). I've tried turning it off and back on again, and adjusting the cords and it's still awful. Thankfully my primary monitor is a different (popular brand). I will never buy acer again. Subpar quality.
reviewTitle: I'll never buy an ACER monitor again
name: Jack Dashing

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021
reviewBody: When I switch between applications or open a new application they often will glitch and the frame will show all white or all black. Some programs become unresponsive. This is not an issue with the laptop as it is functional standalone and when connected to my monitors at my office. Although this cheap work from home solution has proven to be a waste of money and I now need to upgrade to one that will not hinder my ability to work.
reviewTitle: Glitches and images often lag or do not appear at all
name: ryan j davidson

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020
reviewBody: This monitor has been my main one for over a year now, and for what it's trying to do, it succeeds. The response time is good, the brightness is good, the monitor itself is just the right size.Just one problem -- why you gotta display your brand name every time you turn it on? I turn off my monitors when I'm leaving the room for an extended period. The secondary monitor I use, originally my primary one, doesn't do this... Not a very big complaint though.Overall, superb monitor. If you need a good, cheap monitor, try this one!
name: Travis

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2021
reviewBody: they brag about the thinness of the screen and then put a thick box on it to hold the boards, buttons and ports. They could have taken the 22 inch thin screen and designed it like the smaller portable monitors, that would have justified the "Thin" bragging rights. But what is the point of have a thin screen with that box stuck to the back?
name: DylisTN

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2018
reviewBody: I received this monitor and after two months the LCD Screen randomly appeared with a black dot. I then had to ship in the product after paying nearly $30 for a box/shipping and wrapping at Fedex and Acer now wants me to pay an additional $79 to repair the screen that now looks even worse. I was asked to take pictures of the screen before shipping (first 3 images are mine) and once Acer receive my monitor (4th/last picture taken by Acer) the LCD screen looks even worse. After two months of hardly using my monitor (work purposes only), which has zero scratches and was in great condition has now worsened and I am being asked to pay $79 to repair plus the $150 I already paid two months ago + the $30 I had to pay to ship the product. Warranty does not cover this issue, which as you can see in the images are MUCH MUCH worse. The picture quality was great when the screen was working properly, however, I would not buy this product again nor any products from Acer. Two months and this monitor broke? Such a waist of money. Acer's durability is poor.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020
reviewBody: Very nice monitor, especially for the price. HOWEVER, who needs a VGA cable anymore? They should ditch those and include an HDMI cable instead. ALSO, it needs to be noted prominently that there are no built-in speakers. You will have to purchase computer speakers if you use the HDMI connection. I would have purchased a different model with built in speakers if I had realized it. So that will clutter up the workspace a bit adding those.
reviewTitle: Beautiful!  But needs HDMI cable and need to mention that there are no built in speakers
name: JustMeee

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
reviewBody: I was amazed by getting a good monitor for such low price. I don't use it for gaming, just regular work. The monitor is easy to install and connect to a laptop. It has multiple settings to adjust brightness, contrast including an eco mode. It came with a VGA cable. I bought an HDMI cable to connect it with my laptop. There is no camera though.I am very happy with this purchase and highly recommend it.
name: MSR

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
reviewBody: Bought this as a second monitor for work and I couldn’t be happier with my purchase. It came with two connection ports (one HDMI and the other a big blue port with screws). I had a gotten a new laptop from work and luckily it came with the HDMI cord as the new laptop didn’t have the other option.i am very happy about this purchase as the size and compatibility is just perfect for my daily workload.
name: Jamie D.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
