reviewBody: Screen works fine, display is nice and all, but with this monitor is was impossible to get into BIOS. It just kept saying "Input not supported" until the login screen. I needed to get into BIOS to change boot order after upgrading to SSD. I tried everything I could find related to this issue to no avail. Long story short I ended up hooking an old monitor up to the computer (not acer) and it worked fine. POST and BIOS screens simply do not show up on this monitor and idk why... for the record I'm running an asus motherboard, intel 9th gen cpu and radeon gfx card so if anyone knows how to fix it with a similar setup that'd be great.
name: mark patmore

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2021
reviewBody: This monitor makes a world of a difference when teaching on Zoom. I wish I bought it sooner! For less than $100, I really can't complain. The purchase does not come with a HDMI cord, but luckily I had one for my MacBook laying around, so can't ding a star. If you're a teacher teaching in distance learning, this product is a must!
name: Sara

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
reviewBody: I love this monitor i use it with multiple divices i only with it had a headphones out or speekers but he picture quality is amazing and it doesn't smear the image across the screen like my TV's do 10/10 for picture quality just make sure u have a set of speakers or headphones plugged into the source device
reviewTitle: Best screen ive ever bought just 1 problem
name: Aaron413

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
reviewBody: For the price, this monitor is great while it works. However, according to other reviews and now my own, this monitor doesn't last long. I noticed occasional black screens when I first started using it and worried that might be a precursor to something worse. It was.After only 4 weeks of using this monitor, the screen is black and will not display anything (from the pc, from the monitor itself, nothing). When starting my pc, the monitor acknowledges the input and attempts to display something but fails every time. Occasional spurts of color try and come through but last only half a second. I attempted every fix you could imagine short of opening up the monitor. Different cables. Different computer. Checked my hardware inside my pc. Nothing worked.Just started the return process today before it was too late. Save yourself the hassle and invest in something sturdier even if the price of this monitor makes it hard to turn down.
name: Sebastian Hay

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020
reviewBody: We just received the monitor and hooked it up with the VGA cable---no problem except it was a bit too bright. I couldn't figure out how to work the brightness controls underneath the screen.I called the Amazon help line number and got my call and question answered immediately. There is a reason that Amazon is Amazon.Also, I have never been disappointed by an Acer product---including this one. It's a great moniter, especially for the price.
reviewTitle: If you have a question, call the Amazon Help line
name: LFNYC

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2018
reviewBody: A great monitor! I spent about two weeks looking through reviews and specs (and price). This one is a winner for sure and I love the size. Colors are great and the images are nice and bright. Some reviewers complained that it was not very stable. The stand could use some improvement but my cat rubs up on the monitor daily while he keeps me company and it's never come close to tipping over. Others mentioned the buttons on it weren't very practical. I don't generally mess with the settings after the initial setup and I don't power my monitor down every time so neither of those issues affected me. I'm giving it a great review because this was the product I was looking for. Please don't try to compare this to higher end monitors or 4K technology. This is a great monitor for anyone on a budget who isn't overly concerned about having the best tech as soon as it comes out.
reviewTitle: A great monitor! I spent about two weeks looking through ...
name: Outside with Ed

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020
reviewBody: I am an engineering student and intern, so I’ve had to create my own space to work at home for both work and school. I wasn’t expecting much from the monitor due to the price, but as my picture shows it’s screen quality is better than my laptop. I was also looking for about the same size monitor as my laptop screen for consistency, so I appreciate the size. I had no issues connecting it to my laptop. You can see the connection options in my pic. The only thing to note is that the height doesn’t adjust much, but that didn’t bother me.
name: Heather Elizabeth

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2021
reviewBody: It is a decent monitor for my laptop. I wanted a bigger screen to fit to a docking station and this was a good choice. While it is not what I would would want if I was doing intense art kind of work, it is very good for my everyday work and I have done some nice graphics on it. Seems durable and was easy to install. I like it.
name: merlinwv

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021
reviewBody: I bought this monitor for my makeshift pandemic home office and was pleasantly surprised by its quality. I use it for work and grad school so I can't really comment on how it is for gaming, but for my uses it's perfect. I'm not a computer/monitor expert so I haven't used tons of other products, but I'll say that the picture quality is great and doesn't hurt or bother my eyes nearly as much as other screens I've worked on, the color is crisp, and the monitor looks sleek and professional. It has a VGA and HDMI port, and the power cord is long enough that you shouldn't have to worry about not being able to reach an outlet. I normally get slightly nervous when making tech purchases as I'm not a real tech-y guy, but I couldn't be happier with this purchase. Highly recommend.
reviewTitle: Bought for my home office and am very pleased. Awesome bang for your buck (and yes it does tilt)
name: Jim McGonagle

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2018
reviewBody: I dislike giving 1 star reviews. I purchased this monitor along with a two monitor desk mount to replace one of my monitors in a two monitor setup. Never did I imagine this monitor wouldn't be VESA mount capable. Of course I cannot return the monitor since I opened it and I cannot return the desk mount without paying 1/3 of the purchase price to ship it back to Amazon.So, beware, this monitor, regardless of any other features, is not VESA mount capable. I seriously cannot believe it nor understand the reasoning behind this. For my needs, this earns it 1 star.
name: PJ Photo

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
reviewBody: I'm so happy with my purchase. The monitor is my primary screen to be used with my laptop for my home office. It looks great, super streamlined, great picture quality. Makes my life so much easier! You will need a monitor stand for this to make it ergonomic, but that's not a hard problem to fit. Tilts slightly to get a good angle. Very happy with this product, especially the price. I don't use it for gaming, though. Currently length of ownership: 1 month.
name: Kim

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2020
reviewBody: I spent the last 2 days trying to figure out why this montoir wasn't working. Turns out the VGA cable was REALLY broken. The whole side of it was bent. So I bought a whole new VGA cable and then it worked. I knew that everything in my build was good because it was brand new and it couldn't be the motherboard, ram, power supply, CPU, HDMI cable, etc.. because I tested my PC build on a new monitor before.I had to wipe my whole system because this wasn't working and I was not about to take apart this new monitor to look into the system to figure it out.And then after a couple of days of it working, it goes back to having no signal. I had somebody look at my parts and they say the montoir is faulty. Now windows updated and it's giving me a black screen with a cursor. I like don't know what to do now.
reviewTitle: Acer No signal output with VGA cable+HDMI and black screen with cursor!!! Somebody help
name: Beata v

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2016
reviewBody: It's weird that the video connectors stick straight out the back, as opposed to most monitors that have the cables hanging straight down. It seems like the cables are more likely to get bent and break the connectors this way, if you ever push the monitor back against a wall or something. Other than that, it's a good monitor with VGA, DVI, and HDMI connectors.
reviewTitle: It seems like the cables are more likely to get bent and ...
name: Jeremy

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020
reviewBody: There's a single pixel that was dead. It's so unnoticeable unless you're looking for it that it wasn't worth going through the return process but something else I noticed - there's a lot of noticeable banding in solid colors. For example, blue appears to alternate between vertical stripes of cyan and blue, oranges are yellows and reds, etc. not acceptable.
reviewTitle: Look great, especially for the cost
name: Jason Adair

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021
reviewBody: This monitor is perfect! Bought for my 14yr old to use with his chrome book. He suffers migraines and small screen on chrome book was making things worse with added strain on his eyes. This monitor was easy to connect and is perfect!! We are so happy with this buy.
reviewTitle: Bye Bye tiny chrome book screen-external monitor the fix!!!
name: Dee Hunt

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2021
reviewBody: I bought this back in early March 2020 thinking I'd be working from home for a few weeks (hah!). Since then, this monitor has been my main screen that I plug my laptop into. The size, display, color, etc are fine but something seems to be wrong with it electrically. It started turning off on me randomly several months ago and now does it a few times a day. I have to unplug and plug it back in multiple times to get the display to come back on. So unfortunately, a year into WFH, I'll be buying a new, more reliable monitor. I'd say this monitor works great for temporary use but is not a good option if you'll be working on it every day!
reviewTitle: A year into WFH with this monitor and it struggles
name: Jenna Gregory

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2019
reviewBody: I really have no complaints about this monitor. Bought it for someone else, but I tested it for a few days. It is your typical Acer monitor. Quick to fire up, easy to setup. Has a quality feel from it you would probably not expect.It is nothing to worship, but it very much worth the price point. Good color, buttons feel nice, you have mounting options, and it is light-weight and solid. Even the inexpensive stand makes it sit well and stable. Good viewing angle.No need to hype it, it is a good monitor.
reviewTitle: Very good monitor - for the price.
name: Marsaeus

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020
reviewBody: I use this as a large screen for my MacBook Air. It is the exact size I needed and worked (without reading instructions) immediately. Right out of the box.I recommend it highly for what I use it for. The price was unbelievably low.
name: Sophie

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2020
reviewBody: This monitor was assembled and hooked up in a matter of minutes. For a second monitor for my work-at-home setup, it does everything I need it to and was a good price. It does stand a little higher than my laptop screen, which I noticed causes me to look up a lot when looking at the second monitor — I wish it had adjustable height. Otherwise I have no complaints.
reviewTitle: Missing adjustable height, but otherwise great
name: Ashley

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
reviewBody: Seems alright so far, and its cheap price point can't be beat. The stand doesn't tilt, so you might have to elevate it depending on your desk height.For anyone wondering how to tweak the screen settings, I found this online and it works well for me:Picture: Brightness 80, Contrast 52, Black Boost 5, Blue Light off, ACM off, Super Sharpness off.Color: Gamma 2.4, Color Temp User, R Gain 47, G Gain 48, B Gain 46, R Bias 50, G Bias 50, B Bias 48.Gaming: Overdrive normal, FreeSync on, Aim Point off.System Input HDMI, DDC/CI On, HDMI Black Level Normal
name: Ven

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2019
reviewBody: Suggest GO FOR LED. LCD has liquid crystals (same with TV's) personal opine best to avoid. This monitor presents very well, but could not adjust brightness (was way too bright for me and faded picture), contrast OR screen resolution. Returned and went back to old Acer which is LED and is great, thought I needed replacement after years of use, WRONG.
name: nvj3wlv

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
reviewBody: This review is the only one you need. The monitor itself is really cheap at $90 and the picture quality if fantastic. It has a no-glare screen and the monitor is extremely thin. It has 1 HDMI port and 1 VGA port. I use it for gaming and it has a large area that you can view because it is an IPS panel. This monitor is smaller so it's perfect for a desktop. It has no stuttering or lag and can display 60 Hz while just fine. It CAN tilt and the bezels are very thin. This is the perfect monitor for 1080p 75 Hz gaming.
reviewTitle: Absolute best monitor on Amazon for the price.
name: winnieyiyi

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
reviewBody: For those like me that are not tech-savvy, this does NOT have audio. I should have paid more attention to the listing when I bought. Otherwise, it is a great lightweight monitor!
name: Carol P

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2019
reviewBody: So easy to install. No drivers needed. Excellent picture quality. Unplug computer/ connect monitor/ turn on power/monitor will self-install. No drivers needed.This monitor also has HDMI option. But, monitor has no speakers, so hdmi connection might be tricky. If you don't under stand that, just rely on the VGA cable to connect to computer.VGA is the cable that has screws to secure it to the unit.Great value for the money.
name: David D.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
reviewBody: I ordered this for remote teaching. I use this for extending my screen and sharing what is on this screen so I can still see the Teams meeting on my laptop. I fits very nicely on my small desk space, but has a big enough screen for all I need to do. Great value!
reviewTitle: Great for extended screen virtual teaching
name: Kendra

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2021
reviewBody: Thoughtfully packaged, and well-designed, screen was clear without much glare. I was able to easily read documents and emails without any distortion or issues
name: Sharky Senior

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020
reviewBody: I'm a magazine editor and infographic designer, and needed an extra monitor to work from home. If I had the money, I'd probably get something with higher picture quality that could rotate and swivel and all that jazz. Unfortunately, I'm a magazine editor, so I don't have hundreds of dollars to drop on a monitor. This one cost me $120 and is great. It's got adjustable settings for brightness, has good resolution, and is nice and wide. I put it on a pile of books (they make a great cheap computer stand—stack them to any height you want!) and can rotate it left or right if I want. The only thing I'd like to have is some kind of forward or backward tilt motion, but again for $120 I can't complain.
name: Sara Chodosh

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
reviewBody: Beautiful, very good, it can tilt idk why ppl say it cant.
name: Trinity Gutierrez

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2019
reviewBody: For the price, it is great. Colors are vivid, Bezels are thin, Input lag is minimal.However, if you're like me, you might have issues with the monitor cutting in and out. This is not a driver issue with your GPU or IGP. It is the monitor. BUT there is a simple fix. You must turn off auto-source (or something like that). Turn off the option that auto detects a source. For some reason the monitor will cut out and look for another source randomly. Turning off this option will eliminate your screen cutting in and out. Other than this minor inconvenience, the monitor is perfect!
reviewTitle: Crisp and Affordable (SOLUTION TO SCREEN CUTTING IN AND OUT)
name: Liasfur

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2020
reviewBody: This monitor is absolutely perfect for my space! I’m so happy with it. For the price, it’s an especially awesome product. I just use it for work - no gaming or intense video watching. It does the trick perfectly. The only thing I will say is that since it’s so light, it shakes a little bit when I type on the keyboard. This bugs me but I’m sure I’ll get used to it. Overall, great product!
name: Hannah O.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2019
reviewBody: For $140 your only options for good color are hp, Asus, ViewSonic and Acer. I went for Acer and while I don't regret the purchase, the colors are not as vibrant as the ones on my terrible laptop display. The brightness is nice and the colors are good because it's an IPS monitor but they really are not vibrant at all, and you can notice this in games like Overwatch and Destiny. Also, other monitors at the same price range offer up to 75Hz while this one is only 60Hz.Buy this monitor if you're willing to lose out on 15 extra FPS and some vibrant colors. Otherwise, this is a really good IPS monitor at 23.8 inches. It's plastic, as expected from most monitors at this price range. The stand could also be higher so if you're tall or your desk is low, you're going to have to look a down a little since the monitor doesn't tilt enough to the back.
reviewTitle: Good for a budget IPS monitor
name: Dani S.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2021
reviewBody: I decided to add a larger monitor to mirror my MacBook. What a difference this monitor makes! Now I have 2 screens to multitask. This monitor is very thin, light and easy to install. I had to purchase a separate cable to link my MacBook but well worth it. Perfect for work, gaming and streaming!!
reviewTitle: For all you multitaskers out there
name: Sue

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2019
reviewBody: First I have to admit this product is one of the cheapest among those with similar tech specs. So, for the price, this is a good choice as long as you don't bear overrated expectation. There are two main facts you'd better know before you buy. The first is that the HDMI cable is not guaranteed is the box. If you take a careful look on the item list, you may find that the "HDMI cable" is optional. If you take into consideration of the extra money you pay for another HDMI cable, the total price is not so attractive as it appears. Secondly, adjusting the angle of the screen is somehow painstakingly. You cannot finish it with bare hands unless you prepare a screwdriver and a wrench.In conclusion, this product is good for your money but not perfect for your experience.
name: hanhan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020
reviewBody: Fast delivery. Easy to set up with clear instructions. I was looking for something to supplement my laptop. My desk is next to some windows and the picture holds up to the afternoon sun coming in. I like that the only light is under the screen, you can see it but it is not shining in your face. It is the perfect size as I use a computer riser on top of my deck. Have my laptop on the keyboard tray, and this screen and my ipad on the shelf. Would definitely recommend.
name: NBChicago

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020
reviewBody: This has been working great for a couple months! I love the sleek design. I don't know how to judge the colors of a display aside from saying that they look different than my other monitors (for better or worse). I use it mostly for coding and reading, so colors aren't super important to me (I do any design work on my MacBook display).Only quibble is that I would prefer the HDMI connector would angle downwards, rather than backwards—I set up this monitor close to a wall, and was afraid of squishing the HDMI cable jutting out from the back of it.I would buy again, and would highly recommend.
name: robert

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2021
reviewBody: I use this as a second monitor for work. I connect it to my Macbook Air from 2014 using HDMI. The connection is seemless and it turns on quickly. I read other reviews before this about how it tilts/doesn't tilt. I can confirm that this monitor DOES NOT tilt back. I don't know if that matters to me, but maybe it would for some people. Setup/assembly was relatively easy as well. Acer is a good brand and you cannot beat the price. I would highly recommend to purchase if you need a dual monitor setup.
name: Kim Jerantowski

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2019
reviewBody: I only have positive things to say about this monitor. The bezels being slim make it a great for a dual-monitor setup. The screen quality is very good for this price range, refresh rate is good, and honestly I'd have a hard time finding anything better for this price -- especially if you plan on a dual setup.
reviewTitle: Great, very thin monitor at a good price
name: Kalan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020
reviewBody: Press F8 on your keyboard and you will be able to read/edit docs on one screen and read another documents on the other screen. This monitor is great but doesn't come with directions. F8 does the trick.
reviewTitle: Here's how to Extend Your Screen and Work on two documents at once..press F8 on your keyboard.
name: TV Girl

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2021
reviewBody: For all I know this is a great monitor for people who use monitors on desks. I do not. I use my monitors attached to the wall, and never even considered that a modern monitor would NOT have mounting holes in it. So, for me at least, this is utterly worthless and useless.
reviewTitle: Never even considered that it might not be mountable.
name: SorchaCB

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
reviewBody: I also had the problem with the screen going black for 2 or 3 seconds at random intervals. I have a basic setup, no special video card. The problem showed up with in the first couple of days. Looked online, found a number of people reporting the problem, but no solution or even a cause of the problem. Returned it for a refund rather than try to fix it. Looked good when it was working, but going black was driving me nuts.
name: J. Murdoch

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2018
reviewBody: Picture is fantastic. Got a manufacturer refurbished model and it is wonderful. Tons is real estate. Accurate colors, to me anyway. I'm not a photographer. I totally recommend it if you're thinking about it. For my needs it is awesome. I record a lot of music in my home studio so I like the height it offers for my virtual mixing console and the length for tracking. It's awesome, oh I said that. Crisp, clear, easy to set up. sits solidly on my desk. Nice white and black shell. Cool. Can't beat the price, kids.
name: Victor Spoils

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
reviewBody: Anyone know how to remove the upright part of the stand? I cannot see how to detach it, and there's no way it's going back in the box with the stand attached?Plugged in VGA; only get picture on half the screen :-( I suggest you avoid this monitor.
reviewTitle: Screen cracked when received; only gets part of a picture anyway
name: Roger1

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2019
reviewBody: Oops! Didn't come with HDMI cord! Be warned! They sent a vga cord like that was a favor. Good thing i had one hanging around but that would have made me return it if hubby hadn't saved the day. Looks good, bright in a bright room, flat, ready assembly. Quite light. Good price except for the "you want a cord with that?"
name: Lisa K.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2019
reviewBody: It's ok for basic computing. I have two with a laptop and they are ok but slow to update. Also, 5 months after ordering, one is "flashing" and showing lightening in the background. I would not order again or recommend. Called Amazon and they told me to call the manufacturer. Called the manufacturer, they will repair if and only if I PAY to ship it back. Junk, junk, junk, run away from this item.
reviewTitle: Basic, low cost, low frills product, sure to break
name: Mickey

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2019
reviewBody: So far a good monitor for the money. The initial setup was a pain since the included HDMI cable was faulty. Went through multiple reboots and all the settings on the monitor before swapping the included cable with one from the twisted nest of random cords in the back of a drawer. Immediately connected when an old cord was used.Moral of the story -- Included cords are not tested - swap out with known good ones if you experience connection issues.
name: AC

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020
reviewBody: Really great value for the money! It's a super light monitor that's easy to set up. You can't adjust the height of the monitor (you would need a monitor stand) but it does tilt. I love the borderless frame look because it makes the screen look bigger. I use it for my work as an additional monitor and it's perfect for that - much easier to work with spreadsheets.
name: Sarah

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019
reviewBody: RECOMMEND: Absolutely!PROs:• The colors and quality are fantastic.• The cost was reasonable.CONs:• None.OVERALL:Granted, I am not a gamer, so I can't testify on the FPS performance. I mainly use this monitor for graphic design and other general office tasks. So far, two months of use and I have no complaints. Very happy with my purchase.
name: Richard Montoya

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2018
reviewBody: This is BY FAR THE WORST MONITOR EVERY!! I would not recommend this to anyone, especially someone who got hired to work from home. The screen turns on and off non-stop imediatly after it is turned on. I have not had this computer 4 months, and It won’t stay on for anything... this is the worst experience and now I’m looking for a RELIABLE monitor for work... ya gotta do better
reviewTitle: Very disappointed. This product doesn’t deserve a rating.
name: BOOMGHOST777

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2016
reviewBody: Picture is gorgeous.Still can't figure out how to get the sound to work. It's been 3 days with no sound. I've gotten by, but the tiny little buttons, on the bottom where we can't see, don't seem to do what on-line instructions I found said they would.If you want a good laugh, you can Google the problem of getting the sound/audio to work, and I'm not the first nor only. There's even a YouTube video of some guy explaining by "talking" about how to do it, and several comments from people: "But, we can't hear you!!!!". I couldn't either!
reviewTitle: If you want a good laugh, you can Google the problem of getting ...
name: Movie Fan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2015
reviewBody: Excellent monitors! Bought 2 odd them month ago to use for day trading the market. These replaced 3 10 year old 21 inch monitors that has all these years....were top of line Samsung's back then. These IPS screens are amazing! Are clear, bright and amazing screen details,and from most any angle, as advertised. After having these, at this great price, wonder why did not do this long time ago. Only negative is that there in no VESA attachment on back of monitors to mount. That is a minor drawback though, and the link below describes how a company is making an adaptor now! A huge record buy for all.
name: Happy Kindle Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020
reviewBody: I love having the same screen that I use at work. It is helping my vision adjust to the wider screen by having access to it here at home too. Very affordable price.
name: Hillside Retreat

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
reviewBody: I've been running this monitor for months now. I've never had the slightest issue at all with it ever. The color is very good overall along with all the other visibility aspect. It has a very crisp and very defined imagine when running any full HD media. For the money I'd recommend it to anyone that just wants a simple reliable monitor with a good picture to it.As this one fits that bill very well.
reviewTitle: Great deal on an excellent basic computer monitor.
name: Mike B Sr.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
reviewBody: This monitor is a great gaming monitor for the price. A little bit of screen tearing happens in some games, I experienced some in Rainbow Six Siege, but I did not experience any screen tearing in COD WWII. Yes, their is minor ghosting, but for $130 the 4ms response time is amazing for the price. The minor ghosting problems don't matter to me because it is very hard to spot and you wont notice a difference unless you are switching form a 1ms response time. The Acer monitor that I received does not have any backlight problems like others complain about. I am coming form an Dell S2417DG and the Dell has worse backlight bleeding than this one, oh and you can buy 3 of these acer monitors for the price of one Dell 2417DG. I bought one of these so far, I'm so happy with it that I am going to buy 2 more to have a full 3 monitor setup.
name: Ryan Graham

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
reviewBody: Monitor came in and we hooked everything up and it didn’t work. Talked to customer service and they walked me through tech support steps and then told they were sending a new one and a return label for the defective one. Waited for two weeks and nothing came. Contacted customer service again and was told that this model is out of stock and they would have to refund and email me a return label. Very annoyed.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2016
reviewBody: I have had this monitor for a little more than a week. Shipping & Delivery was good, and it arrived in three days. The box or the monitor itself was not damaged, and all was good. Acer even included a free VGA cable for those who didn't have one.After plugging it in, I was greeted with an Acer logo, and Windows auto-adjusted to fit it's crispy 1080p resolution. It was very nice to go from a 900p to a 1080p and this monitor did not fail to impress. For the price, getting a nice sized monitor with thin bezels and good resolution was impressive. There was never a problem with the response time, even while playing games like Counter Strike and Black Ops 3.PROS:Good PriceGood ResolutionThin BezelsGood Response TimeGood Materials/DurabilityGood LookVGA, DVI, HDMICONS:Angle is not adjustableOverall, I would not choose anything other than this for the price range. Great buy, Acer, you have a satisfied customer.
name: Jaimi C.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
reviewBody: Bought 2 of these in February/March timeframe, 1 screen started randomly blacking out in July. Figured out it was due to the hdmi port. Company wants me to send it in for repairs, which would be on my dime since covid shut down drop off sites. No thanks. Can still use the other port, but if you can spend another 100 or so just do it.***edit: the 2nd one just did the same thing.
name: Mikayla Kolodjay

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2017
reviewBody: I bought 2 of these a year and a half ago for my office workstation. I love the thin bevel that makes a side-by-side monitor configuration feel near seamless. The size is perfect for managing a true split screen that allows research to be on one side while writing in a document on the other. The monitor rests stable on the desk, and the round stand base is great for collecting coins, paperclips, etc. The monitor + stand is super thin and doesn't eat up very much footprint on your desk at all. I liked them so much at work that I just purchased 2 of them on my own for my home office.
reviewTitle: GREAT Monitors for Home or Office Use - Thin Bevel - Great Size for Work or Gamingf
name: Hip Dwayne

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
reviewBody: I ordered this based on solid reviews as well as the monitor's super slim profile. The monitor is indeed incredibly thin, and super light to hold. Picture/image quality was very good.My main complaint is that the monitor has absolutely no tilt function and when I mounted it into it's stand the screen tilted forward at least 1/4 inch. There is no way to adjust the mount so the screen sat perfectly vertical, so I had to resort to sliding wads of folded paper under the base like I was leveling a restaurant table with a book of matches. It was a workable solution, but after a few days I sent it back and ordered a different monitor that had tilt/swivel capability.
reviewTitle: High quality screen in a flimsy mount
name: Christopher D.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2016
reviewBody: Fantastic monitor! Very thin and light-weight while still retaining a sturdy stand. The lighting and colors look great on it, far better than any other monitor I've owned. I feel like the thin border around the screen compliments that, and is also great if you are looking for a dual or triple monitor setup as the space between your screens will be so minimal. Looks great with high-end gaming and HD movies, at least [for nVidia users] if your 'Output Dynamic Range' in your nVidia control panel is set to 'Full.' They tend to default that to a lesser setting which greatly tones down and fades your colors, but on the right setting it really looks amazing on this monitor, much more noticeable than on my last one.Not really sure what else to say. I haven't had any issues whatsoever and I've now owned this monitor for around 6 months. Definitely recommend it!
name: Brian Roper

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020
reviewBody: Has no holes on the back to mount to monitor arms. Huge disappointment in these monitors, bought 2 and it sucks, can’t mount them.
name: boisebeer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2019
reviewBody: I needed a bright, clear, high-res monitor for an electronics workbench where I can view electronic schematics while doing repairs of devices. For the price, I don't think I could have found a better monitor. SUPER thin, compact stand, and works amazingly well. I have it paired with an Intel Atom mini-computer for the sole purpose of view circuit diagrams (well, when I'm not watching Netflix instead of getting work done on the bench LOL)
reviewTitle: Really nice monitor for the price
name: Dave from Tacoma

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020
reviewBody: Overall, this is a great product for the average gamer, video editor, or photo editor.However, there is a couple of issue with it. The biggest being dead pixels. I've purchased two of these monitors for my dual monitor setup. And unfortunately, both of them have at least one dead pixel. On one monitor, it's near the center. And the other being on the top left.Past the dead pixels, if you use this for gaming and might use the built-in crosshair. Then the crosshair built into the monitor can unfortunately not be scaled and is absolutely massive.Besides that, it's overall a pretty decent cheap monitor. You may have to adjust the brightness and contrast a bit. But that's an easy enough fix. A quick tip, however. You CAN tilt this monitor up and down. It's just a bit tricky the first time doing it.
name: GreenMohawk

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019
reviewBody: Bought this to use as an external display for my laptop with a dock. Perfect choice on my $100 budget.Pros: Very nice picture, bright, several picture modes. Color and responsiveness is good. Some backlight bleed, but not terrible. HDMI and VGA ports. Zero-frame for a sleek look.Cons: Zero-frame does not mean zero bezel. Top and sides have a solid 3/8" of black border. Buttons are a little hit and miss as there is no text on the front lower bezel indicating which button does what.
name: Andrew

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020
reviewBody: the first one was damaged during shipment, most likely. the replacement came in and its ez2setup and good for its price. u will have to buy HDMI cable, even tho it comes with VGA cable. i also heard that some hidden features in this acer series, is it true? i have yet to tinker with the settings.
name: Dyingbetic

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021
reviewBody: This is a lightweight monitor with good picture and brightness. I ordered it as a second monitor for work and school (I am a law student and law clerk). My boyfriend also uses it for gaming. It is easy to move around and works great. Would recommend.
name: Brianna

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020
reviewBody: So I bought this for work in October because I needed a 2nd screen and it was in my price range. SPOILER ALERT!!! IT DOESN'T HAVE SPEAKERS! I was slightly annoyed at this discovery, especially since it wasn't blatant in the description.The reason why I gave such a scathing review is because 2 days ago the color malfunctioned on me. I turned it on and everything is blue and grey and no matter what settings I change, nothing happens. I guess I got what I paid for
name: Solovely

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020
reviewBody: I bought this monitor for work a little over a month ago but didn’t use it til yesterday, I took it out of the box and as you can see from the picture... it’s quite messed up, not sure if this was a problem in manufacturing or shipping but this was a huge waste of $120 I don’t really have to spare. I hope I can get a replacement and send this one back and hopefully change my opinion on this company but as of now I am very disappointed
reviewTitle: Please read before buying or judging this company.
name: Stephen LaCorte

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
reviewBody: This is a very good budget monitor for first switching over to PC gaming. Just to get a feel for the waters before going all out on a set up. I went with the top tier PC build and saved money on the monitor, I honestly haven’t had many issues that other reviews have pointed out, the monitors picture has been clean and not many screen tears or spots in the monitors picture. The only draw back so far has been some screen tears (but that happens with the top tier monitors), rendering and frame rate drops at times. But it’s honestly not that bad for a budget build. Although I do intend to upgrade my monitor soon. But I’ve been very happy with this monitor at its price point.
name: MetroL7

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2019
reviewBody: This is a fantastic monitor for the price. I use it for my desktop computer for general use, watching a few videos. The picture is clear and sharp. It is very thin which is great for me as I don't have a lot of space on my desk. I had it set up in about 15 minutes. Very nice and I'm glad I bought it.
name: Richard

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
reviewBody: Acer monitor worked for 5 months. Then a black blob appeared in left top corner with colored vertical and horizontal lines, some flickering, throughout. It's difficult to read spreadsheets through this blob. I don't know why this happened. It's been sitting on top of my desk and used only for 6 hours per day. Other reviewers report that the customer support information is outdated.
reviewTitle: Worked for 5 months until Black blob with colored vertical and horizontal lines
name: Close to Boston

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2020
reviewBody: needed a cheap monitor when I started working from home indefinitely. this one not only was within my budget, but I could kill two birds with one stone and grab a wireless keyboard and mouse, too. needless to say, these things were bought in a hurry and without much research, but they have surpassed my expectations exceedingly. the monitor has a sharp and bright quality to it, and the keyboard and mouse are very ergonomic. (they keyboard is quite loud, admittedly, but I prefer that type of sound and tactile response.)I'd recommend this to anybody in need of a well-priced and dependable monitor, and the combo mouse and keyboard if you're looking for a quick set-up, too.
name: ar.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2016
reviewBody: Very light and simple to set up, this Acer monitor has a sharp screen and is the perfect size for a smaller desk where you want a bright, large screen, but not too overwhelming. It's quite thin, with good response times and no flicker. Picture quality is overall very sharp and impressive. For the price, it's an excellent choice.My only complaint, and the reason for 4 stars, is that the blue VGA chord that connects my Lenovo laptop into the back fits well into the connector. But the little screw holes are misaligned, so I can only screw one screw post in and not the other to ensure a snug fit. Since nothing will be moving off my desk, it shouldn't really matter. But we should all appreciate good fit and finish in the products we buy, and this is clearly a quality control defect. But it's the only one,. Overall, the monitor is great, and affordable.
reviewTitle: this Acer monitor has a sharp screen and is the perfect size for a smaller desk where you want a ...
name: R. Jacobs

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
reviewBody: I don't buy monitors on any kind of regular basis ... read, never. I made the presumtion that all monitors have mounting holes so they can be affixed to stands. This monitor does not have mounting holes ... frustrating as that was my intent for purchasing two of them. I choose to keep them due to timing and immediate need, but I'm disappointed ... I'll make do. Functionally, they seem to be working fine.
name: S. Daylong

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021
reviewBody: I ordered this monitor as extra monitor for working from home, it’s a good budget monitor, not heavy to carry it around, with 1 HDMI port and 1 VGA port , and it’s working fine so far. Not compatible with VESA mount.
name: Yan

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2019
reviewBody: There is No sound or speakers built into this monitor....that is stated plainly in the description, so using external speakers is necessarry. Still, all in all, a very good price for the Image quality.Would have liked speakers....but....at this price I'm not complaining. Everything else that was of similar size and quality that included speakers was more expensive.This met my Budget And My Expectations to the tee.
reviewTitle: Very Nice Resolution/Image with this monitor....
name: Patrick A Long

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
reviewBody: Everyone should have a monitor as nice as this one. Got this as a present for myself and it's made working from home so nice. I have co-workers still not using an extra monitor. If you can afford it, this one is worth it. Very good quality, small footprint and sleek style.
name: Ang S.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2020
reviewBody: Been needing a second monitor for my laptop at my desk. At just above $90 this fit the bill nicely. I'm not gaming so no comments there but the picture is great for Outlook and coding.BTW: I bought this March 13 and now, March 18 the price jumped to about $240 from only 3rd partys. That is quite a price jump!
name: BikeWork

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020
reviewBody: The Acer monitor has a great picture quality. I'm not a gamer but for videos and documents it works perfect. I just ordered a second one. I already have a set of speakers, so the fact that the monitor doesn't have built in speakers is no issue for me. Good quality for a good price.
name: smokey

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2021
reviewBody: Was super frustrated to find this monitor didn't have wall/swing arm mount holes nor an adapter of any kind. Thought this was pretty standard with monitors these days as every other ACER monitor I've bought (Easily a half dozen over the last several years) has included them. If this is a new trend, will have to find a new go-to company.
reviewTitle: Careful, this monitor has no mount holes.
name: Sean Orlikowski

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
reviewBody: I hesitate to write a review because the picture quality on this monitor was terrible. When I spoke to someone else, they felt that I got a bad monitor bc these monitors were known to be very good. My husband thinks it may have been the cord that I purchased to connect it to my laptop. I ended up returning it. The return went very well, no issues so far.
name: Kay

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2017
reviewBody: Monitor stopped working after a couple months and now the screen remains black when powered on. Disappointed, will not be purchasing products from the Acer brand again.
reviewTitle: Monitor stopped working after a couple months and now the screen remains black when powered on.
name: Christian

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019
reviewBody: Bought the monitor for when I work from home, the 21" width allows me to have 2 MS office products open side by side to allow me to work more efficently. Along with the screen on my notebook, it is like having 3 monitors.Both HDMI & VGA connectivity makes it multi functional when using legacy equipment.No negatives here.
name: Just a guy

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020
reviewBody: Easy to setup and put together. Nice picture with good color and fine resolution. Does what I need quite well especially for the price.
name: Robert Swanson

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
reviewBody: After about a month the screen shows all these little red specs all over. Not a clear picture at all. Very unhappy that I can’t return after 30 days, which unfortunately is when this defect happens. I would not recommend.
name: Raquel Escorcia

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020
reviewBody: They sure packed a lot into this monitor. I got two for gaming and they work wonderfully, so much I can hook up my console to them and watch tv. Crisp image and low profile sides so they mesh well if you have more than one. I have had them about a year and they run perfectly with no runs or color distortion.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
reviewBody: best value for the price. I have three of these monitors and we connect our work and school computers to it. Ease of connection and it does come with connector cables which is a plus. The picture is clear, crisp and cold vivid. I'm not a gamer, nor the girls. But heard from countless friends it is good. Superb quality and worth the investment.
name: gogo

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2021
reviewBody: This thing is so much better than what I had! No light bleeding or hot spots. Some people have mentioned that the screen would flash on and off. I had the same issue, no worries it's just an issue with the HDMI cord I used. I am totally considering getting a second one and a monitor arm. Obviously not a super high refresh rate but when your gaming with a 1660 super high refresh rate doesn't matter. GREAT for people on a budget who need a good monitor.
name: Jordan Armstrong

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020
reviewBody: Whatever the description says, the screen stands straight up and does not tilt. It's annoying, but what do you want for under a hundred bucks. The picture quality is good. I found that slipping a 1-inch or 1.5 inch three-ring binder under the stand, rings toward you, improves the angle a bit.
name: aar4

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2016
reviewBody: Was a bit hesitant on purchasing this monitor considering how low the price was versus all the specs. After I received it I was pretty thrilled about the quality and size of this monitor. I had an 8 year old 19'' monitor prior to this one so the difference in image quality was staggering. There wasn't any instructions on the assembling of the stand and monitor mount but it was pretty intuitive. Now I am considering getting another one for dual screen!Pros:Good specs for priceGreat 1080p picture quality for games/moviesThin bezelCons:Only came with VGA cable (luckily I had an extra HDMI cable lying around)Would recommend to anyone looking for a budget 23.9'' monitor or upgrading from an older monitor.
name: SpaceR

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020
reviewBody: The reviews from others speak for themselves---this monitor is indeed a terrific buy. The only setting I changed straight out of the box, was to turn down the brightness, a very easy task once you read where the settings.Highly recommended, for certain. Note: not a gamer, so no comment on that aspect.
reviewTitle: Excellent monitor in this price group
name: Ted

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
reviewBody: I will firstly admit, I was a bit skeptical about buying this monitor. I had seen the bad reviews and also watched a TON of youtube videos about this monitor. Also, it was below $100?! Fearing that there would be a defect or something. But when I opened it and inspected the hardware, all was great. As for the screen when i set it up. My God, it's absolutely brilliant. It's DEFINITELY OUTSTANDING given the price it was! I do light gaming, drawing and video editing and this is PERFECT!
name: Hope

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2019
reviewBody: This screen its great for office work, for playing video games the image quality and refresh does not help however this still a good monitor for the price.The only problem I found its that you cant adjust the monitor at all, no up/down, left/right, etc. once mounted that's it.
name: Jose R.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2021
reviewBody: I purchased two of these monitors the first I purchased over a year ago with great picture quality for the price, however the second time around was a nightmare with horrible yellow like resolution.
reviewTitle: VERY HORRIBLE COLOR ON SECOND MONITOR
name: Tammy

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
reviewBody: Display shows "60" refresh rate on the upper corner of the screen - in yellow. Can't make it go away, so I called Acer. The girl was clueless, really clueless, put me on hold for 30 minutes and then hung up while I was waiting. Did a chat with Amazon, where the girl at least tried to help, but couldn't. After 2 hours I said, "It's going back!" I once had an Acer laptop, that wasn't much good, either. I won't buy their products again.
name: John R. Hamilton

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021
reviewBody: I bought this for my 2nd computer. But my old 9 years $130 monitor is still better. But this one is good for gaming. Black points contrast is hard to control and see or some angle is not flexible to see.
reviewTitle: Good for gaming. not recommend for Photo or Video user
name: Leo

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
reviewBody: Ever since the country went on lockdown and I was forced to work from home on a full-time basis, I needed to make sure that I had all the comforts of work, at home. This monitor was just what I needed to complete my home office. It was a great deal and the video quality is excellent!
name: Cali Love

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
reviewBody: This works perfect for my needs. Working from home is a whole lot easier with this. I can look at documents on one screen and work on docs with the other. Split screen worked but this is better. I had to buy an adapter to use with my ChromeBook.
reviewTitle: Arrived on time in good condition
name: Karenw

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
reviewBody: I have owned this monitor for about 3 years, finally upgrading so I thought I would review this.Pros: Pretty big, its no ultrawide but more than enough for 2 windows open side by side 3 years I have never noticed any dead pixels or had any hiccups at all with the operation of the panel Sleek look, thin about 1/2 or 3/4 in panelCons: only 60hz pretty much the only reason I'm upgrading for. If super high fps isnt important to you then dont worry
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019
reviewBody: I don’t write reviews but this item deserves it. I took about 2 weeks of research to find the correct monitor I wanted. Keeping in mind: price, size, specs. This monitor is absolutely amazing. Honestly has gone ABOVE my expectations especially for $89. So, someone who wants a monitor and is a IT specialist, let me tell you GET THIS MONITOR! Won’t regret it. Also if you want to mount to this item look up in amazon “wali mount adapter” and you can mount this! Hope this review has helped decide where to spend your money.
reviewTitle: Buy it, you will not regret it
name: Jon

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020
reviewBody: Probably the best computer monitor for under $100 on amazon! I thought the size would be an issue, but it really doesn't feel small! I bought two thinking I would need it, but the average person could probably go with just 1. Great for 1080p gaming! I really don't notice any screen tearing or input lag! I would recommend for anyone looking for an entry level gaming monitor either for PC or any system!
name: Daniela

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
reviewBody: Was looking for a second monitor in order to have for working from home. Didn’t want to spend a lot for something I’d only use a bit a week. Searched for about 2 weeks, Amazon, Best Buy - finally read reviews and ended up with the one. Turned out to be great so far. Came with all needed cords, picture is good and size is perfect. I am delighted!
name: Liz G

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2021
reviewBody: The screen completely peeled at the corner. At first we thought it was a screen protector but it was not. It started chipping off less than a month after purchase. Fortunately, Amazon was great and we returned the monitor and upgraded to a different brand.
name: Mom of Two

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020
reviewBody: It's the perfect size for my home office. I didn't want something that was too big or too small and this one fits the bill. I have it connected to my laptop using an HDMI cord and it works perfectly. The HDMI cord did not come with this screen (not sure if it was missing or not). The picture is clear and bright and you can adjust the settings. Highly satisfied.
reviewTitle: Great monitor for my home office
name: Wendi

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2021
reviewBody: I just needed an extra monitor that wouldn’t break the bank for a work from home job. It works great with my MacBook Pro. I can use my remote desk top and personal desk top at the same time. Great deal for the price.
name: KLA

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2021
reviewBody: Very disappointed, I read all the great reviews and was very hopeful, but the screen quality on this is not good. I am connected via hdmi to an hp elitebook850. Tried a different hdmi cord, did not help. The screen looks like it has crosshatching, to the point where colors in excel look terrible. The orange looks like it has yellow lines running vertically through it! Maybe I am missing a simple setting somewhere but I am really unhappy right now :(
name: Brian Stewart

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
reviewBody: I don't know if the technology has improved this much or what else it could be but this monitor really surprised me. I have been using an older LCD monitor in this application that costs much more than this one and the difference in picture quality is something you really have to see to appreciate.You used to have to pay a lot of cash for this kind of quality, this monitor is a great deal. The four is because I don't do gaming and it wouldn't be fair for me give it a great rating for something I don't do.
reviewTitle: This monitor greatly exceeded my expectations
name: Carl Rash

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2019
reviewBody: I bought this to connect HDMI to my Canon C100 MII. It's SO MUCH easier to shoot corporate videos and interviews with this little guy running at my feet. Fits into a Gator case I purchased with the foam shipping sides in place perfectly - so it's a perfect little package.... It DOES tilt, it's plenty bright, it weighs about the same as an order of French toast.....
name: Matthew Peyton

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2020
reviewBody: Highly recommended, good price for the quality. Used for gaming and so far so good.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2018
reviewBody: For the money, this monitor is worth it! The colors are great for my laptop! My laptop only goes up to 1080p and has a 980m graphics card. The monitor is smooth and hooks up via HDMI. My laptop shows that supposedly this monitor has speakers but according to the manufacturer, these are not set up in the monitor. The other awesome thing about this monitor is how light this thing is!
name: Elvis

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2021
reviewBody: Bought this for my son in college as an extra monitor. Worked perfectly and connected easily to his laptop. He does programming so not sure how it performs for gaming but for the price you can’t go wrong.
name: Heidi J

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2021
reviewBody: This is a budget monitor. At this price point, the monitor is way better than expected. Not as sharp as you might like, but fine for casual use or casual gaming. Great value
name: DK

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2017
reviewBody: I find this monitor to be very good. It has a very nice display with no internal speakers. If you use the HDMI input, you will need to hook up your external speakers to the back of the monitor (audio output), or you could opt to use earphones there.Going by the pictures of the monitor, I was not impressed with the look of the stand. However, after setting it up, it looks fine. The stand seems plenty strong enough and stable.As I understand, the on screen menus have remained the same for several years, and they are not user friendly at all. So if you have had an Acer monitor lately, you will probably not find the menus confusing to tweak. But this is our first Acer monitor, and although we are not idiots, we find it takes a LOT of time to begin to get things tweaked. This is not a minor consideration if you like to set the monitor to your comfort zone, therefore I can't give it 5 stars.
reviewTitle: I find this monitor to be very good. It has a very nice display with no ...
name: Carole Ladendorf

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2016
reviewBody: These monitors are fantastic for the price and show to be a good value. The super thin bezel makes it a great monitor for a dual monitor setup. I haven't and won't be using the sound aspect of these so I can comment on that. The color is great and they're plenty bright. I was bummed that they weren't VESA compatible right out of the box (mysteriously a hard to find option among monitors lest than $200) but there are adapters https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01771Q6U2/ref=ox_sc_sfl_title_2?ie=UTF8&psc=1&smid=A383DI1D5IGYZ0 that will allow you to mount them to a VESA system but they will knock the price up to the realm of monitors that may come with the VESA capability out of the box.Main reasons for buying this monitor:PriceThin bezel for dual monitor setup (oh so thin!)IPS!Only time will tell if they last as long as my old 10 year old HP 17" flat panel
name: SolidusPaulus

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2021
reviewBody: Great picture. Helps working from home feel like less of an incumbrance.
name: AD

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2018
reviewBody: If you are looking for the best priced 1080p monitor, then you've found it. The stand may be slightly off but it may be a small error with my order. Even with that, it's impossible for me not to give this a 5/5. The picture quality is amazing, freesync, 75 Hz, and a 100mil to 1 contrast!???EDIT: Got a stuck pixel less than 24 hours after it arrived and after less than 5 hours of use. Fantastic, right?EDIT2: Thank god for Amazon and their customer support. Got a replacement the day of reporting my issues. The second screen came in and it's perfect. No dead or stuck pixels and a fantastic screen quality.
name: Stanley

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020
reviewBody: Came and looks as expected! Easy to assemble, nice and light weight. Only thing I would’ve liked for it would have been if the screen face could tilt forward just a little (instead only goes from vertical to backward tilt). I bought a set of hmdi cables to go with it as this doesn’t come with those.
name: Book Lover

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2018
reviewBody: If you're looking for a gaming monitor, and all your PC friends are telling you that you need the 1ms response time, you don't, your eyes can't tell the difference unless you're coming from a 1ms response time monitor. The colors are gorgeous on this and the response time is great. The border is super small, so the monitor itself looks really fresh and modern. No complaints from me, ordered a second one for my mom, so that she can have a second monitor to work on; perfect for really any situation - 24 inches and beautiful, really can't beat it
reviewTitle: Great price for a fantastic monitor
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
reviewBody: I absolutely love this monitor. This thing cost me half of what some fancy monitor would have cost me at a store, it's one screw to assemble it, lightweight, HDMI compatible, and the picture quality is amazing. It's lightweight so I push it aside and eat at my desk when I'm deep in a project and it has this soft, easy on the eyes glow to it that I can't explain but cherish. My eyes don't hurt after 10 hours of shameless gaming and that is worth a 10/10 in my book.
name: Dave

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2017
reviewBody: I've had this monitor for a while now. A good couple months anyways. I have to say, the quality is amazing! I use this for my video editing PC. It helps with seeing the little details in my videos! Clarity of the images are fantastic, even more than I'd expect from this price point! If you are on the verge of choosing between this and another at this price range, get this one! Don't hesitate another minute!
reviewTitle: If you have 2 you are deciding between, get this one now!
name: DannThePannin'Man

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020
reviewBody: No joke, the monitor came in a ripped box. Not even in its original packaging, just the monitor. Obviously the monitor was completely broken. Never buying from Acer again. They mark the product as "NEW" but sends me a product that's clearly not NEW since it's not in it's original packaging and broken. What a waste of time and effort.
reviewTitle: Bought a NEW monitor, came completely broken and not even in its original packaging
name: Peter Cha

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2017
reviewBody: Purchased to replace 2 monitors to make more room on a small desk. The resolution is just fine for a monitor in this price range. I've had no problems with it whatsoever. I will split the screen and have it do the double duty my two prior monitors were doing. My only problem is it is stationary -- cannot shift up/down. I'd like it to shift up a tad, but I was aware this was not a function when I ordered it and thought it would not be much of a problem; hence, the 4 stars rather than a 5 star rating.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2020
reviewBody: I use this monitor to add a second display for my laptop. It's been great to have a larger monitor to reduce the strain on my eyes. The one drawback is that I notice there's no way to mount on anything other than the stand it came with. No mounting screw holes on back.
name: Adam H

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020
reviewBody: Can’t believe I paid $90 for this monitor. It’s really amazing for the price. I can’t speak to it’s use as a hardcore gaming screen. But, for my WFH needs it truly hits it out of the park. Outlook, Word, YouTube Etc are all flawless. Seriously, just buy this thing you can have a great monitor for less than a round of drinks at the local watering hole.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2016
reviewBody: I don't qualify as a real discriminating user. The monitor works fine. I had to check if my computer had an HDMI output. When I plugged it in, I discovered that I had the Microsoft dual monitor setup. This was a true and pleasant surprise. In the past in order to run 2 monitors I had to purchase a special video card. My Lenovo computer treated the monitor plugged into the video out port and the one connected to the HDMI port as 2 separate displays. I really expected that they would each display the same thing. I found nothing to dislike about the monitor, but I love the dual display.
name: S. Connors

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018
reviewBody: Spesking solely of the way the monitor looks, it resembles a very premium monitor. I was pretty impressed with how it looks, it looks even better than my other monitor that was 2x more expensive. The picture quality is nice, a little bright but with the settings adjusted it looks great. Do no hesitate to purchase. Has multiple inputs to the back of the monitor
name: Jeromy L. Veloz

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2019
reviewBody: If you are looking for something of impressive quality and low budget this is your monitor. Believe me I was doubting about this purchase but it really impressed me. I enjoy the quality and although it’s not something beyond awesome it is truly a great purchase and it does the work. This is a good start for any gamer. You won’t regret it.
name: Abisai BonOv

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
reviewBody: Bought this to have a monitor for WFH. Set it up and from first power-up, it has had vertical stripes all the way across the screen. Looks sort of like an excel spreadsheet with thin darker lines and wider slightly lighter ones, both in grey. No amount of fiddling with controls seems to make it go away. Nothing in the manual or anywhere else that I've found to remedy.
name: WA Father

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020
reviewBody: Seems brand new. No problems at all. Shipped safe in solid packaging. Speakers are built into the monitor but they're not as loud as you'd like them which is expected for built-in. I'm not a monitor expert but the picture quality appears good. You could hear a quiet hum when the monitor is on though but you don't notice it unless you're paying attention. I've been using it for gaming no problem for several months without issue.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
reviewBody: Bought it for home office and I am extremely satisfied with the clarity and overall look. I bought two and the slim bezels do aid in having a proper dual screen experience. I use it for office work and for that it is perfect.
name: AydAmazon

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
reviewBody: I really like this monitor for my desk at work. I don't have a ton of space but this monitor is so thin that it really makes the most of the area that I do have. The quality of the picture is excellent and the screen does in fact tilt, despite what other reviews say. Super easy to set up and I have recommended it to others in my office.
reviewTitle: Great monitor for a small space
name: AJB7993

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
reviewBody: Bought 2 of these one was fine picture looks great, the other was okay but had a dead pixel when I called Amazon for a return they wanted me to talk to Acer so after 30 minutes of waiting the guy tells me it's not going to hurt my computer and it should be fine. Its brand new and defective no it's not fine, Amazon is sending 2 brand new ones for exchange.
name: diane

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019
reviewBody: I bought this monitor to use as a home computer screen in place of my laptop's 13-inch screen, and the difference it made was astounding. It has a tremendous value for the price, the picture quality is very good as well. It works great on my small desk because of it's thin flatscreen and small profile, easy color customization, different settings for maximum frame rate blurring, crisper photo quality, and color accuracyMy only complaint is that it is only able to push out 75 frames/second.Overall, it was a great buy, I would consider buying a second for a larger desk area.
name: J-3946

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
reviewBody: I purchased this as a second monitor and it is perfect at that. If you were on a budget you could definitely game on it. Not being used to higher quality and Hz monitors it is perfectly fine.
reviewTitle: Great monitor for its price, probably one of the best to game on at its price point
name: Matt

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2017
reviewBody: Crisp, bright images. No dead pixels. Nice thin bezel makes it very attractive. Plug and play - HDMI connection couldn't be easier. Thought my old Samsung 2253BW was nice, but this is nicer. A pleasure to look at. Menus are straightforward, though tweaking is not required. It's gorgeous straight out of the box. The base is a little funky, but seems quite stable. Overall, a tremendous value, and an excellent choice for most desktop work. I don't think you'll be disappointed.
name: nhhmd

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2017
reviewBody: Great monitor! I even received compliments from two different nerd-friends on how small the bezel (part surrounding the pixel display) is. I will definitely be buying another one of these when I have a big enough desk to accommodate 2 of them. I was worried when I read other reviews about some backlight bleeding, but I haven't noticed that yet working in both dark and light screens.Fun fact: In a new MS Excel spreadsheet on this huge monitor, I can see all the way to column AD and row 43.
reviewTitle: Great monitor! I even received compliments from two different ...
name: Dana C. Ransdell

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2019
reviewBody: No complaints other than a slight glow on a black screen near the edges. Not a big deal though, especially for this price. This monitor has been serving me well for a very long time. I do wish the base had a smaller footprint and I wish it was adjustable up and down. But overall I am very happy with this monitor.
name: Ryan Stewart

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2021
reviewBody: No tiene volumen integrado y ya eso es un problema porque tienes que usarlo con bocinas aparte y tenia cómo un ruidito, 😔 no fue de mi agrado
name: Yuli

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2021
reviewBody: Hermoso monitor gran calidad delgado, buen precio, no es el monitor mas de alta gama pero es un monitor decente
name: Fernando Adarme

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
name: Leah Dudley

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2021
reviewBody: This monitor is a good size and gets the job done for what I need, but it's just ok. The stand is wobbly, which is disappointing and there's a dead pixel which was present from the start.
name: SKH

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021
reviewBody: Everything about the TV is true.It’s great for gaming good picture and it’s a decent size the only downfall is it has no speaker so you can’t hear the volume unless you have headphones
name: UncleP

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
reviewBody: I just purchased my second one (to set up a dual monitor to work from home). The quality of these monitors for the low price is really unbelievable. Buy it. You will not be disappointed in the least.
reviewTitle: One of the best deals I have found in years.  They could sell these for 3 times the price.
name: SBAZ

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2016
reviewBody: When I ordered this Acer R240HY bidx product I thought that I was not going to be that satisfied with this monitor because it does not have VESA mounting functionality. An earlier review from another customer bought a V3 mounting bracket, disassembled the stand and managed to get it set up on a mount.Earlier this week I bought this mounting bracket:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01771Q6U2?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s00I found that it fits perfectly and is the same exact size as the stand part that slides into the monitor. Now I am waiting on my mount to arrive and I will update this review later once I have everything set up.Update: The Acer R240hy bidx DOES have VESA mounting capabilities. The company tested the adapter above and they state that it in fact does work with this Acer r240hy bidx monitor.
name: Caleb Wells

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2018
reviewBody: Very tiny bezels make this display seem even larger than it is. I use it for general office use, and the display works very well for my purposes. It is not ultra HD, but it's not trying to be either. Major improvement over the 17" second display I was using.
name: MM

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019
reviewBody: There is no tilt on the monitor stand. Nor can you adjust the height. Fixed at 4" and a slight forward lean. Plus it didn't work on vga with the thinkpad laptop. Non-existent documentation. The "optional" hdmi cable was missing. Being returned, not worth your money!
name: Kindle Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021
reviewBody: Nice monitor, but pay more attention than I did. There are no VESA mounting holes on this monitor. The monitor can only be used on the supplied stand.
name: Jim Giarrusso

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020
reviewBody: Picture quality is amazing. Highly recommend this for gaming.
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2018
reviewBody: Just received and installed two of these puppies on one PC after returning the (un-named) copy cats. These are better. Basically the same monitor except these have DVI inputs in addition to HDMI and VGA. I was very disturbed to learn that there just are not any graphics cards out there that have dual HDMI outputs and any type of converter is really expensive. These monitor are tool-less assembly, good, power supply in the middle of the cord, good, not a wall wart blocking the outlets. The same bezel-less design as the copy-cat's. The don't have height adjustment, but at $130 what do you expect. FYI they are the correct height for my use. These will be my monitors for several years to come.
reviewTitle: Very Satisfied with this purchase and the product.
name: Hollywood

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020
reviewBody: I really love these, they are very light and thin, beautiful picture for me, and a really fantastic price. We'll see how long they last because they will get alot of use once my setup is complete
name: Notorious Pink

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2019
reviewBody: I'm on a budget and this monitor exceed my expectations in terms that I was expecting something crappy. Sharp image when doing normal tasks pike web browsing, but when it comes to playing games I can see the pixels and in combination with default brightness it makes my eyes hurt. So when I'm playing games I found that lowering the brightness helps a little.
name: Amanda Ulloa

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2020
reviewBody: Settings were very frustrating. Get it bright enough and the contrast was compromised. Standard and graphics mode everything looks like evening with a dark tint. I returned this and put my older 27" Acer back in service.
name: L. Ion May

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020
reviewBody: Actually changing the rating from 4 to 5 stars when considering the price of this monitor. For the price, it’s an excellent monitor! Very happy with it so far. Until your rig is ready for 1440, in my opinion, this monitor is amazing. Just a great balance of features and economy. If you’re on a budget, look no further.
name: Kyle

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2016
reviewBody: Purchased as a replacement for a family member. I've heard not one complaint.My take is that it is very light and the near nada bezel is very cool. Sits stable, but would take much vibration to make this item wobble in a non-threatening manner. Buttons easy to find and memorize.-1 Star for function sync. Could be just me.Used on a Win 8.1 laptop the HDMI interface will not recognize or display the boot sequence when say you press F12 for boot options from the bios.
name: Off The Beaten Path

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2017
reviewBody: The only problem I've had is with the button strip along the bottom. If this monitor is in a cold area the casings around the buttons will contract and cause them to activate, causing a well-known bug where the menu keeps popping up like there's a ghost in the machine. I solved this by removing the button strip so it's outside the casing of the monitor where I taped it to the bottom, thus removing the phenomenon.
reviewTitle: I ain't afraid of no ghost.
name: Clinton Labombard

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
