reviewBody: I use this as a second monitor for my 1080p 17" laptop. For less than 100 bucks, you can't go wrong, just don't expect it to be a gaming quality monitor. Great for productivity tasks. Thin, light, bright.
name: Ben Kickert

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020
reviewBody: Works great. Easy to install and set up. My only regret is that it doesn’t have speakers built in but that’s on me for not checking. Good price. So much bigger than my laptop screen. Love it. Unbelievably thin too.
reviewTitle: Excellent monitor but does not have speakers
name: Kindle Customer99999

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2019
reviewBody: The monitor itself is more than likely the best monitor for the price on Amazon. Quality, crystal clear picture that will surely be a major upgrade if you’re switching from low end monitor that might not support 1920x1080 resolution.I work remotely and purchased two monitors to connect to my Surface Pro 4 dock. Both displays worked like a charm as soon I plugged in the HDMI Cables (There’s also a VGA input), and adjusted resolution automatically.Pros: The picture quality is great and the power cord is exceptionally long if you’re someone like me who has fairly large workspace and sometimes has issues reaching an outlet.Cons: There’s very little tilt in the monitors and the stand seems cheaply made and is difficult to adjust.
name: Thomas Hunt

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2018
reviewBody: This is a great monitor that looks great, with its low profile borders. I like that it turns on and off automatically, so I don't have to worry about remembering to it off when I leave work.I got this one to replace another monitor that I bought which had a glossy screen and was unusable do to the glare. This one has no glare, without compromising picture quality or a sleek look.
reviewTitle: No glare and low profile borders
name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2019
reviewBody: This monitor is the king for its price tag. I replaced a 2010-era Samsung 22" originally valued at $220, and this Acer looks better. The brightness capability is simply amazing when compared to older-model LCDs. The monitor's design is sleek and cheap, but what did you expect? Get the warranty for peace of mind!
name: John Szewczyk

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021
reviewBody: I have only had this monitor for 4 months and it has already begun to flicker. So glad I got a warranty on this thing. Do some research on monitors before you just buy any random one like I did.
reviewTitle: Monitor has begun to flicker after 4 months of usage.
name: I need music equipment ASAP

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2016
reviewBody: This monitor has such good picture quality that it puts my HD television to shame. I am glad I chose this monitor because the HD 1080p resolution makes the images much clearer which is perfect for gaming. The monitor is also the perfect size to completely fill my field of vision even at 30 inches away. It also has an HDMI port so that you can connect it to a cable box to watch television. I am not disappointed and if I knew someone that needed a new monitor I would get them this one as a gift.
reviewTitle: Puts my HD 1080p TV to shame
name: Kindle Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021
reviewBody: I needed a monitor for my new laptop and it was exactly what I was looking for. Works great, has a bright clear picture.
name: Fitzzbm

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2021
reviewBody: Using monitor in.conjunction with a laptop for online meetings - one screen for video conferencing and the second for.documents.
name: Tina

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2018
reviewBody: It suits well for my needs: gaming and studying. Its really thin! Installing its not hard and also it can be configured to your needs. For $104 shipping included, and the fact that is a GAMING monitor, its not something common to find. Also, the monitor is perfect if you have a corner to game or if you are going to make videos. Its kinda bad it doesn't have built-in speakers nor webcam, But anyone can solve that with a soundbar and a detachable webcam.
reviewTitle: Great Monitor for Great price, Great for my needs
name: Angel Garcia

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2018
reviewBody: But there's a ton of light bleed around the edges of the screen. It's fine if the screen isn't dark. Being used as a 3rd monitor, it's a decent item. Colors seem true and it's very bright overall. Much moreso than my other monitors.
name: Starlight

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021
reviewBody: Bad quality. Purchased this at the end of March 2020 and it stopped working at the end of October 2020. Half of the screen went black and the other half is too dim to see much. There's a 3 year Acer warranty but they don't cover shipping. It's almost $100 to ship by mail which is not worth it given that the monitor is $120..... will probably need to trash this.
name: Elizabeth L

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2020
reviewBody: More like a gaming monitor. Has a ghastly bluish screen color that cannot be made warmer.
reviewTitle: Screen color unpleasant to the eye.
name: Yngve D. Roennike

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2020
reviewBody: I bought this back in July for my Home office. For the first few week the monitor seemed to be working just fine. After that the screen will randomly shut off and turn back on for no apparent reason. In a period of an hour working on my computer, this cycle of turning off and on happens about 30-40 times. This is extremely frustrating as I try and work with Excel and plans review. I do NOT recommend buying this monitor, Its cheap and the quality shows. Spend $50-$75 more and go with a different brand and it will be worth your head ache in the future.
reviewTitle: Randomly Screen going black and turning back on.
name: Quentin randazzo

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2020
reviewBody: This is a great monitor! I needed a second monitor while working on my Master's Degree and working from home. Easy set up and good quality!
name: TexasMommyofBoys

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020
reviewBody: The Acer monitors, when used with the HDMI splitter, make an excellent platform for statistical modeling. I have as many as 3 Excel spreadsheets open at any one time when entering data for my model and the two Acer monitors make it extremely easy to move data among the spreadsheets.
reviewTitle: The Acer monitors, used with the HDMI splitter, make good multi-screen for statistical modeling.
name: Richard G. Lillie

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2018
reviewBody: I was searching around for a monitor to use with my 2016 MacBook Pro. Didn't want to pay a lot either. After getting this, it was super easy to put together and use. I am super pleased with it. Now, my eyes can get a break. Picture is very good, colors and sharpness very good. I use my USB-C to HDMI hook up. Great buy.
name: Steve TwentyOne

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2017
reviewBody: 4.5/5 Stars. Bought this on 09/04/2016. I was using a 21" TN Monitor before this.My use case is pretty general. I do some design work on the side at times, no gaming or anything.The setting I use during the day is Standard, but I turned off the blue light setting and set OSD to 0.At night, I use a custom setting -- the same as my Standard one, but the brightness is set to 10. I also use f.lux (warms up the color of your display to match your room at night) which I highly recommend if you are looking at your screen for as long as I do.PROS:- For the price, this monitor was far better than I expected.- The screen size is an upgrade from a laptop and 21" monitor. Not sure if I can go back to a very clunky bezel for long-term use now.- Colors are good. No dead pixels. No ghosting.- The non-glossy screen is exactly what I hoped for.- The power brick -- it's pretty small compared to some I've seen other screens come with.- Very lightweight. Easy to put together without any issues.CONS:- It is very wobbly and easy to tip simply by pressing the power button. That is the cost of having it be lightweight, I suppose.I can see it being knocked over very easily, so I do not recommend placing it anywhere too precarious. Definitely not near children or nosy pets unless it is weighted down solidly.- Man, it is BRIGHT. At times, this is really helpful for certain things. If you are a hermit like me that enjoys sitting in the dark, well -- you'll have to adjust to that a bit.- The settings are difficult to navigate through. There is no way to tell the difference between exit/back, up/down, forward, and power on/off. Even after a year, I still accidentally hit the wrong button here or there sometimes. I put small piece of tape on the power button so I can feel the difference.OVERALL: I think this is a really good monitor to start with and I am happy with it.
name: Lulo A.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2020
reviewBody: So far I have bought three of these monitors. Two for my desktop setup and one for an arcade machine that I made. Obviously this is one of the cheapest monitors that has good specs that you can get online. Pros and Cons below.Pros:Really cheapLow (ish) LatencyAmazing color balance (I have seen more expensive monitors with much worse color balance)Full HDCons:Doesn't ship with an HDMI cable
reviewTitle: Great Budget Monitor with excellent color
name: Aaron B.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020
reviewBody: It does the job for now but it does not have the best picture
reviewTitle: the picture is not very sharp
name: Ray-Consumer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2018
reviewBody: Monitor worked perfectly for 1.5 years, then suddenly one day there was a vertical line going down the screen - not dead pixels, just a line of pixels a few shades darker than the surround pixels. Just enough to be annoying. The warranty was mostly useless, as it requires me to pack and ship to Texas at my expense. Just not worth it, which is probably what Acer is counting on. Fortunately I don't use the monitor daily, so for now I will probably live with it. It's really a shame, it was a beautiful monitor while it lasted. I definitely won't buy another Acer.
name: Elaine C.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2016
reviewBody: I came form an old 20" Hp monitor. It's been about 3 weeks since I had this monitor. Overall it's a big improvement over my old one. It is much easier on my eyes, the colors are bright and vivid. Viewing angle is excellent. Reading news online is not painful as it was before.I did not noticed any difference in my gaming experience, except much better colors and contrast.If you are looking for a good monitor on a budget, this one fits the bill. I'm a happy camper.
reviewTitle: Viewing angle is excellent. Reading news online is not painful as it ...
name: Bobo

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
reviewBody: Great product! The color is awesome and it’s perfect for gaming. My only complaint is I wish it was bigger, but that’s my own fault for being cheap. Lol I paid less than $100 and this is great quality.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2016
reviewBody: the perfect screen size, really you dont need anything bigger then this. the resolution is great and everything just visually looks nice and the small edge along the sides is also nice.it also has the ability to use a HDMI cable if for whatever reason you want to use one instead of the regular cable.i knocked a star off though due to it not having any noticeable way of adjusting the screen, the screen isnt positioned poorly for me but some people like their computer screen to be angled a certain way.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
reviewBody: Picture is clear and it works well 👌🏼

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2021
reviewBody: First off, to anyone considering to buy this monitor. Do it. It's worth the money.My question is this; why does the outer box say that it's a renewed monitor? I thought I bought a brand new monitor.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2019
reviewBody: When it worked it was great- that only lasted for about 2 months now it doesnt recognize anything through the hdmi port or the vdi port. Was supposed to be my 2nd screen for my home office not its just in the way...😢

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2020
reviewBody: NGL, I've been using the same old, decrepit monitor for about a decade. I was about to replace my entire gaming rig when I stumbled across this monitor. It is SO much sharper than my old monitor. It feels like I have an entirely new computer at my disposal.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
reviewBody: Bought 2. One display died in less than a couple of years. Both were on UPS so surge is out of the question. Assumed power unit failure. Checked it with the second monitor’s power. Both power units work. It is the display that just died. A bit disappointed with Acer quality.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2021
reviewBody: one with screen messed up and the other one with no power or a defective power cord. never another Acer
name: karen smith

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2017
reviewBody: I purchased two of these to act as spare monitors for a home office. While I wouldn't want one as my main display, they are very good for the value. They do wobble a bit, but I just set them close together to minimize that. They came with very similar color calibration and overall serve their purpose well.One complaint: they are slightly different heights. While the bases are fixed the same, one is a few millimeters higher than the other. Not a REAL issue, but bugs me. Now I need to find a way to prop one of them up.
reviewTitle: they are very good for the value
name: JAC151

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2019

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2020

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2021

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2019
reviewBody: Plugged it in to use as a second monitor and the picture was good enough that I haven't even thought about adjusting any of the settings.

name: Specfour

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2016
reviewBody: This monitor started off amazing. I couldn't have been happier with this purchase.6 months later from the date of my purchase, and anytime I play more than an hour or so of gaming, the monitor starts to turn off and on again on its own, as if it overheats or something. I have no idea what it is, but I narrowed it down to the monitor itself being the problem. I tested another monitor under the same exact conditions and no problems whatsoever. Then I tested the power cable of the monitor by replacing it with a similar one under the same voltage and similar amperage, and the same thing happened. The restarting gets really annoying when playing games, especially online ones.
reviewTitle: Started off really well. 6 months down the road, now restarts itself after 1+hours of gaming.
name: Henry Lau

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2018
reviewBody: Does not come with a Linux driver CD.Had to choose between using either DVI or HDMI, not both.Could not get it to interface with my 1 year old HD TV (my old monitor did).Has no web cam.On off button and other adjustments located under the front bottom edge.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2019
reviewBody: I love my new screen! Its bright wide, super thin and it came with a super sturdy base. I went from 1 screen to basically 3!

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2019

Now I'm going to have to sit on hold for who knows how long just to even see if they're going to honor their support policy.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2017

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2019

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021
reviewBody: This monitor takes VGA, however it lacks a port for an audio cable. The guide that comes with it claims that is has one, and when you look at the back you can see a space between the VGA and power ports where one ought to be. However, it is not there. I do not know if this is an issue with these monitors in general, or if I got an odd one out, but buyers should beware.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2018
reviewBody: Update - moving review to 2 Stars because replacement item doesn't work. They sent the wrong half of the power cord. Looks like the price to replace the cord will be half the price of the unit new.---------Purchased a year ago - power cord wires are exposed and were shooting sparks where they enter the black box -called to order a new one, and it took over 30 minutes and two phone calls to get the replacement ordered (cost is $32 for 2-day shipping)
reviewTitle: power cord frays, exposes wires that shoot sparks -  tech support slow

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2019

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021
reviewBody: It came a day early which was cool but it came broken. It doesn't power on at all. Really annoying.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
reviewBody: Need to let people know it takes a HDMI cable and a vga adapter to adapt to older computers. Had to make two trips looking for parts
name: Linda B.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2018
reviewBody: Monitor is excellent for the price:0. Beautiful monitor. Great colors, vibrant, well made. Low on features, but sometimes you just want a bare-bones beauty. Got mine on sale for ~$100. Great deal.However:1. It broke after almost exactly 1 year. So... not such a good deal after all.2. Service and support from Acer is pretty bad. Frustrating. Have to fill out the same information multiple times in multiple forms. You have to wait on them, but they can't wait on you. Very much puts you in your place. Shows you that the customer is not #1.3. Sending your monitor in to be fixed costs almost as much as just buying another cheap monitor.Would I do it again? Maybe--I think it is just bad luck that the electronics in my monitor spritzed out on me. I'm guessing it isn't a common thing. I certainly wouldn't buy an expensive monitor from them--not with their service/support.Edit: acer "repaired" monitor so now it doesn't work at all. Shipping costs paid by me. Changing from 5 stars to 1 star for ABYSMAL customer support.
reviewTitle: Beautiful Monitor, Broke at 1 year mark, Bad Service/Support, Good Luck
name: Patrick Darden

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2020
reviewBody: Love this monitor. I bought this to be used as a second monitor for my home office during the COVID crisis and am not disappointed. It’s everything I could ask for.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020

One other issue—it only comes with a VGA cable, no HDMI. This is 2020!

The picture is bright and fairly sharp, though obviously no 4K display. Overall, very satisfied with this monitor for its price.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2016
reviewBody: I have three of these monitors in surround. I am a pretty serious gamer and I wanted these monitors for the thin bezels and anti glare screen. All was good when I got them and set them up. Man do they look nice! The stand is pretty high quality and the screen in very thin. On first boot they were bright and decently colorful. Not as good as my old one, but for the price not bad. I soon noticed that the color was not the same on all monitors. one of them had slightly less bright whites, and one had whites with a slight tint of yellow. This was mostly fixed with some adjusting in the settings. So far these issues are easy to look over since they look so nice and nothing beats having three identical monitors. However they are not that great for the one reason I bought them for: Gaming. These monitors have SERIOUS image ghosting. If you don't know what this is, its when the pixels leave a shadow behinds moving images on the screen because they cant change color fast enough. This adds very noticeable white and black shadows in every game even the desktop. Coming from a higher quality (now discontinued monitor) these do not perform very well in that regard. The pixels are very slow. Even textures with little contrast get blurred when moving forward.Now I am giving 4 stars because of the price/performance. They do what they said and look nice. But if you are a serious gamer that is used to a nice responsive image look for a lower latency panel.
reviewTitle: Good looking but very bad image ghosting
name: Brian

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2016
reviewBody: Cons first: It says 1,000,000 to 1 Dynamic Contrast Ratio, which if you don't know by now, is a useless measurement, Dynamic Contrast Ratio refers to the screen mode that detects light and dark scenes in order to adjust the backlight to produce more "contrast". This feature is not even on by default, not that I would use it anyway. I suspect its true contrast ratio would be lower than the typical 1000:1, which is why it's omitted both here on Amazon and on the Acer website. Coming from glossy HP monitors, the colors just seem very washed out. Dark grays turn into medium grays, etc. That's partially due to its matte finish, but it's also partially due to it being a budget IPS display. I now have another professional matte display by Dell (U2515H) that has great contrast, comparable to my glossy HP displays (27xi). If you're going to buy an affordable IPS display, I would recommend going glossy, unless you are in a super high-glare environment. The new xw series by HP has semi-gloss displays, and in stores they look like they have decent colors while having relatively low glare. They may be worth checking out.The monitor also takes a long time to start up if you don't leave it on. It takes about 4 seconds. It shows an Acer logo and then an Energy Star logo before the picture comes through. Your computer wakes from sleep much faster than that.On the plus side, the 4ms refresh rate is pretty nice, and the bezel is about as thin as you can find (same as my new Dell). Besides the cons of picture quality, it works as you would expect, and although the circle stand isn't the most attractive option, it is made of a nice metal, and you can put snacks in the center.
reviewTitle: Why they hide the contrast ratio from you

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2016
reviewBody: Excellent value for money. I suspect this to be one of the best choices of monitors in the category. I am very satisfied with it's performance and have found no evidence of leaks around the perimeter (as a review I had read might have suggested). Picture image is absolutely steady and color and detail are vivid and sharp. The frame around the image is arguably the thinnest in its category. This is a big plus when it comes to long sessions of work. Also, it would be a plus when using multiple monitors. As I expected, there is a relatively wide viewing angle from any direction - so there is little need to adjust the stand constantly. Again, during long sessions of work I change my angle and height of viewing quite a bit, the wide viewing angle is much more comfortable in such cases. One small issue I have noticed while testing is that I would have preferred a height adjustment on the stand. My preferred viewing height would have been about an inch shorter than the fixed 4.5 inch height (bottom of image to desktop). Sometimes I have to place the monitor on a standard tabletop at work, which is particularly where this need becomes apparent. I thought of mentioning this only for the manufacturers, but it is not really a big problem since I am quite accustomed to it even at this time, three weeks after putting the monitor into use. Since I use this monitor with a new build, its generic drivers were installed by Windows during assembly. However, I replaced these with the Acer drivers. Regardless of how impressed I was with this monitor, I have to state that although I have been a computer builder and business user/enthusiast for many years, I have not been able to figure out how to use the physical buttons on the monitor to tweak its settings - I gave up and used the Windows Control Panel instead. The monitor comes well tuned and does not need much or any tweaking out of the box. Overall, I think most customers would be entirely satisfied with buy and I recommend it highly.

reviewBody: Got today. Works very well. I use it for both the Raspberry Pi and my Windows 10 PC which I mainly play games and run my XMRecorder software, with some picture editing. I am getting used to the small edge bezel but I like it.Cons:1. No wall mounting. I had planned to clear some desk space and mount this on the wall, as I have this monitor and my iMac on the same desk. There are no wall mounting holes on the back side.2. Uses weird external power supply. Most monitors now use the same three prong plug as computer power supplies. This monitor instead uses an external 19 volt power supply with a power transformer. I forsee this possibly causing an issue in the future, as these seem like the first thing to go.Even with the cons though, its a nice monitor. Warcraft looks great, Skyrim looks beautiful.

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2017
reviewBody: I bought this monitor because I foolishly purchased a gaming laptop with a screen that was too small. For $129, this monitor was a good purchase. It's thin enough to be unobtrusive in my living room, but increases the display area for my games enough that the gaming experience is greatly enhanced. I'm using the single HDMI output for connectivity, and the graphical detail is excellent. I haven't found the edge lighting to be as obtrusive as some reviewers have reported, perhaps because I don't play games in a very dark room, so that's a moot point for me.Setup was very simple and straight forward, taking less than five minutes from opening the box and assembling the components to having the monitor up and running. All you have to do is attach one bracket to the oval base and secure it to slots on the monitor. Completely painless and intuitive.Overall, I'm very happy with this monitor so far and would recomment it without hesitation. Haven't found any drawbacks yet.
reviewTitle: Affordable monitor that works well for gaming

name: Amazon Customer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2016
reviewBody: EXTREMELY thin bezel, bought 2 and set them next to each other, you can hardly tell there is a gap in between the pictures! Has all three types of connections (VGA, DVI, and HDMI), which a lot of monitors do not lately. Looks absolutely flawless when gaming or watching 1080p60 video on Youtube/Netflix/Prime. I noticed the smoothest picture seems to come via the HDMI connection, which makes sense. Sure, they aren't VESA compliant, but I wanted to use the included bases anyway. Easy to assemble the base, and its clean 'ring' shape is stylish and minimalist. A truly great buy for the price, and two of these side by side give me a 48" desktop for $260!! Arrived in two days thanks to Prime.I power these two monitors via a single EVGA GeForce 960 GTX 4GB SuperClocked, and in modern AAA games I'm seeing 40-60fps on Ultra settings, 60fps on High settings. This monitor's response time is said to be 5ms, whereas current gaming monitors are 1ms, but to be honest I don't feel there is enough stutter at Ultra to justify paying the 3X price premium for those.
reviewTitle: Awesome 24" monitor, especially used in pairs!
name: WichitaConsumer

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2016
reviewBody: PROS:* Cheap* Full HD* Entry Level Monitor* Small BevelCONS* Some Ghosting* Some Light BleedOVERVIEWThis is an awesome entry level monitor for people who wants to upgrade their PC on the cheap. There is some light bleed in the corners like what other reviews say, but you honestly have to look for it to see it. Ghosting is also present but you still need to look for it to see it, though in some situations it can get noticeable, like gaming.Overall this monitor is nice and works very well. But you get what you payed for.UPDATE!When playing around with the monitor settings, disabling "OD" (which seems to mean overdrive) completely reduces the ghosting effect to almost none! Just turn it off and have fun with your awesome monitor!
reviewTitle: You get what you pay for (UPDATE, a way to reduce ghosting)

postDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2015
reviewBody: At work, I buy hundreds of Acer monitors per year. This one turned out to be a dud. After a week of use, the screen started flashing on and off and wouldn't stay on for more than 10 seconds at a time. I sent it off for repair which took weeks, and when I got it back, there was a repair sheet stating that there was nothing wrong AND the screen was cracked across one corner. Pretty disappointed in Acer customer service on this one. Luckily, Amazon was able to help me out with their fantastic customer service.
reviewTitle: Pretty disappointed in Acer customer service on this one
name: Harvey Tucker
